loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda M. is from Bliss Baybay, Ozamiz City. She is 51 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Luzminda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as sugar, candies, salt, bar soap (laundry and bath), soap powder, coffee, noodles, rice, baby oil, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Luzminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 60,000 PHP from GDMPC. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her seventh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela M. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Estela owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Estela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Estela is requesting a new loan of 44,704 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 27th from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and spareparts for the motorcycle used in the business

loans.name: Jossie

texts.en:
Jossie E. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Jossie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fish to members of the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jossie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jossie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
Armie A. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Armie owns and operates a bakery, baking and selling bread in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Armie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Armie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Dim

texts.en:
Dim Y. is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She makes and sells cakes in front of the local school to earn a living and is able to make approximately US$2.50 of profit a day. Her husband is a mechanic fixing bicycles and motorbikes. On average, he makes US$5 a day. This couple has four children, two of whom are in school and the other two are farmers.

Dim Y. would like a loan of US$700 to purchase rice. She will remove the husks with the intention of reselling the de-husked rice and turning a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice which she will de-husk and sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia S. is from the village of Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, is married, and has ten adult children. Virginia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim P. is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She has five children, three of whom are in school and two are garment factory workers. Since 2007, she has been selling palm wine and meat in front of her house.

Yim P.’s husband, pictured here, is a mechanic who fixes motorbikes. On average, he makes US$5 of profit a day. Yim P. is asking for a loan of US$800 as her husband needs to purchase mechanic’s tools.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic's tools for her husband

loans.name: Juliana Aketch

texts.en:
Juliana Aketch O. is 38 years old, married to Charles Odemba, and they have four children who are all in school. Juliana’s first born son is called Marcus and he has just finished his primary education and will join high school this year. Juliana's husband has a hotel business, and they use the profits made from the business for family upkeep.

Due to the poor economy, it’s hard to rely on her husband’s business to cater to the family's needs, and that’s why Juliana ventured into a business of her own. She now has a food stall just outside where they live, and her customers mainly consist of those passing by on the street and the local cafes in that area. Juliana wants this loan so she can add stock to her business by buying more groceries like tomatoes, onions, vegetables, and other groceries. She hopes to diversify by adding cereals to sell in her food stall. Juliana has benefited from Kadet Ltd by accessing two previous loans, which she paid well and without any problems.

loans.use: Buy tomatoes, onions, other vegetables, and cereals to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok N., 49, is married and lives with nine of her children in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1 each day and are supported by five children working in garment factories and rice fields.

Sok N. would like to take out a loan of US$500; she plans to purchase rice which she will de-husk with the intention of reselling the de-husked rice and turning a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice which she will de-husk and sell

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam V. is 31 years old and she is the village bank president of this group which consists of twenty-two people located in Krang Pou village in Takeo province. The members will each use their loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sam V. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) field on which she cultivates rice. She now faces a problem because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she needs a loan 400,000 KHR from AMK to buy fertilizer.

Mrs. Sam V. is the mother of three children, two of whom are workers in a private company while the other is a student in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Phal Ngarn, is a farmer and is also a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support the family members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yart

texts.en: Yart S., 34, is married and lives with her five children. She works as a farmer in the Takeo province, typically earning US$1 each day, and is supported by her husband who works in house construction. On average, he makes US$2.50 a day. Three of the children are in school and one is a garment factory worker. Yart S. is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase rice and take off the husk, with the plan of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Joe Ann

texts.en:
Joe Ann B. is from the village of Poblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Joe Ann is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Joe Ann owns & operates a specialized retail store. The business's primary source of income is selling rice in the local community. Joe Ann has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 50000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Joe Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joe Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 100000 PHP from GDMPC. Joe Ann is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Joe Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

texts.en:
Ermelinda E. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Ermelinda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling coconut wine in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ermelinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ermelinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconut wine to make vinegar for her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Eliane

texts.fr: G. Eliane est née en 1972 au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a environs 37 ans que Eliane réside à Zogbo. Eliane est mariée à HOUNKPE Moïse un pêcheur, et est mère de six enfants. Le couple a quatre autres enfants à charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Eliane vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Eliane n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Eliane vend des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique (bols, plats, sceaux, etc.) de façon ambulante. Eliane vend également du pain, ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenu. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Eliane s'approvisionne. Eliane a déjà 8 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Eliane souhaite renforcer son capital et agrandir son activité, ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus d'épargne. Cependant, Eliane manque de moyens financiers pour y parvenir. C'est pourquoi Eliane sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Eliane was born in 1972 in the Zogbo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living in Zogbo for about 37 years. She is married to HOUNKPE Moïse, a fisherman, and is the mother of six children. Some of the children are in school. Eliane works in aid of her husband when it comes to family expenses, thanks to the revenues she brings in from her work. Eliane did not attend school. To cope with her different responsibilities, she goes door to door selling plastic kitchen utensils (bowls, plates, buckets, etc.) She also sells bread, which enables her to multiply her sources of revenue. Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she goes to stock up on supplies. She already has eight years of experience in this domain and is on her third loan with ALIDé. She would like to boost her capital and to expand her business. This will allow her to make more money. Yet, she lacks the financial means to do so. This is why Eliane is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying plates, bowls, plastic buckets, and some bread

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum S. is 40 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. This couple has four school-aged children. Prum is shown in the photo with her husband and her children.

Prum sells cakes and school materials at the local primary school. On average, she is able to make about US$5 of profit a day, Her husband is a mechanic who fixes motorbikes. He typically makes US$2 a day.

Prum is asking for a loan of US$600 as her husband needs to purchase mechanic’s tools.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic's tools for her husband

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Lolita owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling rice roll ("budbod") and rice cakes ("puto"). She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Chuong

texts.en:
Chuong N., 33, grows and sells vegetables at the local market of the Takeo province. She typically makes about $3 of profit every day. She is married and has two children living at home to support. Her husband is a rice farmer who typically makes $1 a day. 

Chuong N. would like to take out a loan of $700 that she needs to reinvest in her vegetable farm.

loans.use: Reinvest in her vegetable farm

loans.name: Tushike Mukono Katushabe Kobra Group

texts.en:
K. Kobra is a businesswoman of 36 years of age. She is married and blessed with four children, three of whom are going to school. She has two other dependents schooling too. 

She has a poultry business, which she has been carrying out for over 10 years. She is using the loan to purchase poultry drugs, feed and chicks to add on to and expand her poultry business. She is improving upon her business by purchasing quality feeds and good drugs for every stage of her poultry's lives. She is an active and promising businesswoman whose dream is to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase poultry drugs, feed and chicks to add on to and expand her poultry business

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
N. Grace is forty-five years old, is married, and is a businesswoman. She is blessed with four children of whom three are going to school and she has one dependent who is schooling, too.

Grace deals in produce such as cassava flour, maize flour, vegetables, and so forth. She is using the loan to purchase and stock at least four bags each of cassava and maize flour plus vegetables. She is adding capital to generate more profits.

Grace is a promising businesswoman whose dream is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase at least four bags each of cassava and maize flour plus vegetables

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan P. is 48 years old and she is the village bank president of this group that consists of eighteen people located in Krang Pou village in Takeo province. The members will each use their loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Chan P. is widow with two children both of whom are attending the local school.

Mrs. Chan P. is a farmer who owns 5-hectare (12.5-acre) field on which she cultivates rice, but she now faces some problems because her field has infertile soil and the water is far from the irrigation system. Thus, she decided to ask for the loan to buy fertilizer and to hire the laborer to plow her field. The rest of the loan she would use to pay for pumping water to her rice field.

Mrs. Chan P. hopes that the loan will help her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to hire the laborer to plow her field and to pay for pumping water to her rice field

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 61, is married and lives with four of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about $1 each day and are supported by four of their children who work in the garment factories. 

Leng S. would like to take out a loan of $800 she needs to purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living. 

Leng S. is pictured with her grandson.

loans.use: Purchase rice

loans.name: Leang Sai

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang Sai S. is 26 years old and lives in Prek Reang village in the Kandal province. Her husband, Mr. Thou Chhut, is a fisherman who can make a small income to support the family. 

In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Leang Sai S. needs 1,500,000 Cambodian Riels from AMK, a Kiva partner, to buy a cow for breeding. The rest of the loan she would use to support her family. 

Mrs. Leang Sai S. is the mother of a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Sarn

texts.en:
Sarn S., 31, sells dessert at the local market of the Takeo province. She typically makes about $2 of profit every day. She is married and has three children living at home to support. Her husband is a construction worker who typically makes $1 a day. 

Sarn S. would like to take out a loan of $1,000 that her husband needs to purchase construction tools.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Asaba Ahebwa Kyarisima Robina Group

texts.en:
K. Robina is a forty-two-year-old businesswoman. She is single and is blessed with three children, one of whom is going to school.

Robina deals in fresh foods and she has been running this business for over ten years. She is using the loan to purchase fresh foods such as cassava, sweet potatoes, etc., to sell. She is improving upon her business. She is an active and encouraging woman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase fresh foods such as cassava, sweet potatoes, etc., to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok M., 48, is a rice farmer who lives in Takeo province. She typically makes about US$2 a day. She is married and has five children living at home to support. Her husband is a fisherman. He catches fish and sells them at the local market. On average, he makes US$3 of profit every day.

Sok M. would like to make a new investment selling grocery items. To start this business, she would like to take out a loan of US$500. She believes this business chance will allow her to make more income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To open a grocery store

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en: Merriam P. is from the village of Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Merriam owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products. At the same time she owns a video karaoke machine where she collects payment per song from her customers. She has been engaged in her businesses for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Merriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merriam is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 16th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Kim San's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kim San K. is 39 years old. He is a village-bank president for a group loan consisting of 23 people located in Kandal Kraom village in the Kandal province. 

Mr. Kim San K. is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. On this farm, he now faces a problem because his field has infertile soil. He decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support it. Besides being a farmer, he is also a motorbike taxi driver who can make a little income to support his family. 

His wife, Mrs. Chan Thun, is a grocer in the local market. Mrs. Chan Thun is the mother of five childR., one of whom does housework while the other four are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Oishamo

texts.ru: Табарова Оишамо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Табарова Оишамо имеет собственную пекарню. Она печет и продает более 8 лет. Целью кредита является закуп муки и дров.
texts.en:
Oishamo T. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 45 years old, married and has 8 children. Oishamo owns a bakery. She has been baking and selling baked goods for over 8 years. The purpose of this loan is a purchase of flour and firewood.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and firewood

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie B. is from the village of Quezon, Valencia City. She is 34 years old. Elsie is single. To make a living, Elsie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: N. Christine vit depuis 20 ans au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ADJAGBE Michel un pêcheur, Christine est mère de trois enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Zogbo. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Depuis environs 20 ans, Christine vend des crevettes fumées au marché Gbogbanou, ce qui lui procure des revenus qu'elle utilise pour faire face à ses différentes charges. Christine s'approvisionne au bord de la lagune à Cotonou. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de ses clients, Christine n'arrive plus à satisfaire tous ses clients. Christine ambitionne augmenter le stock de ses produits pour mieux faire face à la demande des clients. C'est ce qui amène Christine à solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
N. Christine has been living for twenty years in the Zogbo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to ADJAGBE Michel, a fisherman, she is the mother of three children. All of the children are in school and live together with their parents in Zogbo. The couple jointly ensures that family expenses are covered. For about twenty years, Christine has been selling smoked shrimp at the Gbogbanou market, and this brings in the revenues she uses to cope with her different responsibilities. She supplies herself from the shores of the lagoon in Cotonou. She is a previous client of ALIDé having already benefited from two loans, which have been repaid. Facing the demand from more and more customers, she no longer manages to satisfy them all. Her ambition is to increase her stock of goods in order to cope better with customer demands. This is what brings Christine to request a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shrimp in bulk

loans.name: Hazel Jean

texts.en: Hazel Jean A. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 36 years old. Hazel Jean is married. To make a living, Hazel Jean runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Hazel Jean has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Hazel Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hazel Jean is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Hazel Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Savlatbi

texts.ru: Мирзоева Савлатби проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 39 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Мирзоева Савлатби имееет собственную пекарню. Она печет и продает в своей торговой точке. В этой области Мирзоева Савлатби работает 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа муки и дров.
texts.en:
Savlatbi M. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. Savlatbi owns a bakery. She bakes and sells baked goods at her retail outlet. Salvatbi has been working in this field for 10 years. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour and firewood.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and firewood

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun A. is 24 years old and she lives in Pongro village in Takeo province. She is the mother of a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband, Mr. Run Sart, is a duck breeder who is able to earn a small income to support his family by selling eggs. 

Mrs. Oeun A. is a farmer who owns 5-hectare (12.5-acre) field on which she cultivates rice. In this plantation she has obstacles because the field has infertile soil and not enough water to support it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed plus a water pump to support her plants.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and a water pump

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle B. is from the village of Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old and is single. Michelle owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Michelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Saruon

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroun T. lives in Chong Kong Kor village in Takeo province. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other is a construction worker.

Mrs. Saroun T. is a farmer who owns a piece of land she uses to grow vegetables. In this plantation, she now faces some problems because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and fuel. The rest of the loan she would use to buy poles to cultivate beans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, fuel and bean poles

loans.name: Glenny

texts.en: Glenny D. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 34 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Glenny owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Glenny joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Glenny is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita G. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 52 years old. Juanita is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Juanita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Juanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice W. M. is thirty two years old, married to a business man and has a one year old child. Her business is located at Gikomba in Narobi where for the past year she has engaged in making and selling ladies suits. She sells her products to wholesalers and retailers and she is actually using her loan to buy rolls of cloth to make more suits to grow her business.

Her major challenge is that many people in Gikomba market engage in this kind of business and thus customers are spoilt for choice. However, she does not give up and she works very hard and even hopes that, in future, she will own property that will bring more income to her.  She is humble and self motivated. She is an enterpreneur and has created employment for other people.

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, age 8, attends a local primary school while her son, age 3, hasn't reached school age yet.

Battsetseg and her husband work together in their retail vegetable business, which they began in 2003, in one of the largest black markets in the city. Her husband drives to nearby provinces and purchases vegetables at wholesale prices, then transports the goods back to the city where Battsetseg sells them for a profit. Since beginning her business 7 years ago, she has experienced steady growth and her working capital currently exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs (approx. 690 USD). Her daily sales are around 200,000 tugrugs (approx. 138 USD) and her average monthly profit is 350,000 tugrugs (approx. 242 USD). She is working to expand her business in the near future and is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan (approx. 1,035 USD) in order to purchase a large amount of vegetables so that she can store them in her cellar until prices increase in the spring when she can sell them for a larger profit.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of vegetables to store and sell later on

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ali has been working at furniture repair for almost ten years now. He also sells furniture, but it is usually used furniture that he repairs and then sells later on.

Ali decided on doing his business because he learned it when he was young and gained lots of experience. He also said that he is creative and always follows furniture fashions, that’s what makes him special. When he first started his business, he had to face some financial issues since the price of the thread and machines is expensive.

Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new thread and repair one of his sewing machines for his work. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. His clients can be anyone from his region. He also has attractive and competitive prices because he wants to keep on increasing his networking and grow his client base.

loans.use: To purchase new thread and repair one of his sewing machines for his work

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Mr. Chhoeun I is 31 years old and he lives in Trapeang Kak village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice on. Although he tries to work hard with his field, he still cannot support the family. Thus, he wants to start a new business to improve more than before. So, Mr. Chhoeun I decided to ask for the loan amount of 2,000,000R to buy ducklings for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Thet Chim is grocer who can earn a little income to help support her family. Mrs. Thet Chim is a mother of two children one of whom is a student in the local school; the other is too young to study or work. Mrs. Thet Chim is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy ducklings

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 42-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Mohamad has been working as a taxi driver since the year 2000. When he first started his business, he had to face competition since in the region where he works, there are a lot of other taxi drivers.

Mohamad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and also because of his punctuality. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles N. M. is a young man aged twenty four years old who is not married yet. He does not have any children. He spends most of his time taking care of his electronics business which is located at Gikomba in Nairobi. He has had this business for the past five years.

He is using his loan to buy more chargers, water heaters, iron boxes and padlocks to grow his business and, in the future, even open another shop in Nairobi town. Despite many people doing the same business as his, he actually sees himself working hard and becoming a millionaire. He is a very social man.

loans.use: To buy chargers, water heaters, iron boxes and padlocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying groceries

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 35-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ibrahim has owned a butcher shop for over fifteen years. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues due to the cost of his machines, the rent, and other expenses related to his shop, but he always did his best to manage and not to have debts.

He decided on opening his shop because he realized that there wasn’t a butcher shop in his region and that people had to go a bit far from their home to purchase their meat. Ibrahim is special in his work because he is known for his good quality meat. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase cows for his business. This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan.

His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase cows for his business.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is a 47-year-old widow who lives with her 5 children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. Her two oldest sons, 28 and 25, help her to operate a family construction business; her daughter, 21, attends university, and her two youngest sons, 17 and 14, both attend a local high school. While her children were all growing up, she taught them how to make boots and also how to build houses.

Since 1998, she and her children have made boots which they sell in Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. During the warmer months, she and her oldest sons build houses. During the last three years, she and her sons have built eleven two-storey houses in Zuunmod, the capital city of Tuv province, and they have already received two orders for houses this upcoming summer. Because of her and her children's success, they were able to build their own two-storey home and are quite comfortable and happy in it.

Bayarmaa is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (approx. 1380 USD) loan in order to furnish the second storey of her home so that her family can be more comfortable and in order to purchase more boot-making supplies.

loans.use: to purchase more boot-making supplies

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en:
Ganhuyag is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two teenage children in the Arhangai province of central Mongolia. He and his family currently live in a rented house. His daughter, age 19, attends a vocational training center and his son, age 15, attends a local high school while his wife helps Ganhuyag with his boot-repair business.

Ganhuyag began his business in 2006 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (approx. 69 USD) and as a result of his hard work and good customer service, his working capital now exceeds 510,000 tugrugs (approx. 352 USD). He is working hard in order to one day own his own house and workshop and buy new work equipment. He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrugs (approx. 690 USD) in order to purchase some necessary tools and supplies for his boot-repair business.

loans.use: to purchase some necessary tools and supplies for his boot repair

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 38-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Haidar has been working as a home painter since 1998. He paints and decorates houses, as well as doing paintings. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties except making himself known by the public.

Haidar decided on doing his business because he likes painting and decorating, and is good at it. He is special in his work because he does it well and is aware of new painting and decoration fashions; he does his best to have the newest tools in order to improve his performance. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase paint and painting tools for his work.

This is the first time that Haidar has requested a loan. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business. (To have an idea of his work, you can simply look at the frame behind him; he is the one who realized it.)

loans.use: To purchase paint and painting tools for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy grocery products

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Som T. is 35 years old, and she is the village bank president for a group that consists of 17 people located in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Yon Kin, are farmers who own a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice on. They now face a problem because their field does not have enough water to support their crops. Thus, Mrs. Som T. needs the loan amount of 400,000 Riel from AMK to buy gasoline to run her pump. Mrs. Som T. is the mother of two children who both are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy gasoline

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles N. W. is twenty seven years old, married and does not have any children. His business is located at Gikomba, a very busy market in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. He has been selling cereals to the people of Nairobi for the last five years. He has to work really hard to make profits as there are many other people who engage in the same kind of business as his and so customers are spoilt for choice.

He is using his loan to buy more cereals to expand his business and he wants his business to grow to a point where he will be able to supply in wholesale. He has a dream to start another business for his family. He is a very hardworking man and he wants to own land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy beans, peas and black beans

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: S. Charlotte est née en 1983 au quartier Sainte Cécile à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il a 15 ans environs que Charlotte s'est installée au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou. Mariée à AGBOHO Gilles, Charlotte est mère de quatre enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Zogbo. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de leurs enfants. L'activité de Charlotte lui génère des revenus et lui permet de faire face un temps soit peu aux différentes charges de la famille. Charlotte n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de cinq ans que Charlotte vend de façon ambulante, des ustensiles de cuisine (assiettes, glacières, bols en séries). Charlotte vend également des chaussures, ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenus. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Charlotte s'approvisionne. Charlotte a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Charlotte souhaite étendre son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. Cependant, Charlotte manque de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C'est pourquoi Charlotte sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Charlotte S. was born in 1983 in the Sainte Cécile district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Charlotte has been settled in the Zogbo district of Cotonou for around 15 years. Married to Gilles AGBOHO, Charlotte has four children. All the children are at school and live with their parents in Zogbo. The couple has another child in their care, as well as their own children. Charlotte's business brings in an income and allows her to help out a little with the family's various expenses. Charlotte has not been to school. For around five years Charlotte has been selling kitchenware (plates, iceboxes, sets of bowls). Charlotte also sells shoes, which allows her to multiply her sources of income. She stocks up at Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Charlotte has already had two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been repaid without problem. She would like to expand her activity and better satisfy customer demand. However Charlotte lacks the financial means to do this and it is for this reason that she is asking for a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchenware (plates, iceboxes, sets of bowls)

loans.name: Mina

texts.fr: Mina F. est une femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse d’éponges, elle a fait plusieurs années d’expérience dans le domaine, elle réalise beaucoup de bénéfices et avec le prêt de kiva, elle voudrait se ravitailler beaucoup en vue de pouvoir satisfaire la clientèle. Avec les bénéfices obtenus, elle aimerait aider son mari dans ces tâches de responsabilité. Dans l’avenir elle aimerait être une grossiste.
texts.en:
Mina F. is a 42-year-old woman, married and mother of one child. She retails sponges, and has several years experience in the business. Her income is quite good, and with Kiva’s loan she wants to acquire a large quantity of supplies to meet customer demands. With her earnings she wants to help her husband manage his responsibilities. In the future, she would like to become a wholesaler.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sponges for retail

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma A. is thirty-six years old, married and has four children between the ages of fifteen and four years old. Her husband is a driver. They hope to give their children a good education. 

Fatuma's business is located at Mariakani, a busy residential area in Mombasa. Mombasa is the coastal city of Kenya and it's known for its tourist attractions because of its rich history and game parks, as well as the Indian ocean. She engages in selling chicken meat to the local people and restaurants, something she has enjoyed doing for the last two years. 

She is using her loan to buy more chickens to expand her business and meet her customers' needs despite the stiff competition and seasonal oversupply. She hopes to own rental houses in the future and improve her standard of living. She is a very sociable and customer-friendly person.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work in his farm and to look after his cattle. Abdurahmon wishes to expand his business by purchasing young cattle and fodder for them. That is the reason that he is asking for a loan. He will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his request.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Additional head of cattle and feed

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
Furkat has always distinguished himself as being a very hard working person and devoted to his family, who are his role models. Ever since he was young, his parents taught him about honest work and responsibility, virtues that he has adopted for himself. Furkat manages his own business, a grocery store. He started it 3 years ago after the mechanic\'s shop where he worked closed down, when he found himself needing his own way to support his family. 

Thanks to his business, Furkat has been able to help his family. Today he requests a loan in the amount of $2600 USD. He needs you and through your generosity you can help him expand his business so that he may continue to support his children's education. Please help them by becoming part of the development of his small business. Furkat will sincerely thank you.

In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. loans.use: Expand store inventory

loans.name: Mukimjon

texts.en:
K. Mukimjon is 39 years old. He buys and sells cattle from different market places and has been in the business for the last 12 years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. He is requesting a fourth loan after successfully repaying the third one. With the previous loans, Mukimjon has been able to increase on the number of head that he trades. 

Mukimjon is married and a father of three children. With the loan from Kiva, he plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He plans to see his children go through higher education and be able to get good jobs unlike himself.

loans.use: To buy more head of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy general grocery products

loans.name: Yusupkhon

texts.en:
M. Yusupkhon is 46 years old, married and has 6 children. For three years Yusupkhon has been providing welding services. During the cold seasons he takes orders for making small stoves, and also sells them at the market due to high demand. 

Now it is the beginning of the cold season and many people are coming to Yusupkhon to order small stoves. Since during the winter in Tajikistan the supply of electricity and gas are limited, small stoves are in great demand during that period. Now Yusupkhon has applied for a loan to fully meet the demand of his customers. He is asking for a loan of $800 US to purchase materials for making small stoves. With your help, Yusupkhon will be able to make his business succeed and to provide all of his children with an education. Your generosity can change their lives.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Raw materials for metal stove fabrication

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20211020036) is a 39 year old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội nhóm 07 (7).

H. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  H. owns & operates a handicraft business.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling bamboo handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month (about $162 US) from these activities.

H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  This loan will be the first loan H. has taken out from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20211020037) is a 37 year old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20211020038) is a 55 year old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20211020039) is a 36 year old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20211020040) is a 37 year old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

5.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20211020041) is a 34 year old woman who is requesting a 3,360,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

6.  Nguyễn Thị Nhị (20211020042) is a 43 year old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

H. Nguyễn Thị (20211020036) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm H. trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngô Nội nhóm 07 (7).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hàng mỹ nghệ bằng tre cho du khách và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã H. trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

3.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20211020039) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20211020040) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.

5.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20211020041) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.

6.  Nguyễn Thị Nhị (20211020042) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Mahmanain

texts.en:
For the past 11 years, N. Mahmanain has run her own clothing business at the clothing market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She and her husband have four children and her business is an important source of income for the family. Mahmanain's income helps her to support her children with food and education.
Lending services from Kiva partner, IMON International, have been a key support for Mahmanain as she has developed her business. She has proven to be a great client and has maintained a perfect payment record. Mahmanain is requesting a loan of 8000 TJS to boost her available capital and allow her to purchase new inventory. We are grateful for the opportunity to further assist in the success of this dedicated entrepreneur.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Oumar

texts.en:
Mr. Oumar Kassé, though only 27, has worked in barber shops for almost 15 years. As a student, he worked part-time at his father's shop and, after leaving school at age 17, he began working full time. Mr. Kassé says he enjoys the daily interactions with his customers, but notes that he has a lot of competition as his shop is in the busy Grand Thies market, where there are many barber shops.
Mr. Kassé will use his loan for a personal use: renovating his bedroom in his family's small house. He says the roof leaks and there are a number of other small problems which, with this loan, he can finally fix. Oumar does not yet have a family of his own, but supports his mother and sisters. He will pay back the loan with the revenue from his barber shop.

loans.use: To repair and renovate his bedroom

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is single. His family lives in Dushanbe where he sells assorted blankets, towels, tablecloths, shawls and many other textiles in the central city market. His business is characterized by a good selection of merchandise and affordable prices. Juma has been in this business for four years. One of his dreams is to purchase a private house and make his own family. He believes that persistent work and higher sales would help him generate enough profit and put aside enough savings to make this dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: T. Marie est née en 1974 et vit au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marie est mariée à AVOCEVOU Noel, un tailleur. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Zogbo. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Marie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Marie vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs et riz, accompagné de différentes sauces) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et au marché de Fifadji que Marie s'approvisionne. Marie a obtenu autrefois deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. La clientèle de Marie s'accroit de jour en jour. Mais actuellement Marie éprouve de difficultés dans l'approvisionnement de ses produits. C'est la raison pour laquelle Marie sollicite un troisième prêt afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et aussi d'élargir son champ d'activité.
texts.en:
T. Marie was born in 1974 and lives in the Zogbo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Marie is married to AVOCEVOU Noel, who is a tailor. The couple has 4 children, some of whom are enrolled in school. All the children live together with their parents in Zogbo. The couple share in supporting the family.

Marie was never enrolled in school. To support herself, Marie sells cooked food (maize and rice porridge with various sauces) out of her home. She buys her ingredients in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin, and in Fifadji market. Marie has already received and correctly reimbursed two loans from ALIDé. Her clientele is continually growing but she currently has difficulty procuring her ingredients. That is why she is requesting a third loan so that she can satisfy the needs of her clientele and also expand her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

T. Ngô Thị (20209050051) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, SEDA. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt 3 - Nhóm 03 (3).
T. is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.
In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,256,000 VND from SEDA. This loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. loans.name: Ngô

texts.en: C. Ngô Thị is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, C. raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. C. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 Vietnamese Dong a month from these activities. In 2008, C. joined SEDA, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. C. is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan she has taken out from SEDA. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her extended family. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. C. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh hỗ trợ tài chính cho các thành viên trong gia đình mở rộng của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm C. phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Vũ's Group

texts.en: Kỷ Vũ V. is a 50-year-old man living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Kỷ is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Giữa 1 - Nhóm 03 (3). Kỷ is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Kỷ operates a store, selling animal feed and farm-related products in the local community. Kỷ has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 Vietnamese Dong a month from these activities. In 2008, Kỷ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kỷ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. He is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Kỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Phan Thị Lý is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food. 2. Nguyễn Thị Cừ is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.704.000 VND loan to support her business of providing recycling services. 3. Nguyễn Thị H. is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 4. Tô Thị L. is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business of operating a specialized retail store. 5. Dương Thị T. is a 58-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business of operating a specialized retail store. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Kỷ Vũ V. (20213040001) là 50 tuổi nam. Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Kỷ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cầu Giữa 1 - Nhóm 03 (3). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm thức ăn gia súc & có liên quan đến nông trại trong cộng đồng địa phương. Kỷ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Kỷ kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, Kỷ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Kỷ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Phan Thị Lý (20213040005) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. Nguyễn Thị Cừ (20213040003) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.704.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. 3. Nguyễn Thị H. (20213040010) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Tô Thị L. (20213040004) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 5. Dương Thị T.
