(20213040007) là 58 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda N., âgée de 32 ans est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois KIR-DIOM depuis 2 ans et y a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Avec son prêt elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Elle achète des bœufs les déparasite avec des produits vétos, les engraisse et les revend au bout de 4 ou 5 mois. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Aïda N., 32, is married and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank KIR-DIOM for two years and has received 4 loans which she managed well and reimbursed. With her loan she wants to fatten cattle. She buys cows, rids them of parasites with veterinary products, fattens them, and resells them after 4 or 5 months. Her goal is to help support her family and be able to put aside more in savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Rumama

texts.en:
Rumama R. is currently in the business of selling sorghum in the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more  bags of sorghum to sell. 

Rumama is 25 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase foodstuffs for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are all delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more  bags of sorghum to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja dando clases de oratoria pero este ingreso es mínimo por lo tanto se dedico también a la venta de chompas.
El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y no perder la clientela que ganó y poder mantener su negocio estable.

Es cliente de Impro y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own house in the Sopocachi zone in the city of La Paz with her husband and children. She works providing speech classes but the income from them is minimal, so she also sells sweaters. The loan that she is requesting is to increase her capital, not lose the customers that she gained, and to be able to keep her business stable.

She is an Impro client and has a very good loan repayment history. This has allowed her to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more sweaters for her business

loans.name: Kikonya C Birungi Aisha Group

texts.en: B. Aisha is twenty-three years old and married, with two children, of whom one is going to school. She owns a grocery, and she has been in business for two years so far. She is using the loan to purchase grocery items, such as beans, flour, charcoal, ground nuts, and so forth. She is adding capital, stocking enough in her grocery store for sale. She is an active and encouraging business lady. Her dream is to purchase a motorcycle for transportation to generate daily income.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items such as beans, flour, charcoal, ground nuts, and so forth

loans.name: Kikonya A Atugonza Robinah Group

texts.en: A. Robinah is a hardworking businesswoman, thirty-five years old and married with five children, of whom three children are going to school. She has dealt with a grocery business since the year 2008. She is using the loan to purchase her grocery store items, such as charcoal, flour, and tomatoes. She is adding to her capital to improve her business for much better profits. Her future hope is to see some changes in her life, improving upon her lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase her grocery store items, such as charcoal, flour, and tomatoes

loans.name: Kikonya A Karungi Monica Group

texts.en: K. Monica is thirty-three years old, representing her small group, single, and blessed with three children going to school. She has been operating a chapatti business for over five years. She is using the loan to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, charcoal, and so forth for making chapattis for sale. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, charcoal, and so forth for making chapattis for sale

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana H. is currently in the business of selling various types of foodstuffs in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs and crates of sodas to sell. Diana is 19 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. 

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs and crates of sodas to sell

loans.name: Asaba Ahebwa Kyalisima Sophi Group

texts.en: Sophi K. is a 28-year-old, single business lady with three children. Two of her children are going to school. She deals in a grocery-store business, which she has been operating for almost two years. She is using the loan to purchase grocery items such as flour, tomatoes and vegetables for sale. Her hope is to try hard to change her standard of living and, more so, she dreams of building a house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items such as flour, tomatoes and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria vive en anticrético en  la  zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en la Policía Nacional como cocinera del comando general, y percibe sueldo mensual. El crédito que solicita es para compra de insumos para su negocio de venta de comida y poder aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es el primer crédito en IMPRO, y el análisis socio-económico indica que Maria es capaz de repagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Maria lives in an anticrético (a special rental arrangement available in Bolivia) in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. She works for the National Police as a cook for the general command and receives a monthly salary. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of goods for her food sales business, and to be able to increase her income to improve her quality of life.

This is her first loan with IMPRO and the socio-economic analysis completed indicates that Maria is capable of repaying the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods (potatoes, rice, meat, etc.) for her food sales business.

loans.name: Kikonya B Kimuli Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty K. is a businesswoman of 30. She is married with five children, three of whom are going to school. She has had a retail shop business for four years so far. 

She is using the loan to add capital into her business, as in purchasing retail items such as soap, groundnuts, paraffin, salt, flour, sugar, matchboxes and so forth. She is a creative businesswoman whose future hope is to prosper in whatever she does.

loans.use: Purchasing retail items such as soap, groundnuts, paraffin, salt, flour, sugar, matchboxes and so forth

loans.name: Kikonya B Kabahwezi Margaret Group

texts.en:
K. Margaret is forty years old and is a married businesswoman blessed with thirteen children of whom seven are going to school.

Margaret has carried out a charcoal business and a business dealing in garden tools for over three years now. Due to the lack of capital, she is using the loan to add capital to her business as in purchasing things like charcoal and garden tools (hoes, pangs, slashes, axes, and so forth) to satisfy her customers' demands.

Margaret is a promising businesswoman whose dream is to prosper and be able to afford whatever she needs.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and garden tools

loans.name: Kikonya C Nakayuwa Juliet Group

texts.en: Juliet N. is a hardworking businesswoman aged twenty-one years old. She is married with four children; two of whom go to school. For over four years, she has had a grocery business. To increase her capital, she has been adding stock to her business by purchasing grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, beans, vegetables, pineapples, etc. to sell. She is encouraging and active and her future plans include purchasing a motorcycle to generate income through transport and a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Djibil

texts.en:
Mr. Djibil F., age 30, is a new client of U-IMCEC in Thies, a city about 50 miles from sprawling Dakar. 

Djibil earned his diploma as an electrician in 1999, inspired by a long interest in all things electrical. However, he has found it difficult to find steady employment, so he supplements his income by raising chickens. Chickens can be a profitable activity, because each one can fetch as much as $6.00 in the markets. Djibil's older sister taught him the trade, and he has been raising chickens for about a year. 

With this loan of 300,000 frs (Communaute Financiere Africaine francs, also known as "XOF"), he will purchase 200 chicks and about a dozen 50-kg (~110 lb.) sacks of feed. He works closely with a local veterinarian, helping him to make sure the flock stays healthy. After 6 weeks, the chicks will be fully grown chickens that are ready for sale. 

Djibil says he will save the proceeds to pay for his upcoming wedding – an expensive affair!

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Dedeha

texts.en:
Dedeha L. is in the business of selling cassava and onions in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of sugar to sell.  Dedeha is 46 years-old and married with a husband who is a lawyer.  With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a big plot of land and build a house for her family.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar.

loans.name: Kirima United Atugonza Constance Group

texts.en: A. Constance is twenty-five years-old, unmarried and a hardworking businesswoman. She is blessed with one child. For the last five years, she has owned a retail shop. Due to inadequate capital and lack of stock in her shop, she is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, soap, salt, flour, paraffin, etc. for sale. She is very hardworking and active and dreams of building a house.

loans.use: To purchase retail items for sale.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Yacine Cissé est une femme de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PAR-C. depuis 2 ans et a 4 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et parallèlement elle vend des denrées alimentaires telles que du riz, du sucre, de l'huile etc. Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes et de contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yacine Cissé is a 35-year old woman who is married with five children. She has been a member of the village bank in PAR-C. for two years and has had four loans. She fattens beef and at the same time sells foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, oil etc. Her aim is to boost her savings and help to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline J. is currently in the business of selling beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to pruchase crates of beer and sodas to sell.  Jackline is 26 years-old and is married with a husband who is a policeman.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Alvaro Jose

texts.es: Alvaro de 42 años de edad habitante de  colonia los Laureles ubicada a 33 km de Nueva guinea, solicita su segundo credito a la isntitucion de AFODENIC, para utilizarlo en retencion de terneros, piensa que con este financiamiento sus animales puedan alcanzar tamaño y peso generando mayor ganancia en su comercializacion, su parcela es de 25mzs en la que realiza cuido de su pequeño hato y cultivos agricolas, su familia la conforma su coyuge y 4 hijos todos mayores de 12 años 2 de ellos estudia educacion secundaria y dos educacion primaria sus hijps le apoyan en los quehaceres de la parcela y su esposa en las actividades del hogar, es un hombre de buenas costumbres, humilde , responsable con muchos deseos de superacion tanto en la educacion de su familia, como tambien en el margen economico, su sueño es responder a la institucion asumiendo su compromiso debidamente como lo estipulan las normas de credito en esta microfinanciera.
texts.en:
Alvaro is 42 years old and lives in the Los Laureles development, located 33km from Nueva Guinea. This is his second loan with AFODENIC, and he will use it for calf retention. He believes that with this funding, his animals will be able to achieve the size and weight needed to generate better sales earnings. His piece of land is 25 manzanas (1 ‘manzana’ is equal to approximately 1.7 acres of land), and he uses it to care for his small herd as well as crops. His family consists of his wife and their four children, all of which are more than 12 years old. Two of them are in high school, and two are in primary school. His children help him with the chores on the land and they help his wife with the household chores. He is a well-mannered, humble, responsible man with many wishes of overcoming his family’s education as well as the economic limits. His dream is to duly meet his commitment to AFODENIC, as stipulated in the loan regulations for the microfinance institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Calf retention

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is currently in the business of selling bread in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour, milk, sugar, etc. to make more bread to sell.  Rose is 28 years-old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients.

loans.name: Luis Eugenio

texts.es: Don Luis de 60 años de edad es habitante de la colonia San Jose, esta solicitandole a la institucion de AFODENIC su primer credito, el que usara para retencion de deternero, el objetivo de este productor es que esta financiera le otorgue este financiamiento de manera que sus animales puedan crecer y ganar mas peso generandole rentabilidad cuando sea su comercializacion y poder solventar necesidades en la economia familiar, posee una finca de 120mzs donde realiza sus actividades pecuarias y agricolas, sus hijos y su esposa colaboran en las actividades de su unidad de produccion siendo la misma  una fuente de empleo para mejorar las condiciones economicas a nivel familiar, Don Luis en la colonia donde el habita lo consideran como  hombre responsable, trabajador, productor humilde y con muchos deseos de superacion, su mayor anhelo es quedar bien con la institucion para seguir trabajando con apoyo de la misma.
texts.en:
Don Luis is 60 and lives in the town of San Jose. He is requesting his first loan from Afodenic, which he will use to raise calves. His objective is to receive this loan so his animals can grow to a heavier weight which will generate more profit for him when he sells them. He will be able to resolve his family's economic problems. He has a farm with 120 manzanas [about 200 acres] of land where he raises livestock and practices agriculture. His children and wife help him with these activities since it is the only source of work they have to improve their family's economic conditions. People in the town where he lives consider him to be a very responsible, hard-working, and humble man with many wishes of getting ahead. His biggest dream is to be seen favorably by Afodenic so he can keep receiving its support.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise calves

loans.name: Marvin Calixto

texts.es: Marvin de 32 años de edad, habitante  de comunidad el Zapote, ubicada a 37 km de Nueva Guinea, su familia esta conformada por su esposa y 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudiantes de educacion  secundaria y el menor estudiante de primaria, pertenece a la religion catolica, en las actividades laborales de su finca trabajan en sociedad apoyandose mutuamente, el esta solicitando su primer credito a la institucion de AFODENIC,  el objetivo de  este productor es que esta  financiera le apoye con el monto solicitado para utilizarlo en retencion de ternero y asi esperar que alcancen mayor tamaño y poder obtener mejor precio en los mismos, y que de manera que su venta sea mas rentable, Marvin es un señor  responsable, honesto, trabajador, humilde, su sueño es pagar en tiempo y forma para que esta microfinanciera le siga brindando servicio de credito cuando lo necesite y de esta manera contar con recursos economicos para el sosten familiar.
texts.en:
Marvin is 32 years-old, and lives in the Zapote community (located 37km from Nueva Guinea) with his wife and three children. Two of the children are in secondary school, while the other is still in primary school. He belongs to the Catholic religion and works on his farmland (in a mutually supportive environment) with other members of his community. He is requesting his first loan form AFODENIC so he can continue to raise his calves and ultimately sell them for a higher price. Marvin is responsible, honest, hard-working, humble, and he plans to repay this loan in a timely manner. As a result, he hopes to be able to request additional loans from this microfinance institution, which will provide him the financial resources to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise his livestock (calves)

loans.name: Agomyo

texts.en:
Agomyo E. is currently in the business of selling local alcoholic beverages at home and is requesting a loan to stock more materials to use.  Agomyo is 27 years old, married, and has 3 children who all go to school.  Her husband is a policeman. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: For store inventory

loans.name: Robespierre

texts.es: Robespierre habitante del casco urbano del municipio el Coral, tiene un año de laborar como responsable de Recursos Humanos de la Alcaldia del Coral, es un profesional que ama su familia y ha luchado para salir adelante ya son una familia muy unida, es un profesional que tiene muchos deseos de superacion personal, esta solicitando su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su casa de habitación  construyendo un porche con verjas, así poder tener más seguridad en su vivienda y vivir en mejores condiciones,    se considera como una persona honesta y responsable con capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Robespierre is from the urban hood of the Coral municipality. He has worked for a year as the person in charge of Human Resources at Alcaldia del Coral. He is a professional who loves his family and strives to progress forward as they are a very united family. He is a professional who has a great desire to overcome personal obstacles. He is seeking his first loan from the institution AFODENIC to invest in the improvement of his house, constructing a porch with wrought-iron gates - giving him more security in his house and live in better conditions. He is considered an honest person and responsible for the repayment capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a porch

loans.name: Sista

texts.es: Sista  de 46 años de edad habitante de colonia karinwas, esta solicitando refinanciamiento de credito a la institucion de AFODENIC, para ser invertido en su pulperia en esa misma colonia, con el objetivo de aumentar su inventario de pequeño negocio, y asi sastifacer la demanda de su clientela. Doña sista trabaja en conjunto con sus hijas y su esposo atendiendo la parte de la venta de forma colectiva, ella se ha caracterizado por ser una buena clienta de esta financiera, su sueño es incrementar y diversificar los productos en su negocio de modo que sirva para aumentar las ganancias economicas y mejorar los niveles de vida en la familia, en su comunidad la consideran como una persona honrada, responsable, progresista, trabajadora y con buenos pricipios cristianos.
texts.en:
Sista is 46 years old and lives in the Karinwas district. She is seeking to refinance her loan from the institution AFODENIC. The loan will be invested in her local store in the same district where she lives, with the objective of expanding the inventory of her small business, and in this way satisfying her customers' demands. Doña Sista works together with her daughters and husband, attending to the sales collectively. She is known as a good customer of the financial institution. Her dream is to increase and diversify the products in her business and in this way increase her economic earnings and improve the living standards of her family. In her community she is considered an honorable person, responsible, progressive, hard working and with good Christian principles.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for grocery store

loans.name: Vicente Azael

texts.es: Vicente Azael de comunidad el Granadino Municipio el Coral, tiene un año de laborar para la  alcaldia del coral, es un hombre que le gusta superarse y ayudar a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos economicos, solicita su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC,  el que será invertido en mejoras de su vivienda, necesita ampliar su casa y así gozar de mejores condiciones de vida en su hogar en conjunto con la familia. don Vicente es un hombre trabajador en sus dias libre trabaja en la finca cuidando su ganado, también tiene buenas referencias personales de los vecinos de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Vicente Azael from the community of the Granadino Municipio el Coral has worked for the mayor's office for one year. He is a man who likes to improve himself and help his family, as they have limited economic resources. He is seeking his first loan from AFODENIC, which will be invested in home improvements. He needs to improve his house and in this way enjoy better living conditions in his home, together with his family. Don Vincente is a hard-working man and on his free days he works on his farm, looking after his livestock. He also has good personal references from his neighbours in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo habita en la comunidad La Garza el Coral,  trabaja como consejal de la Alcaldia del Coral desde hace un año, tiene 4 hijos: dos mayores de edad y dos que tiene a cargo, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de los niños, solicita su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejoras de su vivienda, necesita hacer cambio de zinc y hacer un anexo permitiendo de esta manera tener mejores comodidades en su casa de habitación y mejor comodidad para su linda familia, su sueño es que sus hijos estudien para que sean personas de bien, don Wilfredo es un un hombre responsable y muy querido en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Wilfredo lives in the community La Garza el Coral. He has worked as a town councillor of la Alcaldia del Coral for one year. He has 4 children: 2 older ones and 2 in his care. His wife takes charge of the housework and care of the children. He is seeking his first loan from AFODENIC to invest in home improvements. He needs to change the zinc and make an annexe, in this way permitting better comfort in his house and better comfort for his beautiful family. His dream is that his children study to that they can have a good life. Don Wilfredo is a responsible man and much loved in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the roof and construct an annexe

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Don Segundo  tiene un año de laborar como consejal de la Alcaldia El Coral Chontales habitante del casco urbano el Coral, tiene tres hijos todos menores de edad los cuales los tiene estudiando su primaria, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de los niños,  solicita su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, para ser invertido en aumento de su galera para realizar el ordeño de manera mas higiénica y brindar un cuido mas adecuado a su ganado bovino, el desempeña el cargo de concejal propietario en Alcaldía , además posee su propia finca y ganado,  según referencias de sus vecinos lo consideran como un hombre responsable,  honesto y de buenos valores morales.
texts.en:
Don Segundo has worked as a town councillor in la Alcaldia El Coral Chontales for a year. He lives in the suburbs of Coral. He has three children, all young, who are studying in primary school. His wife takes care of the housekeeping and children. He is seeking his first loan from the AFODENIC institution to invest in the improvement of his wagon, to make it more ordered and hygenic and give better care to his cattle. He does his job of councillor in Alcaldia well, and also possesses his own farm and livestock. According to his neighbours' references they consider him to be a responsible man, honest, and of good moral values.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve wagon

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid has nine years of experience in the poultry business and has owned a poultry shop in his town since 2008.  He's 31 years old and single.  He helps his father with the household. Walid is requesting a loan of $1,200 US to buy additional chickens in order to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: Chickens for poultry farm

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
Las 11 integrantes del grupo Luz y Vida pertenecen al Centro Focal Los Andes, elaboran su reglamento interno para trabajar durante el precente ciclo organizadas por sus líderes, presidenta, tesorera y Secretaría de Actas, llevan adelante su reunión. Ellas se agruparon por la necesidad de acceder al préstamo para invertir en sus negocios.
Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de maní, ropa, carne, comida, elaboración de calzados, tejido a máquina de prendas de vestir y venta de lubricantes. Todas quieren mejorar sus negocios comprando mercadería o materia prima.
texts.en:
The 11 members of the group "Luz y Vida" (Light and Life) belong to the Los Andes regional office of ProMujer. They developed their internal working rules during the previous loan cycle. They are organized around their leaders: President, Treasurer and Secretary, who run their meetings. They formed the group in order to access a loan to invest in their businesses. All of them have diverse businesses such as: the sale of peanuts, clothing, meat and food, the production of shoes, the sewing of garments, and the sale of lubricants. All of them want to improve their businesses by buying merchandise or raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Las Iluminada 1 Group

texts.en:
Laura, 41, is a borrower who lives in Santo Domingo Norte, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Las Iluminada (The Illuminated), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Laura lives with her husband in a simple home north of the Dominican capital. The area is very crowded and typical of urban areas in developing countries. Running potable water is inaccessible, electricity is scarce if available at all, and health care is inadequate at best. Despite these and other difficulties, Laura runs a successful small business from her home, selling women’s clothing. She is very grateful for this loan, her third from Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to expand her business.

Specifically, Laura plans to use this loan to purchase women’s pants, blouses and undergarments, which she will then sell at a small markup to friends and neighbors. Laura’s loans have helped her business immensely and as her business grows, so do her loans. Her current loan is 150% the size of her first loan and Laura continues to increase her sales and profits. She hopes to have her own home one day and help her children progress. 

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in 11 offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Laura and the Las Iluminada group!

loans.use: Blouses, pants, and undergarments

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es: Sergio Antonio habitante del Municipio El Coral,  tiene un año de labora para la Alcaldia del Coral Chontales como responsable del área de proyecto y planificación,  su esposa trabaja y le apoya con los gastos familiares y con los compromisos adquiridos, esta solicitando su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su casa de habitación, ya que actualmente tiene embaldozado una parte y desea ponerle el piso a toda la casa para que se vea mas bonita, sueña con dar mas seguridad a su casa y vivir en mejores condiciones para cuando nazca su primer hijo, este joven se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta y responsable, su sueño es tener estabilidad laborar y  mejorar su vivienda, que es el patrimonio de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio Antonio lives in the town of El Coral. He's been working in the planning division of the town government of El Coral Chontales for a year. His wife works and helps him with household expenses and outstanding financial obligations. He's requesting his first loan from AFODENIC, to be used in renovating his home. At the moment only part of it has tile flooring, and he'd like to install flooring throughout the house to make it look nicer. He dreams of making his home safer and more pleasant to live in for any children he might have in the future. This young man is honest and responsible, and his dream is to have steady work and improve his home, which will be his family's legacy.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: intalling a floor in his home

loans.name: Monica Alexandra

texts.es:
Mónica P. de 50 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, no esta casada pero tiene 2 hijos de 16 que estudia en colegio fiscal y de 25 años que estudia en la universidad.

Mónica comenzó con un negocio de comidas pero como no le resulto en su sector vender comida, comenzó con el reciclaje de tapas, botellas, plásticos todos esto los consigue en el basurero principal de guayaquil. Ella ahora recicla tapas, botellas, plásticos y los vende por unidad. Una de las complicaciones que Mónica tiene son las enfermedades que produce porque algunas veces se encuentran con cosas químicas. 

Con el préstamo quiere adecuar un lugar en su casa para tener más espacio para poner cosas de reciclaje. En el futuro quiere comprar un vehiculo para poder transportar mejor los plásticos.
texts.en:
Mónica P. is 50, and she lives in the outlying areas of the city. Her house is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She is not married, but she has two children. The 16 year old goes to public school, and the 25 year old attends the university. Mónica started a food business, but selling food in her area did not work out for her. She started to recycle tops, bottles, and plastics. She finds all of these things in the main dump of Guayaquil. She now recycles tops, bottles and plastics. She sells them by the unit. One of the complications that Mónica has is illnesses; sometimes she encounters chemical things. She wants to use the loan to adapt a place in her house to have more space to put the recyclable things. In the future she wants to buy a vehicle to be able to better transport the plastics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tops, bottles, and plastics

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 40-year-old married man with four children. He has been working as a builder since 1996, taking house projects. He is thankful for his business because, over the years, he was able to meet his family's needs and raise his four children. 

Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy construction materials and renovate his tools because he will taking charge of a new, big house project and he needs to be ready for the requisitions of customers.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and renovate his tools

loans.name: Amapolas Group

texts.es:
Las 8 integrantes del grupo Amapolas que pertenece al Centro Focal Los Andes, elaboran su reglamento interno para trabajar durante el precente ciclo 1, organizadas por sus líderes, presidenta, tesorera y Secretaría de Actas, llevan adelante su reunión. Ellas se agruparon por la necesidad de acceder al préstamo para invertir en sus negocios, así Ruperta Juana C., una de las integrantes, tiene una tienda de barrio hace 1 año y desea incrementar su mercadería, Santusa Susana C. de 35 años confecciona prendas de vestir a pedido ya que tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio y necesita el préstamo para comprar tela.
Las demás integrantes tienen negocios como tejido de chompas, mantas, gorras, aguayos (tela colorido),venta de muebles.
Todas quieren mejorar sus negocios comprando mercadería o materia prima.
texts.en:
The 8 member of the group "Amapolas" belong to the Los Andes regional office of ProMujer. They developed their internal working rules during the previous (and first) loan cycle. They are organized around their leaders: President, Treasurer and Secretary, who run their meetings. They formed the group in order to access a loan to invest in their businesses. Ruperta Juana C., one of the members, has had a neighborhood store for a year and wants to increase her merchandise. Santusa Susana C., 35, makes garments on order; she has a small workshop in her home and needs a loan to buy fabric. The other members have businesses such as the weaving of sweaters, blankets, caps, aguayos (big squares of colorful woven fabric), and the sale of furniture. All of the members want to improve their businesses by purchasing merchandise or raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Penda Aliou

texts.fr: Penda Aliou KÂ est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants . Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans et a eu à y bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a remboursés. Avec son prêt elle développe un petit élevage de bœufs et de moutons et les bénéfices issus de son activité lui permettent d'aider à la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Penda Aliou KÂ is 38 years old, married and has six children. She has been a member of the village bank in SIWAL for two years and has had four loans which she has repaid. With her loan she is building up a small beef and sheep rearing business and the profits from her activity will allow her to help taking care of her family and to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
DaliL. es una madre D. familia D. 27 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el caserío L. Pava, distrito D. Mochumí, ubicado a una hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Debido a que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícoL. y que los ingresos que percibe por esta actividad no son permamentes, elL. maneja un negocio D. crianza y venta D. animales en su casa. Usualmente cría ovejas cerdos, aves D. corral entre otros animales menores para venderlos a los negociantes que visitan L. zona con frecuencia. Este negocio es D. mucha ayuda para L. familia por lo que DaliL. da todo D. si para sacarlo adelante.

DaliL. desea ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. más animales, pero no cuenta con el suficiente capital para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en L. necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro D. su objetivo.

ElL. es una madre responsable, trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia. Su más granD. anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una educacion D. calidad y una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
DaliL. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and her three children in the village of L. Pava, district of Mochumí, which is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Because her husband works as an agricultural laborer and his income isn't constant, DaliL. manages a business raising and selling animals out of her home. Usually she raises sheep, pigs, farm birds and other small animals, which she sells to businesspeople who visit the area frequently. This business is a great aid to her family and helps make headway. DaliL. wishes to expand her business by purchasing more animals, but she doesn't have the sufficient funds to carry it out, which is why she is requesting a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 soles to help her achieve her objectives. She is a responsible and hard-working mother who is very devoted to her family. Her biggest goal is to proviD. her children with a quality education and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more small animals to expand her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana pertenece al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANNIYOC” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Juana vive en la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Rayanniyoc esta ubicado a una 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Juana se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y mandar a sus hijos menores al colegio. Juana tiene una pequeña chacra donde siembra cebolla, orégano, papa, papaliza y muchas semillas más. La socia también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Juana requiere el préstamo para invertir en la educación de sus hijos y también va comprar más semillas y fertilizantes para la chacra. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the “VILLA RAYANNIYOC” Community Bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa. She is 51 years old, married and has four children. She lives in the city of Rayanniyoc, province of Calca, department of Cusco, Peru, about 30 miles from the city of Cusco. Juana gets up very early to take care of her household duties, for instance preparing breakfast and sending her small children to school. She has a small farm where she grows onion, oregano, potato and many other items. Juana also makes a living raising small animals. She has been dedicated to her business for a number of years and it has been going well thanks to her hard work. Juana is requesting a loan so she can invest in her children's education as well as purchase more seeds and fertilizers for her land. She is grateful for the opportunity this program provides and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her children's education as well as purchase more seeds and fertilizers for her land

loans.name: Nabiha

texts.en:
Nabiha is a 40-year-old married woman with five unemployed children. She has been working as a home-based cooker, selling delicious plates and pastry products upon the request of her clients. 

Nabiha is well-known by the whole region for her delicious and variable food products. Today, Nabiha is requesting to borrow $800 to buy products needed for cooking in order to fulfill client orders and make a good income.

loans.use: Buy products needed for cooking

loans.name: Heydi

texts.es: Heydi A., es soltera, habita en la comarca Villa Álvarez, vive en la casa de sus padres, realiza estudios de secundaria,  su actividad principal es trabajar en  las actividades del campo con su padres, ella es una mujer dispuesta a salir adelante, con su inventario actual del ganado que ella posee de herencia de su papá, Heydi necesita del crédito para realizar la compra de 3 ternero desarrollo, para engordarlo y obtener mejor ingreso cuando ellos alcancen su peso optimo para ser comercializado durante el año, esperando que este un precio favorable, para ganar, estos nos va ayudar para salir adelante con el núcleo familiar y mejora la calidad de vida, ella es una joven que necesita tener su propia económia, para en el futuro poder ofrecerle algo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Heydi A. is single and lives in the region of Villa Álvarez in her parents' house. She has a high school education and makes a living working in the field with her parents. Heydi is a woman very determined to make headway, and currently has an inventory of cattle that was handed down from her father. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase three calves to fatten so she can earn more income when they reach their optimum weight and she sells them during the year. She's hoping to get a favorable price to earn more, and this will help her family make headway and improve their quality of life. Heydi is a young woman who needs to have her own finances so in the future she can provide for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Don Maximo es casado, tiene  3 hijos menores de edad,  es pequeño productor ganadero con 23 años de experiencia, posee un parcela en la comarca Villa Alvarez de 33 mzs, con un poco de inventario ganadero, la cual presenta buenas condiciones tècnicas para el desarrollo del hato, con infraestructura de corral, galera, manga, para el desarrollo del ordeño, pastos mejorados, le brinda suplementos alimenticios y manejo fitosanitario al ganado, está solicitando su primer crédito para compra de terneros de desarrollo, con el objetivo de aumentar su inventario ganadero y obtener ganancias al momento de la comercialización, para lograr así un buen desarrollo de la inversión.,  es muy reconocido en su comunidad con gran liderazgo, sueña con tener un futuro mejor que mejore la calidad de vida del nucleo familiar.
texts.en:
Maximo is married and has three young children. He is a raiser of livestock with 23 years of experience and has a parcel of land in the region of Villa Alvarez with a small inventory of cattle. The land has good technical conditions for the development of the herd, with infrastructure for milking and improved pastures that provide food supplements and healthy plants to the cattle. He is requesting his first loan to purchase calves with the objective of increasing his cattle inventory and obtaining better profits at the time of sale, thus achieving a good development from this investment. Maximo is well known in his community for his great leadership, and he dreams of a better future and improving the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Nyeupe Group

texts.en:
Mambo! Greetings from Tanzania.

Meet Bakari A. and the Nyeupe group from Dar es Salaam. The group's name means "white" in Kiswahili. Bakari is a 44-year-old father of two, aged 23 and 2. He is married and has been running a business selling livestock for three years in the Mlandizi district of Dar es Salaam. Bakari sells live chickens and goats from 6:45 am to 6 pm daily. He makes approximately $150 per month. 

This is Bakari's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. He used the first loan to buy cement to make blocks because he is building a small house. He also used it for "kilimo" (agriculture) to grow "mpunga" (rice). Bakari will use this loan to buy cement to make more blocks, to continue growing rice, and to purchase more live chickens for his business.

In the photo, Bakari is sitting in the front row toward the left, wearing glasses. He will share this loan with the members of his group. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan on time. The Nyeupe group from Tanzania thanks you for your support!

loans.use: chickens, cement for blocks, and agricultural inputs to grow rice

loans.name: Keki Group

texts.en:
Jambo from Tanzania!

This is Mariam S. and the Keki loan group. At Tujijenge Tanzania, the groups name themselves. "Keki" is the Kiswahili word for "cake"! Many words in Kiswahili have been borrowed from English and the spelling is changed to reflect the Tanzanian pronunciation. 

Mariam S., a member of the Keki group, is 27 years old, married, and has two children, ages 5 and 2. She has been running a food shop ("duka" in Kiswahili) since last year. The shop is open from 6 am until 10 pm daily, and Mariam manages to make a profit of about $150 per month.

This will be Mariam's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. She would like to use it to purchase more food to sell in her shop, as well as to buy kanga and vitenge to add to her offerings. Kanga and vitenge are the colorful, patterned sarongs and fabrics worn by many Tanzanian women. Mariam believes that selling these fabrics in her store will greatly improve her business by attracting many new customers.

In the photo, Mariam is seated in the front row wearing the yellow-green dress (which happens to be tailored from vitenge cloth!). She is seated with the members of her group. They will all hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. The Keki group in Dar es Salaam thanks Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: sarongs and fabrics and foodstocks for shop

loans.name: Estela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Estela P. de 48 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su estado civil es divorciada su esposo la abandono cuando su hija tenia 3 años, ahora su hija tiene 15 años y estudia en una escuela fiscal.

Estela comenzó vendiendo perfumes y cremas gracias a los buenos ingresos que tenia comenzó a implementar cosas comestibles para vender en su casa. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta el anochecer todos los días vendiendo arroz, azúcar, colas, cremas, perfumes etc. Una de las complicaciones que tiene en su tienda es la inseguridad que hay en su sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar snack, legumbres, colas, cremas para tener más variedad en su tienda. En el futuro quiere agrandar más el negocio.
texts.en:
Estela P. is 48 years old and lives in the suburbs of Paraíso de Guayaqui. She is divorced because her husband left her when her duaghter was three years old. Now she is 15 and is in school. Estela started out selling perfumes and lotions, and thanks to her good profits she began selling edible items out of her home. She works from 6 in the morning until dusk every day selling rice, sugar, sodas, lotions, perfumes, etc. One of the problems she has with her store is the lack of security in the area. With the loan, she plans to purchase snacks, legumes, sodas and lotions to add more variety to her store. In the future she wants to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snacks, legumes, sodas and lotions

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 37-year-old married man with 3 young children. He has been working in construction for the past 20 years. In 2000, he decided to work on his own and create his own business taking on construction projects. He's very happy because he feels independent in his own business. Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a car (Rapid model)  for easier transport to the houses where he works.

loans.use: buy a car for easier transport

loans.name: Amanda Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Amanda Concepción M. P. originaria del barrio Camilo Ortega al sur de Managua vende ropa y colchones. Ella mencionó mientras acariciaba a su pequeño hijo de seis años que todo sacrificio y trabajo es para que el tenga un mejor futuro, educación y que disfrute esa etapa de su vida. 

M. desea que su pequeño tenga lo que ella no pudo y que no pase hambre, frió y trabajo.
texts.en:
Señora Amanda Concepción M. P. comes from the Camilo Ortega neighborhood south of Managua. She sells clothes and mattresses. As she carressed her small son of six years, she mentioned that every sacrifice and all her work is so that her son can have a better future, a better education and enjoy this phase of his life. M. hopes that her small one will have what she did not and never be hungry or cold or have to do hard labor as a child.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes and mattresses for resale.

loans.name: Maria Hermelinda

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que vive junto a sus tres hijos de 8, 5 y un años de edad en el caserío El Taymi, distrito de Tucume, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su esposo trabaja en una mina de la ciudad de Cajamarca. Las ganas de progresar y sacar a su familia adelante han hecho que ella también empiece a trabajar: se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace cinco años, ella cría todo tipo de animales menores a espaldas de su casa y los vende a los comerciantes que eventualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Por otro lado trabaja eventualmente como obrera agrícola.

Maria desea ampliar su negocio de venta de animales para asi obtener mas ingresos y dejar de trabajar como obrera agricola, por ello se  ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme amleternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de mas animales para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una madre responsable y trabajadora que siempre piensa en el bienestar de su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho. Su más grande anhelo es que su esposo trabaje cerca para poder tener a toda su familia reunida.
texts.en:
María is a 26-year-old mother that lives with her three children, ages 8, 5 and 1 years, in the Taymi settlement, Tucume district, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Her husband works in a mine in the city of Cajamarca. The desire to progress and move her family ahead has driven her to also begin to work. For five years she has been dedicated to the breeding and sale of animals. She raises all kinds of animals behind her house and sells them to the merchants that occasionally visit the zone where she lives. On the other hand she also works as an agricultural laborer. Maria desires to expand her animal sale business in order to obtain more income and to stop working as an agricultrual laborer. Because of this she has seen the need for the first time to request a loan of 1500 new soles from Edpyme amleternativa. She plans to use the money to purchase more animals to achieve her objective. She is a hard-working and responsible mother that always thinks about the welfare of her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances respect her very much. Her greater hope is that her husband might work closer to be able to have all her family reunited.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more young animals to grow her business.

loans.name: Quiere Al Niño Group

texts.es:
“Quiere al Niño”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  12 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes realizan diversas actividades como: producción,  comercio y servicio, ellos vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace 4 años.
Dionisia Victoria asume el cargo de presidenta, tiene 50 años, conviviente, y tiene 5 hijos todos ellos independientes.
Desde hace 8 años se dedica al tejido a crochet (tejido manual), se inicio en este negocio porque inicialmente trabajó en una empresa, en el cual logró aprender y  decidió independizarse, actualmente trabaja con un cliente el cual exporta sus productos, además participa en un comedor popular de Horacio Zevallos y apoya a un sacerdote como asistenta social de ayuda comunitaria en diversas zonas del cono este de Lima.
Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado la educación de sus hijos en una universidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El reciente préstamo será destinado a la compra de materiales para su negocio, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
“Quiere al Niño” is a community bank made up of 12 enthusiastic and enterprising members, who pursue different activities, including production, trade and services. They have worked with EDAPROSPO Prosperidad for four years. Dionisia Victoria, who is the president of the group, is 50 years old, lives with her partner and has five children, all of whom are independent. For 8 years, she has been crocheting textiles by hand. She started this business because she had worked in a factory, where she learned this skill, and decided to pursue it independently. At present, she works with a client, who exports her products. She is also involved in Horacio Zevallos’ popular restaurant, and she helps a priest as a social assistant and works to help members of the community in different areas in the eastern part of Lima. Because of her hard work, she has succeeded in sending her children to a university and in improving the quality of her life. This loan will be used to buy materials for her business. All of our members agree to help each other and commit to pay the loan installments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Brenda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
8.	Individual: Brenda de los Ángeles R. A. 
Código: 04010651
Total: 8000	
Periodicidad: 32 semanal			 Fecha: 25-01-2010

Brenda de los Ángeles R. A. tiene una pequeña pulpería donde oferta desde granos básicos, carne, verduras, frutas entre otros productos de necesidad. Ella invertirá el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad  de productos y si es posible en nuevos especialmente en útiles escolares y papelería.
texts.en:
Brenda de los Ángeles R. A. has a small convenience store where she offers basic grains, meat, vegetables and fruits among other necessities. She will invest the loan to buy a greater quantity of products and, if possible, new products, especially school supplies and stationery.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more foods and new products for her convenience store.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y su hija de quince dias de nacida en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en el caserio Quemazón, ditrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Usualmente trabaja como obrero agrícola, pero debido a que esta actividad no le ofrece la estabilidad que necesita instaló, hace un año, una pequeña bodega en casa de sus suegros, allí el vende abarrotes y diversos productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azucar. Aceite). Este negocio es de mucha utilidad para sus vecinos ya que no existen bodegas por la zona, y el pueblo mas cercano está a quince minutos de distancia.

Para atender la gran demenada por los productos que ofrece, Pedro se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más productos y asi ampliar su negocio.

El es un joven muy conocido y estimado por sus vecinos y conocidos, los cuales lo consideran una persona responsable. Su más grande anhelo es darle a su hija una adecuada calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro is 30, married, and lives with his wife and two-week-old daughter in his in-laws' house. It is located in the town of Quemazón, in the district of Mórrope, one hour from the city of Chiclaylo. He usually works in agriculture, but because it doesn't offer him the stability that he needs, he set up a small grocery store in his in-laws' house a year ago. He sells groceries and various basic goods like rice, sugar, and oil. This business is very useful for his neighbors because there aren't any other grocery stores in the area. The closest town is 15 minutes away. In order to handle the great demand for his products, Pedro saw it necessary to request his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so he can invest in the purchase of more products and expand his business. He is well-known and loved by his neighbors and other people who know him. They consider him to be a responsible person. His biggest wish is to give his daughter a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and other basic goods to expand his business

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian is 52 years old, married, and the mother of six children. Three of her children are in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits, etc. in her neighborhood. She has twenty years experience in retail selling. It has been her dream to expand by adding new foodstuffs that are frequently demanded by her customers. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and foodstuffs such as tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices, groundnuts, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is 53 years old, married and the mother of four children, all of whom have completed school and are working. Abena lives with her husband in a community in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor who prepares and serves kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked, and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. Abena has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. She has been selling kenkey for twenty five years now. In addition, she also sells raw food such as bags of maize at the market square. Abena was able to provide for her children from the kenkey business. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She would be glad for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials (maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood)

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 31 years old, married and the mother of two children. She says that with the help of God all her children attend school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits and babies product like napkins, feeding bottles, etc. in her neighborhood. She lives in a community in the central region of Ghana. She also sells maize grains in addition to her grocery shop. She buys her maize in Kumasi. Demand for her stock is on the higher side so she is requesting a loan to buy her stock in bulk to meet those needs and increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is 50 years old, married and the mother of five children. One of her children completed senior high school and only one is in school. Esi manufactures palm kernel oil. Palm kernel oil is produced from the palm kernel. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her operation is on a limited scale because she doesn't have adequate capital to buy machines for the processing. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials (palm kernel) and processing equipment to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and profit to provide for her family and finance her child's education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and processing equipment

loans.name: Ngô Thị's Group

texts.en:
S. Ngô Thị (10105030031) is a 60-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  S. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Hội Phụ (4).


S. is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, S. manufactures & sells bamboo products to local businesses and community members.  S. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, S. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,270,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4,578,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Chử Hồng N. (10105030035) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her food stall.


2.  Phạm Thị T. (10105030034) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


3.  Đỗ Thị L. (10105030051) is a 59-year-old female who is requesting a 4,142,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


4.  Trịnh Thị Q. (10105030032) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business imaking & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


S. Ngô Thị (10105030031) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  S. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Hội Phụ (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  S. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, S. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2006, S. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  S. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.270.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.578.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Chử Hồng N. (10105030035) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  Phạm Thị T. (10105030034) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  Đỗ Thị L. (10105030051) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


4.  Trịnh Thị Q. (10105030032) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Alberto Jose G. U., de 49 años habita en el Barrio Pilas Orientales es acompañado por su mujer la cual se dedica  al comercio, el tiene 7 hijos,  3 de ellos son mayores de edad los otros 4 viven con él y le apoyan en los mandados y quehaceres del hogar, uno de los planes principales del Sr. G., sería el obtener los recursos necesarios para poder apoyar a sus hijos a prepararse académicamente, para esto el señor Alberto desde hace 10 años que se dedica  a la agricultura principalmente  a la producción de Granos Básicos y Hortalizas, el problema primordial del cultivo es el ataque de los roedores en sus plantíos que le dañan considerablemente su producción, es por esta razón que solicitó este crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de siembra, la venta de esta cosecha a un buen precio para la calidad de la misma, le traerá la posibilidad de poder diversificar sus cultivos pudiendo mejorar estabilidad  económica de  la familia.
texts.en:
Señor Alberto Jose G. U., of 49 years, lives in the Pilas Orientales neighborhood. He is accompanied by his wife, who is dedicated to commerce. He has 7 children, 3 of whom are of legal age. The other 4 live with him and help him with the errands and tasks of the home. One of the main plans of Señor G. would be to obtain the necessary resources for his children to be prepared academically. For this Señor Alberto has been dedicated for more than 10 years to agriculture; chiefly to the production of Basic Grains and Vegetables. The fundamental problem of cultivation is the attack of rodents in his fields that damage his production considerably. For this reason he has requested this loan for the purchase of fertilizers and seeds for sowing. The sale of his harvest at a good price because of it's good quality will give him the possibility to be able to diversify his crops, enabling him to improve the economic stability of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad en el caserío San Pedro de Sasape, ubicado en el distrito de Illimo, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores, el compra ovejas, chanchos y aves de corral en los caseríos aledaños para venderlos en el Mecado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista) de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Además posee una mototaxi (vehiculo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que genera recursos adicionales. Con estos ingresos el trata todos los dias de sacar adelante a los suyos.

Cesar desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales para comercializar, por ello esta solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles para realizar su objetivo.

Su mas grande anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en excelentes profesionales. El es un padre responsable y muy trabajador, sus vecinos lo estiman mucho y siempre acuden a el cada vez que necesitan ayuda.
texts.en:
Cesar is 41 years of age, married and lives with his wife and their three young children in the San Pedro of Sasape settlement, located in the Illimo district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He is dedicated to the commercialization of young animals, the purchase of sheep, pigs and poultry in the adjoining settlements in order to sell them in the Mecado Moshoqueque (wholesale market) of the city of Chiclayo. In addition, he possesses a mototaxi (motorized vehicle used in the transportation of loads and passengers) with which he generates additional resources. With these incomes he tries every day to get ahead. Cesar desires to expand his business with the purchase of more animals to market. Because of this he is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 1700 new Soles from Edpyme Alternative to carry out his objective. His greater desire is to see his children become excellent professionals. He is a very industrious and responsible father. His neighbors respect him very much and always come to him any time that they need help.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more young animals for resale.

location.town: Sector San Pedro de Sasape - Illimo - Lambayeque

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 38 years old and married with two children—one newborn and one in school. Her husband s a trader in the community where she lives.

Theresa has owned and operated a grocery store for eight years, selling items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and skimmed powdered milk. She also sells cereals like maize in the community market.

Theresa sees an opportunity to grow her business and wants the loan to expand her inventory to include other items frequently in demand by customers. Improved sales would enable her to save more for her children's education. She hopes to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Manuel Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 69 años de edad, es separado, tiene dos hijas mayores de edad que ya son independientes y vive junto a su madre en la ciudad de Piura, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la venta y reparacion de relojes en el Mercado de la ciudad de Piura. Este negocio le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia y ahora le permite hacerse cargo de su madre, que es de edad muy avanzada. El se esfuerza diariamente para seguir adelante y mantener a su progenitora.

Manuel se encuentra solicitando por segunda vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la ampliacion de su negocio con la compra de relojes de mano para esta temporada de verano.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir saliendo adelante con su negocio para brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida. El ya ha trabajado con nuentra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Manuel is 69 years of age. He is separated and has two daughters of legal age that are already independent. He lives next to his mother in the city of Piura, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 20 years he has been dedicated to the sale and repair of clocks in the Market of the city of Piura. This business has helped his family to get ahead and now permits him to take care of his mother, who is of a very advanced aged. He endeavors daily to continue ahead and to maintain his ancestor. Manuel is requesting his second loan from Edpyme Alternative; a loan of 500 new soles, which he plans to use to grow his business with watches purchased for this summer season. His greater desire is to continue doing well with his business in order to offer his mother a better quality of life. He has worked with our Institution previously and has shown himself to be a responsible and punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy watches to grow his business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 53 years old and married with five children, one still in school. She lives with her family in Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She has been a baker for ten years selling bread retail, as well as bulk, in the market center. Her problem is finding adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. She requests a loan to enable her to remain in business. With it, she believes she can provide for her family — especially her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Phạm Thị's Group

texts.en:
Vụ Phạm Thị is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. Vụ is the group leader of a six-member group with a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Hội Phụ.


Vụ is married and has one grown child. To make a living, she operates a family member's business manufacturing and selling bamboo products in the community. Vụ has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Vụ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and business. Vụ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.180.000 VND from SEDA. This loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new loan of 4.142.000 VND for the same purpose. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Vụ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the Group:

1.  Chử Thị L. (10105030042) is a 51 year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

2.  Ngô Thị T. (10105030045) is a 55 year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

3.  Vũ Thị Quế (10105030044) is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

4.  Đỗ Thị H. (10105030052) is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.
