5.  Phạm Thị H. (10105030043) is a 39 year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 48 years old, is married, and is the mother of three children. Life she said is a bit challenge but she tries hard to overcome most of them.

Monica is currently into the sale of earrings and necklaces made with silver, copper, and gold brands and she sells them through hawking (going on foot) through the market. She also sells grocery products like skimmed milk, vegetable oil, etc.

Monica obtains her stock of goods from Kumasi, from Accra, and sometimes from Cape Coast central market and retails to her customers. She requests the loan to buy earrings and grocery products to upgrade her stock. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy assorted earrings and necklace in bulk and grocery products

loans.name: Maura Katalina

texts.es: La señora Maura Katalina C. O., de 57 años de edad vive en el barrio San Ignacio es casada y el señor se dedica a los trabajo de agricultura, ellos tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 de ellos son adultos y casados que viven de manera independiente, el menor es el que habita con la familia apoyándole en las tareas del hogar y la finca, ellos tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la producción  de pitahaya, piña y plátano, el problema principal al que se han enfrentado ha sido la falta de capital para poder realizarle mejoras a los cultivos, por otra parte la familia el año pasado tuvo la mala fortuna de  perder a un hijo lo cual dentro de la desdicha familiar, les trajo serios gastos que cubrir por tanto optaron por cubrir estos egresos con dinero ahorrado que tenía la familia para invertirlo en el negocio, es por esta razón que ellos solicitan se les brinde este crédito con el fin de darle mantenimiento a la cosecha en la compra de fertilizantes, esto les traería mejores condiciones económicas por que le recuperaría lo invertido y les generaría las utilidades para nuevos proyectos de la familia. Ellos son una familia muy humilde y responsable que a lo largo de los años la misma comunidad lo confirma.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maura Katalina C. O. is 57 and lives in the San Ignacio area. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have 5 children: 4 are married adults who live on their own. The youngest lives with his parents helping them with household tasks and the farm. They have been growing pitahaya (dragon fruit), pineapple and bananas for the past 15 years. The main problem facing them has been the lack of capital to be able to improve the crops. Coupled with this last year the family had the tremendous misfortune of losing a son. This family tragedy led to a series of big expenses to cover. They had to manage these expenses with their savings that they were going to use to invest in the business. That is why they are asking for a loan-to take care of their crops with the purchase of fertilizers. This will improve their economic situation and help them repay the loan, and will generate the means for new family projects. They have been a very humble and responsible family over the years-their community will confirm this.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en: H. Nguyễn Thị (10107030006) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà nội. H. is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vạn lộc (2). H. is married and has two school-aged children. She operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month. In 2006, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,450,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 6,322,000 VND which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Nguyễn Thị L. (10107030009) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her general store. 2. Ngô Thị T. (10107030008) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** H. Nguyễn Thị (10107030006) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh -Hà nội. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vạn lộc (2). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND. Vào 2006, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,450,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,322,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị L. (10107030009) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 2. Ngô Thị T. (10107030008) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông ngH.. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh NgH. Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Sorbeh-Turn-Table Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Sorbeh-Turn-Table' group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000.00 each to enable them to add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and in their academic pursuits. 

Rugiatu K. (left) is the leader of this group. She is 39 years of age and was born in Makeni city. She is married to a businessman and they have 4 children. One of her children is in primary school and 3 are in secondary school. Rugiatu is a petty businesswoman and she has been a businesswoman for 18 years now. She sells  market foods like salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, onions, and so on. With this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy market foods like salt, margi, pepper, onions, and so on

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is 53 years old. She is a wife with two children. Through her hard effort, all of her children graduated from the junior high years ago and are now working on their own. Efua owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and skimmed powdered milk. She also sells onions, spices, and peppers from her shop. She deems it a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. Efua hopes to improve her sales to enable her to save more of her earnings for the future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Wan Word Movement Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Wan Word Movement' group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,500,000 each to enable them to add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing, and in their academic pursuits. 

Aminata K. (in the middle of the photo) is the leader of this group. She is 35 years of age, married to a driver and they have 2 children, both of whom are attending secondary school.

Aminata sells market foods – rice, peppers, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy peppers, margi, onions, salt, rice to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy peppers, margi, onions, salt, and rice for resale

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Casa Grande, distrito de la Arena, provincia de Piura, en la región Piura, ubicada a 3 horas y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace 8 meses instaló en casa de sus padres un negocio de cabinas de internet (internet café), para lo cual adquirió cinco computadoras con los ahorros de su anterior actividad: el comercio de arroz. El había estudiado la carrera de Computación e Informática en un instituto de la ciudad de Piura y el instalar este negocio habia sido siempre la meta que deseaba lograr.

El negocio es de mucha utilidad para los estudiantes e la zona, que siempre recurren durante los meses de estudio a solicitar la búqueda de información para sus trabajos escolares. Elmer desea adquirir una  impresora multifuncional con la que desea brindar en adelante un mejor servicio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ampliar su negocio para poder brindar un buen sevicio. El es un joven responsable, trabajador y muy empeñoso.
texts.en:
Elmer, 28 years old, is single and lives with his parents in the Casa Grande sector of the District of Arena, Province of Piura, in the Piura region about three hours and forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Eight months ago he installed an internet cafe business in his parents house, acquiring five computers with the savings from his previous work selling rice. He had studied the Computing and Information Technology course at an institute in the city of Piura. Starting this business has always been the goal he hoped to accomplish. The business has been very useful for the students of the area who always come during the school year to search for information for their school work. Elmer wants to acquire a multifunctional printer with which he can provide better service in the future. For this reason he has seen the necessity of requesting for the first time a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1000 new soles. His greatest wish is to expand his business to be able to provide good service.He is a responsible young man, hard working and dedicated.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a multifunction printer to expand his business.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Ngọc's Group

texts.en: B. Nguyễn Thị Ngọc (10107030005) is a 26-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà nội. B. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vạn Lộc (1). B. is married and has two infant children. She operates a specialized retail store selling electronic products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month. In 2006, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,142,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. B. is now requesting a new loan of 5,014,000 VND which will again be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Nguyễn Thị H. (10107030002) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. 2. Nguyễn Thị D. (10107030003) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 3. Lê Thị Mỵ (10107030004) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Trần Thị N. (10107030007) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** B. Nguyễn Thị Ngọc (10107030005) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. B. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vạn Lộc (1). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm điện tử trong cộng đồng địa phương. B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 4,000,000 VND. Vào 2006, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. B. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,142,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị H. (10107030002) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 2. Nguyễn Thị D. (10107030003) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 3. Lê Thị Mỵ (10107030004) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Trần Thị N. (10107030007) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ismary Abigail

texts.es:
La Señora  Ismary Abigail B. N., Labora como  Analista de Recursos Laborales en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y  este  se encuentra en edad escolar, esta casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de  materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines para terminar de cambiar el techo de su casa.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Ismary    dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su vivienda
texts.en:
Ismary Abigail B. N. works as a labor resource analyst at the Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez in Managua. She takes care of her son, who attends school. She is married and has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for a year. During this time, she has invested a loan in improving her home, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL. She will invest the loan she's requesting in the purchase of construction materials, such as zinc and beams, in order to finish replacing the roof on her house. Her goal is to provide greater security and a better quality of life for her children. Ismary said that because of the loans granted by CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements and expansion

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Patricia Maria

texts.es:
Patricia C. de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su estado civil es divorciada, tiene 2 hijos los dos estudiando en escuelas fiscales. 

Patricia comenzó como comerciante vendiendo todo tipo de cosas ya son 13 años que sigue como comerciante vendiendo perfumes, ropas, cremas, lociones etc. Patricia sale a recorrer las calles de Guayaquil todos los días para vender su mercadería. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es cuando sus clientes se demoran en pagar.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa, perfumes, joyería para poder tener más variedad en su mercadería. En el futuro quiere poner ya un negocio establecido en su casa.
texts.en:
Patricia C. is 36-years-old and lives on the outskirts of Paraíso de Guayaquil. She is divorced and has 2 children who attend public school. Patricia began selling all types of products and after 13 years, she continues as a vendor, selling perfume, clothing, creams, lotions, etc. Patricia takes to the streets of Guayaquil every day in order to sell her merchandise. One of the complications that arise is when her customers delay payment. She wants to buy clothing, perfume and jewelry with this loan so that she can offer a greater variety of merchandise. In the future, she wants to have an established business in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothing, perfume, creams

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara is married and the mother of one child; she is twenty-five years old. She lives with her child in a town called Moore in the central region of Ghana. She enjoys commerce and has been selling foodstuffs for over four years in the town where she lives. She sells food items like beans, maize, groundnuts and others. She buys her goods from the farmers in her locality and the surrounding towns. She sells to the people of her locality, most of whom are food vendors. She says she desires to buy the goods in bulk so that she can reach a larger share of the market by trekking to markets in nearby towns. This she says is only possible by increasing her working capital. Basically, this is what she aspires to use the loan for.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, maize, groundnuts, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Mame Penda

texts.fr: Mame Penda D. est âgée de 24 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PAR-CISSE depuis 2 ans et y a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a bien régulièrement remboursés. Son crédit lui permet de développer une activité d'embouche bovine; elle achète une paire de bœufs puis l'engraisse et la revend au bout de 4 ou 5 mois. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mame Penda D. is 24 years old, married and has one child. She has been a member of the village bank in PAR-CISSE for two years and has had four loans which she has repaid on a regular basis. Her loan will allow her to build up her beef fattening business; she is buying a pair of oxen which she will fatten up then resell after four or five months. Her aim is to boost her savings and to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La   Señora Juana María G. H., Labora como Recepcionista en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y  esto se encuentra en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines por lo que va a cambiar el techo de su casa ya que este se encuentra en mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 Juana dijo que gracias a los préstamos  otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda
texts.en:
Juana María G. H. works as a receptionist at the Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez in Managua. She is responsible for her son, who attends school. She is a single mother and has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for a year. During this time, she has invested a loan in improving her home, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL. She will invest the loan she's requesting in the purchase of construction materials, such as zinc and beams, that she will use to replace the roof on her house, which is in bad shape. Her goal is to offer her children greater security and a better quality of life. Juana said that due to the loans granted by CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and extension

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a businesswoman. She sells Dumas cloth, linen, lace materials and also flour, margarine and yeast etc. to the bakers around her community. She mostly sells the clothing materials through hawking, that is, personal selling method. This, she said, makes her goods move very fast. She is 31 years old and a married mother with three children. All her children are in school. She is very supportive to her family through the proceeds she makes from the business.

Cecilia has been selling for the past eight years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a more viable profit. She wants to purchase Dumas cloth, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. She dreams of having her own house from the savings she makes every day, and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas cloth etc. in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
La   Señora Claudia María Pérez M., Labora como Inspectora en Turno vespertino del Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y  estos se encuentran en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento y arena, para la construcción de  un embaldosado frente de su casa de habitación.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 Claudia dijo que gracias a los préstamos  otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Claudia María Pérez M. works as an evening shift inspector at the Manuel Olivares Rodriguez Institute of Managua. She has two children in her care, and they are of school age. She is married. She has had loans with CEPRODEL for three years. During this time, she has invested three loans in the improvement of the house in which she lives, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL.

The loan she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as cement and sand for the construction of a tile floor at the front of her house.

Her goal is to offer better security and a better living conditions to her children.

Claudia says that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements and enlargement of home

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor julio cesar Hernández S. es originario del municipio de san Juan de Limay comunidad san Lorenzo del departamento de Estelí , el es trabajador del ministerio de educación  el cual trabaja como maestro de educación primaria en su comunidad san Lorenzo donde tiene mas de 8 años de laborar el crédito se le otorgo para la compra de medicina  ya que su hijo tiene problemas respiratorios y su medicina es muy cara por lo que necesitaba con urgencia el crédito también el piensa comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos, el espera que su hijo se recupere con esta medicina y lleve una mejor vida y pueda seguir sus estudios ya que el año escolar se aproxima y no quiere que pierda el año escolar.

Julio es casado y tiene cuatro hijos bajo su cargo el cual estudian el nivel de primaria y preescolar julio tiene su casa propia  y no vive con sus padres pero los sigue apoyando ya que son muy importante para el y dice que siempre estará agradecidos con ellos por el estudio que le brindaron y el desea hacer lo mismo con sus hijos.   
 
Este es el quinto crédito que julio tiene con ceprodel el cual a demostrado una buena capacidad de pago y honradez tiene cinco años de estar trabajando con ceprodel y desea seguir trabajando  por mucho mas tiempo ya que los créditos le han ayudado a seguir adelante y a solucionar problemas como los que se le están presentando ahora como medicina y los útiles escolares de sus hijos  el expresa que con los créditos anteriores mejoro su casa y que también a mejorado las  condiciones de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Julio Cesar Hernández S. is from the San Lorenzo community in the municipality of of San Juan de Limay, Department of Estelí, Nicaragua. He works for the Ministry of Education as an elementary school teacher in his community, San Lorenzo, and has been working there for 8 years. He is requesting this loan in order to buy medicine because his son has respiratory problems and his medicine is very expensive. For this reason he urgently needs the loan. He also plans to buy school supplies for his children. He hopes that his son will get better with the medicine and will have a better life. He also hopes that this son will be able to continue with his studies because the start of the school year is nearing and he doesn't want his son to miss this year. Julio is married and has four children in his care, all in elementary school or preschool. He has his own home and does not live with his parents but he does help support them. His parents are very important to him and he says that he will always be thankful to them for giving him the opportunity to study in school. He wants to do the same for his children. This is the fifth loan that Julio has taken with CEPRODEL, which shows that he is good about repaying and honors his commitment. He's worked with CEPRODEL for five years and would like to keep working with them. The loans have helped him to get ahead and to solve problems such as those he is facing now, like medicine and school supplies for his children. He would like to mention that with the earlier loans he improved his home and has also improved the living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicine for his son and purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Juan Israel

texts.es: El señor Juan Israel A. es propietario de su pulpería que tiene desde hace tres años y que la ha logrado mantener gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos por mejorarla. Él se ha destacado por ser una persona muy esforzada y trabajadora y ha sabido llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de los productos para la pulpería como las gaseosas, comestibles, algunos medicamentos y otros productos para ofrecerlos en su pulpería en el mercado Mayoreo.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Israel A. owns a general store that he has managed for the past three years. He has invested a great amount of effort to maintain and improve it. Juan is known for being a strong, hardworking person who supports his household. The loan he is requesting will be used to acquire products for his store such as sodas, food, medicines, and other items. His store is located at the wholesale market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha R. R., de 48 años de edad vive en el Barrio Pilas Orientales, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura  y al comercio, ellos tiene 7 hijos de los cuales los tres mayores viven de manera independiente, los otros dos trabajan en los quehaceres del hogar y tiene bajo la tutela a los otros dos, toda la familia trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 12 años, el principal problema que acoge a los trabajadores de este sector es el poco apoyo de las Entidades Gubernamentales para el sector agrícola dificultando en gran manera la buena asistencia a los cultivos, fue gracias al apoyo de su esposo que la señora logro sacar adelante la cosecha, pero ahora necesita de un capital más fuerte, para poder brindarle un buen mantenimiento al cultivo de piña, con este apoyo, la cosecha sería de calidad pudiendo venderla a un  alto precio, garantizándole a la familia la recuperación del dinero invertido y las utilidades para nuevos proyectos.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha R. R. is 48 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of Pilas Orientales. Her husband is a farmer and trader. They have seven children, three of whom live independently. The next two children work by performing household duties. The youngest two children pay attention to their older siblings. The entire family has been involved in agriculture for twelve years. The main problem they have encountered is the lack of support from government agencies. It is difficult to find a great deal of assistance with their crops. Thanks to the support of her husband, Martha was able to move forward with her harvest.

She is now in need of additional capital in order to maintain her pineapple crop. With this assistance, she will be able to harvest a quality product that commands a high selling price. This will guarantee that her family can recoup the money they have invested and use it for new projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies needed to maintain her pineapple crop

loans.name: Victor Edinson

texts.es:
Victor tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, vive junto a su familia en el sector Fraternidad Juan Valer Sandoval, de la ciudad de Piura, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene un pequeño taller de carpinteria metalica instalada en su casa donde usualmente trabaja, pero debido a que esta actividad no le garantiza los ingresos permanentes que necesita también se dedica al servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi que adquirió hace tres años. 

El ofrece su servicio dentr de la ciudad de Piura y con este ingreso adicional puede solventar los gastos familiares. El tiempo de uso de su mototaxi ha hecho que empiece a sufrir algunas fallas de origen mecánico que requieren de urgente reparacion, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparacion y tapizado de su unidad movil.

Su más grande anhelo es hacer mejoras en la construcción de su casa ya que está hecha de material rustico (adobes). El es una personas muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, los cuales lo consideran un padre responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Victor is 41 years old, married, and has two dependent children. He and his family live in the District of Fraternidad Juan Valer Sandoval in the city of Piura, which is three hours away from city of Chiclayo.

He has a small metal shop in his house where he usually works. Since this business does not generate the steady income that he needs, Victor also provides transport services of both cargo and passengers in the motorcycle taxi he acquired three years ago.

He provides his services within the city of Piura. With the additional income, Victor is able to meet his family’s expenses. His motorcycle taxi business suffers whenever his vehicle encounters mechanical failures that require urgent repairs. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 soles in order to repair and upholster his vehicle.

His greatest wish is to make improvements to his home since it is made of basic materials (adobe). Victor is well-known and respected among his neighbors, who consider him to be a hardworking and responsible father.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair & upholster his vehicle

loans.name: María De Los Santos

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María de los Santos G. se dedica a su actividad de venta de frutas ofrecidas por ella misma en unos canastos donde coloca los perecederos.

Ella tiene 29 años de dedicarse a este negocio y en este lapso ha logrado llevar a cabo su trabajo con el que suple las necesidades de su hogar. El crédito que ella está solicitando será invertido en la compra de las frutas  como lo son las naranjas para así mejorar su actividad y suplir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
At the wholesale market in the city of Managua, Sra. María de los Santos G. sells fruit from baskets used for holding perishable items. She has been in this business for 29 years and has succeeded in her work, which allows her to meet her household needs. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits, such as oranges, in order to improve her business and provide for household necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Savanna

texts.en: Savanna is 25 years old; she is married and has given birth to two children. One of her children is in school. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or what we called 'Kose'. 'Kose' is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge. With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es:
El    Señor Fernando José P. R., Labora como Responsable de Mantenimiento del Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y  esto se encuentra en edad escolar, esta casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos  en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines por lo que va a cambiar una parte del techo de su casa el que se encuentra en  mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 Fernando dijo que gracias a los préstamos  otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. Fernando José P. R. is in charge of maintenance for the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. He is married and has two dependent children attending school. Fernando has been working with CEPRODEL for the past three years. During this time, he has received three home improvement loans.

The loan he is now requesting will be used to buy construction materials, such as zinc and crossbeams, to replace part of the roof of his house since it is bad condition. His objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children. Fernando thanks CEPRODEL for providing the loans that make it possible for him to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saraí Del Carmen

texts.es:
Saraí Martinez se ha destacado por haber iniciado desde hace siete años su negocio y de venta de ropa ofreciendo pequeñas cantidades de ropa pero hoy en día ha logrado mejorar grandemente las condiciones por lo que ahora tiene más surtido el negocio.

Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. También comprará zapatos para la venta y así continuar mejorando las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Seven years ago, Saraí Martinez started a business selling clothes. She began offering her products in small quantities but today she has been able to greatly improve the conditions of her business. Now her establishment is well-stocked.

The loan she requested will be used to buy clothing for women, men, and children. She will also buy shoes to sell so that she can continue to improve the condition of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
El    Señor José del Carmen Loa isiga A., Labora como Secretario en el Departamento de Capacitación en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y  esto se encuentra en edad escolar, esta casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines por lo que va a cambiar el techo de su cuarto ya que este se encuentra en mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 José dijo que gracias a los préstamos  otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. José del Carmen L. A. works as a secretary for the training department of the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. He is married and has two dependent children attending school. He has worked with CEPRODEL for the past year. During this time, he received a loan that was used to make improvements to his home.

The loan he is requesting now will be used to buy construction materials, such as zinc and crossbeams, to replace the ceiling of a room since the existing one is in bad condition. His objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children. José thanks CEPRODEL for providing the loans that make it possible for him to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace a ceiling

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La señora Rosalina I. se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y que siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar de su familia. Trabaja arduamente en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua atendiendo su pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos que son comercializados a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

La razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es para la compra de los productos para la pulpería tales como los comestibles, productos personales, entre otros. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente y beneficia a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosalina I. is known for being a hardworking woman who is always concerned about the welfare of her family. At the wholesale market in Managua, she manages a grocery store where she sells all types of products every day. She opens her business in the early hours of the morning.

Rosalina is requesting a loan because she needs to buy merchandise for her store such as food, personal products, and other items. This loan will benefit her family greatly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maria Epifania

texts.es:
La   Señora María Epifanía T. González, Labora como Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y  estos se encuentran en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cuatro créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento y arena, para la construcción de  un muro en el patio.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 María dijo que gracias a los préstamos  otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. María Epifanía T. González works as a janitor at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. She is a single mother with two dependent children attending school. She has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for the past three years. During this time, she has received four home improvement loans.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as stone, cement, and sand in order to build a wall in her patio. Her objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for her children. María thanks CEPRODEL for providing the loans that make it possible for her to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jacinta Guisela

texts.es:
Jacinta Cedeño de 37 años, vive en una casa de ladrillos esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja como guardia en un hotel de Guayaquil tienen 1 hijo que estudia en una escuela particular cerca de su sector.

Jacinta comenzó hace 2 años atrás vendiendo en su casa arroz y azúcar. Poco a poco empezó a tener ingresos necesarios para comprar más víveres para el negocio. Ahora Jacinta trabaja sola todos los días vendiendo víveres de todo tipo. Una de las complicaciones que tiene son las enfermedades que hay en estas épocas ya que hay mucha lluvia en su sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, enlatados, dulces para tener más surtida su tienda. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y poder ampliar más el negocio.
texts.en:
Jacinta Cedeño is 37 years old and lives in a brick house located in the District of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her husband works as a security guard at a hotel in Guayaquil. They have one child who attends a private school near their district.

Two years ago, Jacinta started selling rice and sugar from her home. Gradually she started to generate the income needed to buy more groceries for her business. She now works every day by herself selling all types of food. Some complications that she encounters are the diseases that develop during this time of the year because the district experiences a lot of rain.

With his loan, she will buy rice sugar, canned goods, and an assortment of candies to restock her store. In the future, she hopes to finish the construction of her house and be able to expand her business even more.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nguyen Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyen Thị (10117120017) is a 42 year-old woman living in the town of Dong Anh - Hanoi.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Nguyen Thị operates a family member's business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling soft drinks in the local community.  Nguyen Thị H. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Nguyen Thị joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nguyen Thị has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.250.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Nguyen Thị is now requesting a new loan of 6.758.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Nguyen Thị H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Josefa del Carmen G. Garcia de 38 años de edad, es casada y con su esposo, viven en la comunidad el Edén, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y guarda de seguridad, ellos tienen 3 hijos de las edades de 18, 13 y 9 años, el mayor trabaja y le apoya en los gastos del hogar los otros dos estudian y en las horas libres le apoyan en los trabajos de la tierra, para un futuro la señora Josefa planea comprar un vehículo para transportar las cosechas, se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 21 años y las dificultades que se les han presentado han sido la  falta de agua potable en la zona, ella cuenta con agua en su hogar cada 10 a 12 días, esto es por la zona marginada donde habita la familia, aun así ellos no deja de trabajar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, agradecería le apoyaran en la compra de mayores insumos tales como fertilizantes, para brindarle un mejor mantenimiento a sus tierras con este crédito venderían la cosecha de forma rápida pudiendo recuperar lo invertido y captando las utilidades para nuevas inversiones a futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa del Carmen G. Garcia is 38 years old, married and lives with her husband in the community of El Eden; her husband works as a farmer and security guard. They have 3 children, ages 18, 13 and 9; the oldest works and helps with the household expenses; the other two go to school and in their free time they help working the land. In the future, Mrs. Josefa plans to buy a vehicle to transport their crops; she has been working in agriculture for 21 years, and one the biggest challenges she has faced is the lack of drinking water in the area; she only get water in her house every 10-12 days because her family lives in a marginal zone. In spite of the challenges, they have not stopped working to improve their living conditions; she would appreciate the support in buying more consumables such as fertilizers to improve the management of her land. With this loan, she would sell her corps faster allowing her to recover her investments and to earn profits for new investments in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies to maintain her crops

loans.name: Maria Claudia

texts.es:
Maria Claudia es casada, tiene 32 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Catacaos, provincia de Piura, en la región Piura, ubicada a tres horas y 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a que su esposo trabaja como mototaxista y que los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares, se vio en la necesidad de empezar a trabajar e instaló un puesto de venta de ropa para niños en el interior del mercado central del distrito de Catacaos. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia por lo que dia a dia ella se esfuerza por sacarlo adelante.

Su negocio goza de buena acogida debido a la calidad de prendas que ofrece y a al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes, por ello está pensando en ampliarlo con la compra de más ropa, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una madre responsable y muy conocida en la zona donde vive. Sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo la estiman mucho y la consideran una persona confiable y amigable.
texts.en:
Maria Claudia is married, 32 years of age and lives with her husband and their two children in the Catacaos district, province of Piura, in the region of Piura, located three hours and 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Due to the fact that her husband works as a taxi driver and the income that he earns is not sufficient to cover the family expenses, she saw the need to begin to work and installed a stall to sell children's clothes in the interior of the central market of the district of Catacaos. This business is of a lot of help for the economy of her family for which she endeavors to get ahead day to day. Her business enjoys a good reception due to the quality of garments that she offers and the good deal that she offers her clients. Because of this she is thinking about expanding her business with the purchase of more clothes, but she does not have sufficient capital to carry out this action. For this reason she has seen the need for the first time to request a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternative. She is a very well known and responsible mother in the zone where she lives. Her neighbors and coworkers respect her a lot and consider her a friendly and dependable person.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tạ Thị's Group

texts.en: T. Tạ Thị (10117140012) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà nội. She is the group leader of a six-member group L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Xóm Ngoài (4). T. is married and has two adult children. She operates a business making and selling food, selling tofu products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month. In 2006, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous L. of 4,750,000 VND from SEDA. This previous L. was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. T. is now requesting a new L. of 5,450,000 VND which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The L. will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Nguyễn Thị H. (10117140016) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 5,450,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. 2. Nguyễn Quang T. (10117140014) is a 27-year-old male who is requesting a 5,450,000 VND L. to support his business raising livestock. 3. Vương Thị T. (10117140059) is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 5,450,000 VND L. to support her business making and selling food. 4. Nguyễn Thị L. (10117140015) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 5,450,000 VND L. to support her clothing business. 5. Trần Thị Kim O. (10117140013) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,450,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** T. Tạ Thị (10117140012) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xóm Ngoài (4). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh dO. chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ đậu hũ trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh dO. này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND. Vào 2006, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh dO. của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,750,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,450,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị H. (10117140016) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,450,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Quang T. (10117140014) là 27 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,450,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Vương Thị T. (10117140059) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,450,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 4. Nguyễn Thị L. (10117140015) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,450,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. quần áo. 5. Trần Thị Kim O. (10117140013) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,450,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (T. Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DO. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Đặng Thị's Group

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Hội (1). T. is married and has two school-aged children. She operates a business manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month. In 2006, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,142,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. T. is now requesting a new loan of 4,578,000 VND which will again be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be her 6th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Lương Thị H. (10105050024) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 4,578,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products. 2. Bùi Thị S. loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El  señor Juan Carlos tiene 40 años de edad, junto con su esposa se han esforzado para darle  mejorares oportunidades a sus dos hijos, su esposa emigro a los Estados Unidos de América para poder trabajar y mejorar su vivienda ya que el trabajo aquí en Nicaragua esta escaso. Don 
Juan tiene varios negocios, docente de ingles, tiene un taxi y una pequeña librería en su casa de habitación. Las clases las imparte por la mañana medio tiempo, luego por la tarde da su servicio de taxi y en su casa tiene una persona que le administra la librería todo con el objetivo de obtener mejores ganancias para poder hacer las  mejoras a su casa como pagar los gastos de agua, luz, teléfono todo esto lo ha logrado con su esfuerzo y las remesas que su esposa ha mandado. Con el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, hierro y cemento y otros para poder hacer el porche en frente de su casa y tener mas espacio ya que la librería la tiene en la sala y como es pequeña  se le hace difícil y desea invertir mas y poder ubicarla en el porche su librería. Para más seguridad de los antisociales ya que estaría en el porche con mejor seguridad. A futuro es poder incrementar la venta, comprar otras vitrinas para poder ofertar más los productos. Todo esto espera lograr con su trabajo y el apoyo de la institución.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Carlos is 40 years of age. Along with his wife he has endeavored to give better opportunities to their two children. His wife emigrated to the United States of America to be able to work and improve their dwelling, since the work here in Nicaragua is scarce. Señor Juan has various businesses; he teaches English, has a taxi and a small bookstore in his home. He gives classes part time in the morning, then in the afternoon provides his taxi service. In his house he has a person that administers the bookstore. He does all this with the objective of obtaining profits to be able to make improvements to his house, such as to pay for water, lights, and telephone. He has achieved all this with his efforts and the remittances that his wife has sent. With the loan that he is requesting he will buy building materials such as: stone, sand, iron and cement and other things to be able to make the porch across his house and to have more space, since he has the bookstore in the living room and it is small and makes things difficult. He wants to invest more and relocate the bookstore on the porch. For more security from outsiders, since it would be on the porch it needs better security. In the future he would like to be able to increase sales, to buy other showcases and to be able to offer more products. All this he expects to achieve with his work and the support of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to add a porch to his house where he can relocate his bookstore.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre y a su hermano en el caserio Vichayal, distrito de La Arena, provincia de Piura, en la región Piura, ubicado a 3 horas y 35 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella nos comenta que debido a que su padre los abandonó, tuvo que empezar a trabajar para apoyar en la economía familiar, se dedica a la venta de salchipollo y arroz con pollo (platos típicos del país) por las noches. Ella cocina estos platos en una cocina de leña contruida de material rustico instalada en su casa y durante las mañanas apoya a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar. También se dedica a la cria y venta de aves de corral.

Maria Esther desea comprarse un carrito sanguchero que le facilite la venta de comida por las noches, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mas grande anhelo es estudiar la carrera técnica de enfermeria en la ciudad de Piura. Ella es una joven trabajadora, responsable y emprenderora. En la fotografia nos muestra la cocina rustica en la que actualmente prepara los platos que ofrece.
texts.en:
María Esther is 20 years of age. She is a single woman and lives with her mother and her brother in the Vichayal settlement, district of La Arena, province of Piura, in the region of Piura, located 3 hours and 35 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She tells us that due to the fact that that her father abandoned them, she had to begin to work to support the family economy. She is dedicated to the sale of salchipollo and rice with chicken (typical dishes of the country) in the evenings. She cooks these dishes on a stove constructed of rustic materials that she installed in her house. During the mornings she helps her mother with the tasks of the home. Also she is dedicated to raising and selling poultry. Maria Esther desires to buy a cart with a grill to facilitate the food sales in the evenings, but does not have sufficient capital to carry out this action. Because of this she has seen the need to request, for the first time, a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternative. Her greater desire is to study the technical career of nursing in the city of Piura. She is a responsible, hard-working youth and businesswoman. In the photograph, she shows us the rustic stove on which at present she prepares the dishes that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cart with a grill to use for selling food.

loans.name: Mirada De Luz Group

texts.en:
Village Bank “Mirada de Luz” (View of Light) comprises 17 persevering members from the city of Talca.  Talca is a city in the region of Maule, in central Chile.  Most Maule residents work in rural areas, where they tend to farms and grow crops.  The region is best known for its colonial architecture and artisanal exports, in addition to its wineries.  Nevertheless, because the working population there has grown significantly, the region remains one of the poorest in Chile.

The main businesses run by the members of this village bank include ceramic work, jewelry making, shoe repair, clothing sales, and dressmaking workshops. 

Verónica, the founder of village bank “Mirada de Luz,” is pictured above in the first row, wearing black pants and a black shirt.  She buys and sells children’s clothing door-to-door.  Verónica also sells underwear and cheese, and she makes and sells pearl bracelets.  She has two children studying at the university level.  Her husband also works at his own independent business because he lost two of his fingers in an accident and had difficulty finding work because of this.  

Verónica plans to invest her portion of the group loan in merchandise.  Her dreams are to grow her business and have a store of her own in the city center, so that she can find economic stability that will help her maintain her quality of life as she ages.

For Verónica, Fondo Esperanza and her village bank, “Mirada de Luz,” have been a great moral help in addition to helping her economically.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en: Lê Nguyễn Thị (10105050007) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà Nội. She is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Hội (3). Lê is married and has one school-aged child. She operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month. In 2005, Lê joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,142,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lê is now requesting a new loan of 5,014,000 VND which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her 6th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Phạm Thị T. (10105050010) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 2. M. Thị D. (10105050013) is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business operating a butcher shop. 3. Bùi Thị N. (10105050011) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Lê Thị Hồng M. (10105050009) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 5. Nguyễn Thị B. (10105050012) is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Lê Nguyễn Thị (10105050007) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. Lê là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: Don Silvio es un padre de familia de tres hermosos hijos, que junto con su esposa esperan lograr darles una buena educación. Tiene 41 años de edad, su esposa trabaja vendiendo celulares para poder cubrir los gastos de agua, luz, entre otros ya que todo ha incrementado. Su trabajo es técnico de pista en bombas de gasolinera en donde lleva dos años laborando en esta empresa, pero en años anteriores también ha trabajado en el mismo cargo, y cuando estuvo desempleado vendía celulares para poder alimentar a su familia. Con el crédito anterior pudo comenzar el cuarto pero no lo termino por falta de capital es por esta razón comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, tablas para poder terminar el cuarto y una división que también desea hacer ya que la que tiene es de madera y esta ya muy vieja y en malas condiciones. Gracias a la institución por apoyar a hacer esta mejora en su vivienda y por la aprobación de más capital lo cual espera terminar la obra que comenzó.
texts.en:
Don Silvio is the father of a family with three beautiful children. He and his wife hope to succeed in giving them a good education. He is 41 years old. His wife works selling cellular phones to cover the costs of water and light, among other things, since everything has gone up in cost.

He works as a gasoline pump technician. He has been working in this business for two years, but he has worked at the same job in past years. When he was unemployed, he sold cellular phones to be able to feed his family. With his previous loan he was able to begin building the room but he did not finish it due to lack of capital. For this reason, he will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, and boards to be able to finish the room and a wall that he also wants to make, since what he has now is made of wood and is already very old and in bad condition. Thanks to the instituiton for its support in making this improvement in his home and for the approval of more capital, which he is waiting for to finish the work he began.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, and boards to be able to finish a room.

loans.name: Shalom 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the coordinator of her group called “Shalom” and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor in the eastern lowlands of the Dominican Republic where the economy is centered around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure of wooden walls and a tin roof with her husband and her son.

Josefina is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans without arrears. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and shoes by purchasing blue jeans, blouses and shoes. Her business model is to take orders for clothing and then to go to Santo Domingo and purchase the clothes in the main markets and come back to her community to sell the items at a profit. While 80% of her product is ordered in advance she will sell the rest by walking around the community and searching for clients.

Josefina will use the profits to invest in her home by completing the project her husband has started to replace the wooden walls with cement block. She also intends to continue investing in her family by purchasing medicine, school supplies and clothes for her son. In the long term her goal is to purchase a small plot of land so that she can construct her own home, as her current home is owned by her parents. She also plans to start university classes in business management soon. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more blouses, blue jeans and shoes to sell

Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Natalia Mariel

texts.es: Natalia tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, vive en el domicilio de sus abuelos. Trabaja en una empresa de productos comestibles como encargada de ventas además de trabajar como educadora en un jardín de niños, cuenta con amplia experiencia en ventas. Natalia no tiene competencia al ser asalariada ya que recibe sueldo por parte de sus empleadores. Solicito el crédito para realizar la compra de una computadora portátil (laptop). Natalia tiene un buen comportamiento de pagos, buena voluntad y capacidad de pago, solo trabaja con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Natalia tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, vive en el domicilio de sus abuelos. Trabaja en una empresa de productos comestibles como encargada de ventas además de trabajar como educadora en un jardín de niños, cuenta con amplia experiencia en ventas. Natalia no tiene competencia al ser asalariada ya que recibe sueldo por parte de sus empleadores. Solicito el crédito para realizar la compra de una computadora portátil (laptop). Natalia tiene un buen comportamiento de pagos, buena voluntad y capacidad de pago, solo trabaja con nuestra institución. Natalia is 27 years old, is single, and lives in her grandparents' house. She works in a company in a food products company where she is in charge of sales. She also works as a teacher at a kindergarten and has ample sales experience.Natalia does not have any competitors since she is a salaried employee, receiving a salary from her employers. She is asking for a loan to purchase a laptop. Natalia has made her payments, has goodwill and the ability to pay. She only works with our organization.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of laptop

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina es una persona dedicada a su familia su entorno familiar está constituido por su esposo y sus tres hijos. Segundina se dedica a la confección tiene un puesto en la Avenida Punata, paralelamente tiene un internet en la zona norte. En el caso de la confección es la única en la zona que se dedica a esa actividad siendo su trabajo de gran demanda, lo mismo sucede en el caso del internet solo existe el de la cliente en la zona, razón por la cual tiene buenos ingresos por sus servicios. Segundina es para gastos de salud, que incurrió para la curación de su hijo, se prestó dinero y lo devolverá con el crédito. Segundina es una buena cliente y con buen comportamiento de pagos en Agrocapital, siendo que en su último crédito solo tuvo un día de atraso en 18 cuotas.
texts.en:
Segundina is a person dedicated to her family; her family environment is made up of her husband and three children. Segundina is a seamstress and has a stall on Punata avenue; in parallel, she offers internet services in the north zone. On the seamstress business, she is the only one offering these services in the area and her services are in high demand. Segundina needs the money for health expenses that she incurred to treat her son; she borrowed money and she will pay it back with this loan. Segundina is a good client with a good payment record at Agrocapital, since in her last loan she was late 1 day once during her 18 payments.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Health expenses

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es: Florencio tiene 54 años de edad su estado civil es soltero, no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en una casa que es propia. Florencio se dedica a la venta de ganado vacuno, la carne la comercializa en las ferias de la ciudad donde vive.
