Florencio cuenta con una experiencia de 16 años de experiencia en este rubro su competencia es de nivel medio, esto debido a que cuenta con clientes fijos quienes lo prefieren por su responsabilidad en el trabajo. El presente crédito lo sacó para capital de operación, es decir para la adquisición de ganado vacuno. El presente es su tercer crédito en la institución en créditos anteriores trabajo de manera optima, no tiene obligaciones con las Entidades Financieras.
texts.en:
Florencio is 54 years old and single with no dependent children; he lives in a house he owns. Florencio sells beef cattle; he sells the beef in the markets in the city where he lives. He has worked in beef sales for 16 years and is very competent; he he has many customers who prefer to buy from him because he is responsible in his work. This loan will be used for working capital--to purchase more beef cattle. This is his third loan through the institution; he worked hard to repay his previous loans so that he no longer has other liabilities.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beef cattle--working capital

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es: Don Cesar es un padre de familia muy dedicado al trabajo, desde joven ha trabajado para sastifacer las necesidades de su familia, junto a su esposa trabajan para poder apoyar a sus dos hijos los cuales están el colegio. Su meta es poder darles una buena educación ya que ellos por falta de la economía de sus padres no lograron terminar. Su esposa comenzó a trabajar como domestica y con sus ingresos ayuda a pagar los gastos de agua, luz, y parte de gastos estudiantiles. El negocio de don Cesar es ebanista tiene once años elaborando bonitos muebles, puertas, camas, entre otros, toda esta experiencia la adquirió donde trabajaba como ayudante. Luego por gracias Adios y el apoyo de Afodenic logro poner su propio taller que hasta ahora administra. Las dificultades es que abecés la madera esta con costos muy alto, lo cual no alcanza para comprar lo suficiente para trabajar los encargos o para hacer la venta de muebles. Con este préstamo invertirá en comprar variedad de madera para poder terminar los muebles y poder quedar bien con sus clientes, a si como poner a la venta camas, sillas, ropero, todo con el fin de captar clientes nuevos, y mejores ingresos para una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Don Cesar is a father who is very dedicated to his work; since he was young, he has worked to provide for the necessities of life for his family. He works with his wife in order to support their two children who are in school. His goal is to give them a good education since he and his wife were not able to finish studying due to the financial situation of their parents. His wife started to work as a housekeeper and her earnings help to pay the water and electric expenses and part of the school expenses for their children. Don Cesar has worked as a carpenter for the past 11 years making beautiful furniture, doors, beds, and other pieces. He gained experience first by working as an apprentice. Later, thanks to God and the help of Afodenic, he was able to start his own workshop which he now runs. His challenge is that sometimes the cost of lumber is very high and he cannot afford to buy enough to fulfill his orders or to make his pieces. With this loan, he will purchase a variety of lumber to finish his furniture and fulfill his customers' orders; also he will build and sell beds, chairs, wardrobes, etc. in order to gain new customers and better income to be more stable economically for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lumber to make wardrobes, beds, chairs and other furniture

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 42 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, tiene un hijo que depende de él, la familia vive en casa que es propia. Julio se dedica a la actividad de venta de papa, chuño y tunta, comercializa en las ferias de la localidad donde vive. Julio cuenta con una experiencia de 19 años en este rubro, mismo que lo desempeña junto a su esposa. La competencia es media, porque Julio es responsable con sus clientes y sus puestos de venta están en la plena plaza. El presente crédito Julio lo utilizará para la compra de ganado lechero y cancelación saldo capital. Este es su tercer crédito en la institución, en sus créditos anteriores trabajo de manera optima, no tiene obligaciones con las  Entidades Financieras.
texts.en:
Julio is 42 years old and married. He has one dependent son and he and his family live in a house they own. Julio sells potatoes and potato flour in the markets of his neighborhood. He has worked in this field for 19 years with his wife. His competition is not too fierce because Julio is responsible with his customers and his stalls are in good locations in the markets. This loan will be used to purchase dairy cattle and to pay off his capital balances. This is his third loan with the institution and he worked hard to pay off all his previous loans so that he has no further liabilities.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cattle and pay off of capital balances

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johana E. de 22 años, vive en una casa de cemento solo tiene luz como servicio básico su vivienda esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja en una camioneta haciendo fletes tienen 1 hijo de 7 años que estudia en una escuela particular.

Johana hace 2 años atrás regreso de España  donde aprendió todo lo que se hace en los salones de belleza poco a poco empezó a hacer cortes de cabello y tratamientos. Ahora Johana tiene su propio salón de belleza en la que trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 22h00. Una de las dificultades que tiene es que la mayoría del tiempo tiene que estar de pie y eso hace que la circulación de la sangre en los pies le cause dolor.

Johana quiere comprar con el préstamo tratamientos, cremas, planchas para tener mas cosas en su salón de belleza. En el futuro quiere poner una sucursal del salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Johana is 22 years old. She lives in a cement house that only has basic electrical service. Her house is located in “The Paradise of Guayaquil”. Her husband works in the freight trucking business. They have one son that is seven years old and studies in a private school. Johana went to Spain two years ago where she learned everything that one does in a beauty salon. Little by little she began to cut hair and do treatments. Now Johana has her own beauty salon where she works from 7:30 in the morning until 10:00 at night. One of the difficulties that she has is that she has to be on her feet all the time and the lack of circulation to her feet causes her pain. Johana wants this loan to buy treatments, creams and shelves to display more items in her salon. In the future she wants to have a franchise of beauty salons

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams, treatments and display shelving.

loans.name: Victoria De

texts.es: Victoria tiene 41 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, tiene 6 hijos que dependen de ella y su esposo, toda la familia vive en una casa que es propia. Victoria se dedica a la venta  de papa, chuño y tunta, todos estos productos los comercializa en las ferias de la localidad y ciudad donde vive. Victoria trabaja en este rubro desde hace 14 años atrás, su esposo por otra parte es profesor trabaja en una unidad educativa de la provincia Aroma. La competencia de Victoria es media, debido a que es responsable con sus clientes, está sus puestos de venta en la plena plaza en cada feria. El presente crédito es para la compra de mercadería al por mayor “papa, chuño y tunta”. Este es su cuarto crédito en la institución, en sus créditos anteriores trabajo de manera optima, no tiene obligaciones con otra Entidades Financieras.
texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old. She is married and has 6 children who depend on her and her husband. The whole family lives in a house that is their own. Victoria sells potatoes, chuño and tunta (two types of freeze-dried potatoes). She sells all these products in the markets in the area and city where she lives. She has worked in this business for 14 years. Her husband, on the other hand, is a teacher. He works in an educational unit in the Aroma province. Victoria's competition is just average, because she deals responsibly with her clients, and her sales locations are in the middle of the plaza at every market.

The present loan is for the wholesale purchase of merchandise -- potatoes, chuño, and tunta. This is her fourth loan at the institution. With her previous loans, she worked in an optimal manner. She has no obligations with other financial entities.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale merchandise:  potatoes and freeze-dried potatoes

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en: M. Nguyễn Thị's main source of income comes from raising chickens for sale. M. is 35-year-old woman living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. M. is married and has two school-age children. M. has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 dong (VND) a month. In 2007, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.876.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.886.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her fifth loan from SEDA. M. plans to use the additional revenue to pay for the tuition fees of her children. M. is the leader of a six member group accessing a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members (if someone is delinquent or defaults). The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Kha (2). 10114060011 About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Trần Thị Thúy H. is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 10114060013 2. Nguyễn Thị N. is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 10114060012 3. Trần Thị G. is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business running a general store. 10114060015 4. Trần Thị D. is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. 10114060016 5. Nguyễn Thị K. is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 10114060014 About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. M. Nguyễn Thị (10114060011) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. M. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Kha (2). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2007, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. M. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.876.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.886.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Trần Thị Thúy H. (10114060013) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị N. (10114060012) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Trần Thị G. (10114060015) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 4. Trần Thị D. (10114060016) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 5. Nguyễn Thị K. (10114060014) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor vive en la casa de su hermana, es soltera y no tiene dependientes. Leonor se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos y perfumes por catalogo y sus principales clientes están en oficinas publicas, Bancos y empresas privadas. La competencia es alta en el rubro al cual se dedica, pero cuenta con clientela  que demanda sus productos, principalmente por los precios y plazos que otorga. Con el crédito incrementara su capital de operaciones,  puesto que tiene variados pedidos y para retirar los productos de la casa matriz, debe cancelar previamente. Este es el primer crédito al que accede la cliente y viene recomendada por la hermana quien es excelente cliente de nuestra Institución, la cual da muy buenas referencias personales y M..
texts.en:
Leonor lives in her sister's house, is single and has no children. She makes a living selling cosmetics and perfumes via catalog, and her main customers are public office workers, bankers and private business people. The competition is high in her trade, but she has a clientele that demands her products, mainly because of the prices and the payment plans. With the loan, she plans to increase her working capital to fulfill her various orders and to take products back to the company headquarters, which she should have done previously. This is the first loan granted to Leonor, and she comes recommended by her sister, who is an excellent client of this lending institution.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Virginia De

texts.es: Virginia tiene 36 años de edad, es casada cuenta con dos hijos, vive en su domicilio propio. Virginia se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de desayunos cuenta con amplia experiencia vende desde hace 13 años, es muy conocida en el sector donde es su mercado (pasaje en el centro de la ciudad) y además de preparar sándwiches, el conyugue es maestro albañil contratista se dedica a la construcción. Virginia no tiene competencia es la única persona que vende en el pasaje de la alcaldía. Virginia solicito el crédito para realizar compras de bienes para su hogar. En Agrocapital cuenta con muy buen comportamiento de pagos por lo que la misma tiene crédito paralelo el mismo que se le otorgo para la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Virginia is 36 years old, married, has two children and lives in her own home. She makes a living selling all kinds of breakfast items and has 13 years of experience. She is very well known in the area where she sells her products (on a street in the city center) and also prepares sandwiches. Her husband is a construction worker. Virginia does not have any competition since she is the only person who sells products on her street. She is requesting the loan to purchase goods for her home. Kiva partner Agrocapital has a very good history of payments and approved this credit to Virginia to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for her home

loans.name: Daniel Fernando

texts.es: Daniel es soltero, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en casa propia la cual fue financiada por nuestra institución desde la compra del lote de terreno. Daniel es empleado en un surtidor de la zona trabaja en un turno y en sus horarios libres se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su moto taxi. La competencia es media en sus dos actividades. Daniel destinará el crédito a la construcción de una habitación más en su casa. Daniel tiene excelentes referencias morales en la zona, su cumplimiento fue excelente en el pago de sus anteriores operaciones. Esta será su cuarta operación en la institución.
texts.en:
Daniel is 25 years old, single and lives in his own home, which was financed by this lending institution since he purchased the land. Daniel works at a regional gas station in shifts, and in his free time he makes a living transporting passengers in his moto-taxi. There is medium competition in both of his activities. Daniel plans to use the loan on building another room in his home. He has excellent moral references and his payment history was excellent in his previous loans. This will be his fourth loan through this lending institution.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a room to his home

loans.name: Đặng Thị's Group
loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Tambopata De Tipon Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TAMBOPATA D. TIPON”, Nuestros socios están situados en L. comunidad D. Tipón, en el departamento D. Cusco. Esta zona es conocida como área D. esparcimiento y famosa por sus restaurantes al aire libre en toda L. carretera, ellos venden chicharrones (platos típicos en base D. cerdo, papas, doradas, choclo en granos y ensalada), y en el sector D. Tipón venden una parte chicharrones y otros cuyes al horno.

Nuestros socios alternan sus actividades con el comercio, ellos trabajan en L. crianza D. animales menores, compran y venden cuyes, pollos, gallinas, cerdos; ellos crían a estos animales desD. su tierna etapa y después D. algún tiempo que consiguen engordarlos y que se reproduzcan, los socios que se dedican a este rubro, llegado el tiempo D. L. madurez D. los animales los venden y nuevamente toman otra temporada D. compra y crianza y engorD., otros 4 socios se dedica a L. compra y venta D. cervezas y gaseosas al por mayor y distribuyen a los diferentes restaurantes D. L. zona que se dedican a L. venta D. chicharrones y cuyes, como (cuy al horno, cuy chactado),  otros 3 socios tienen tiendas D. abarrotes para abastecer a L. zona D. productos diversos para sus cocinas, como (azúcar, sal, leche, aceite, verduras, arroz, fideos etc.)otra socia venD. desayunos y todo tipo D. snack, otras 2 socias venden ropa y cosméticos, por catálogos.

Nuestra socia L. Sra. Cintia MarceL. B. C., tiene 28 años D. edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, L. socia cría cuyes desD. el año 2002, elL. comenzó con 20 cuyes y se fueron reproduciendo poco a poco, L. socia compra cuyes y al cabo D. un cierto tiempo en el cual los cuyes alcanzan L. madurez los venD., nuestra socia tiene 2 galpones (espacios o corrales pequeños seguidos)a L. fecha L. socia tien 300 cuyes y los va vendiendo, ahora L. socia solicita el préstamo para implementar sus galpones y comprar cuyes machos para aumentar su negocio, nuestra socia desea llegar a 800 cuyes para tener mejor ingreso economico.

Los socios agradecen y valoran L. oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se comprometen en cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Tambopata D. Tipón Communal Bank. Our members are situated in the Tipón community in the department of Cusco. The region is known for its recreation areas, and it is famous for its open air restaurants on all of the roads. They sell “chicharrones” (typical dishes containing pork with roasted potatoes, sweet corn, and salad). In the Tipón area some sell chicharrones, and others sell baked guinea pigs. Our members have different commercial activities. Among them are raising small animals, buying guinea pigs, chickens, hens, and pigs. They raise them, and in time they fatten them, and the animals reproduce. The members who work in this field sell the animals. Then they buy animals and start again in another season. Another group of members sells beer and soft drinks wholesale. They distribute them to different restaurants in the area that sell baked pork and guinea pigs. Other members have grocery stores to supply the regions with diverse products for their kitchens. Another member sells breakfast and all types of snacks. Another group sells clothes and cosmetics. Mrs. Cintia MarceL. B. C. is 38 years old and lives with her partner and their son. She has been raising guinea pigs since 2002. She started with 20 guinea pigs, which eventually reproduced. She buys guinea pigs, and once they are full-grown she sells them. She has two sheds to house her guinea pigs, which today house 300 guinea pigs, which she sells on a regular basis. She is requesting the loan to improve her sheds and buy more male guinea pigs to expand her business. She goal is to have 800 guinea pigs so that she can boost her income. The members are grateful for and value the loan, and they promise to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La socia desea el préstamo para implementar sus galpone y comprar cuyes para la venta.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria Luisa tiene 54 años de edad, es divorciada hace varios años y vive con su hijo de 16 años, vive en casa propia. Su hijo salió bachiller recientemente. Maria Luisa se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir generalmente para damas, no tiene puesto fijo pero si tiene buena clientela en las instituciones donde entrega su mercadería, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años. Maria Luisa tiene competencia en su rubro pero debido a su experiencia ella tiene mercado asegurado, tiene bastantes amistades las cuales les recomiendan a más clientes por la calidad de prendas que ella vende. Maria Luisa en esta oportunidad traerá ropa de otra ciudad, ya que en la temporada de verano tendrá mucho pedido, por otra parte tendrá gastos de consumo. Maria Luisa trabaja también con otra entidad financiera desde hace tiempo. Es muy buena cliente en nuestra institución y no tiene malos antecedentes crediticios.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is 54 years old and has been divorced for many years. She lives with her sixteen year old son in their own house. Her son recently received his high school diploma. Maria Luisa sells clothes, primarily for women. She doesn’t have her own store but she has good customer base in the institutions where she delivers her merchandise. She has been doing this business for many years. Maria is a competent businesswoman with a steadfast clientele. She has many friends that recommend her to other customers because she sells good quality clothes. Maria Luisa has an opportunity to bring her clothes to another city that has a lot of business during the summer months. If she does this she will have additional costs. Maria Luisa has worked with another financial entity for a long time. She is a good customer in our institution and has a good credit record

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expenses

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es: La señora Feliza es casada, cuenta con casa propia, tiene 49 años de edad, cuenta con 1 hijo de 25 años. Feliza cuenta con la actividad de la elaboración y venta de enaguas con 14 años de experiencia en este rubro. Cuenta con demanda ya que vende su producto realizando viajes al desaguadero, Oruro y distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. El destino del crédito fue para capital de operación, compra de material de trabajo. La señora Feliza cuenta con experiencia crediticia en otras entidades financieras y Agrocapital, en este último con 2 años de experiencia. No cuenta con antecedentes negativos según centrales de riesgo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Feliza is married and has her own house. She is 49 years old and has a 25-year-old son. Feliza makes and sells petticoats. She has 14 years of experience in this line of work. She travels to different locations according to customer demand. She travels to Oruro and other fairs in the city of El Alto. She would like this loan for operating capital and to buy material for her work. Mrs. Feliza has experience with other credit unions and with Agrocapital. In the last two years she has not had any negative marks on her credit rating.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Sara Vda De

texts.es: Sara en una señora que tiene 64 años de edad, Sara es viuda y vive en domicilio en alquiler en una localidad de Cochabamba. Sara es rentista por viudez de parte de su esposo, además cuenta con ingresos que le paga su hijo por cuidar a sus nietos ya que el mismo esta en el exterior del país. Cuenta también con ingresos adicionales por trabajar en una salteñeria los fines de semana como cocinera. Sara no tiene competencia al ser rentista y los ingresos adicionales que recibe de parte de sus hijos por cuidar de sus nietos es directa. Sandra solicitó el crédito para realizar compras de fin de año para su hogar. Sandra demostró tener un muy buen comportamiento de pagos en las varias secuencias de crédito solicitadas en nuestra institución así como en otra entidad financiera donde también cuenta con crédito.
texts.en:
Sara is 64 years old. She is a widow and lives in a rented home in Cochabamba. Sara supports herself by means of a widow's pension and money her son sends her. He lives outside of Bolivia and she uses the money to care for her grandchildren. She also depends on the additional income she earns cooking on the weekends at a salteñeria. Sara does not have the skills to invest her income and she spends the money her children give her to care for her grandchildren. Sara is requesting a loan to make end of the year purchases for her home. Sara has proven to be reliable in making repayments on past credit sequences with Fundación AgroCapital and an additional financial entity.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items for her home

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: La familia de Pedro está conformada por el cliente, su conyugue y 4 hijos de 14, 11, 8  y 3 años todos viven en la misma casa que es de propiedad del señor Pedro. Él se dedica a la jardinería desde hace unos 20 años atrás, la cual realiza sus trabajos a domicilio, su cónyuge se dedica a la venta de frutas de acuerdo a la temporada. Pedro realiza sus trabajos a domicilio, el cual le ha permitido adquirir clientela de manera fija, su cónyuge vende las frutas hace bastante tiempo lo cual le ha permitido posesionarse bien en el mercado de ambulante por lo que la competencia es mínima. Pedro requiere el crédito para la compra de material de construcción ya que como empieza la época de las lluvias no quiere tener percances en su vivienda. Este es su cuarto crédito con Agrocapital, tienen un excelente cumplimiento de pago  a la fecha solo tiene crédito con nosotros.
texts.en:
Pedro's family is formed of himself, his wife, and his four children, who are 14, 11, 8, and 3 years old. They all live in the same home, which Pedro owns. He has been a gardener for 20 years and his wife sells seasonal fruits. Pedro works at his clients homes, which permits him to have clients in fixed locations. His wife has sold her fruit for a while, and this has allowed her to position herself in the local market, where there is little competition. Pedro seeks this loan to purchase construction materials for his home since the rainy season has begun and he doesn't want anything to happen to his home. This is his fourth loan with Agrocapital. He has an excellent record making his payments. To date, he only has received loans through our organization.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Ana Guadalupe tiene 43 años de edad, casada y con un hijo, su esposo trabaja como supervisor  en una gasolinera esso, el negocio de ella es la venta de prenda de plata como oro laminado, ropa, zapatos, desde hace seis años se dedica solo a su venta, cuando inicio lo hizo con parte de su liquidación  de trabajo y con el apoyo de su esposo para poder ayudar a cubrir los gastos de alimentación, ya que todo esta caro y hay que tener la iniciativa de obtener mejores entradas para poder subsistir y poder lograr los objetivos propuestos. Por falta de capital no tiene ropa solo prendas es por eso necesita invertir en ropa para uniformes para poder vender como: faldas, camisas, pantalones, calcetas, camisolines y comprar variedad de prendas para aumentar el inventario del negocio el cual espera a largo plazo llegar  atener una pequeña tienda en su casa. Contenta con el financiamiento ya que gracias a este préstamo comprara la mercadería para vender y sastifacer al cliente con las necesidades, ya que muchas de estas prendas las da al crédito de la quincena debido a la falta económica de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana Guadalupe is 43 years old. She is married with a son. Her husband works as supervisor at an Esso gas station. Her business is selling silver jewelry items such as gold laminate as well as clothing and shoes. She has been engaged solely in selling for six years. When she started, she did it with a part of the severance from her job. With the support of her husband, she was able to help cover living expenses, since everything is expensive and you must have initiative to get better income and be able to get by and obtain your goals. Due to a lack of funds, she has no clothing, only jewelry. This is why she neds to invest in clothing for uniforms to be able to sell such as: skirts, shirts, pants, socks, undershirts, and to purchase a variety of clothing to grow the business' inventory. Her long term goal is to have a little store at her house. She is happy with the financing since thanks to this loan she will purchase merchandise to sell and satisfy clients with what they need. She sells a lot of the jewelry on two week credit due to the financial need of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school uniform clothing such as: skirts, socks, and various jewelry items for her clients.

loans.name: Ampliacion Villa El Polvorin Group

texts.es:
MIRIAM, TIENE 38 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA, TIENE 4 HIJOS DOS MENORES DE EDAD Y 2 MAYORES. HACE DOS AÑOS INTEGRA EL GRUPO "AMPLIACIÓN VILLA EL POLVORIN", ACTUALMENTE ES LA SECRETARIA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO, ELEGIDA POR SUS 9 COMPAÑEROS, QUIENES RESIDEN EN EL ASENTAMIENTO HUMANO "VILLA EL POLVORIN", EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
MIRIAM, SE DEDICA HACE SEIS AÑOS, A LA ADMINISTRACIÓN DE UNA BODEGA DE SU PROPIEDAD, LA CUAL FUNCIONA EN SU DOMICILIO. ELLA INICIÓ EN ÉSTE NEGOCIO, POR QUE QUERÍA SER INDEPENDIENTE, GANARSE SU DINERO Y APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES. FUÉ SU ESPOSO EL QUE LA APOYÓ PARA INCIAR SU BODEGA, BRINDÁNDOLE PARTE DE SU SUELDO PARA ABASTECER POR PRIMERA VEZ SU PEQUEÑA BODEGA,LA CUAL HA IDO CRECIENDO POCO A POCO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ PARA AUMENTAR EL STOCK DE PRODUCTOS DE SU BODEGA.
texts.en:
Miriam is 38 years old, married and has four children. Two of who are still young and 2 older kids. She has been a member of the Group "Ampliacióm Villa el Polvorín" since two years ago; she is currently the group’s board secretary. She was chosen by her 9 group partners, who live in “Villa el polvorin” neighborhood, Carabayllo district.

Miriam has been dedicated for the last six years to the administration of a grocery shop that she owns at her house. She started this business, because she wanted to be independent, make money and support her husband with the family expenses. Her husband supported her to start the grocery shop and gave her part of his salary to stock the shop, which has been growing little by little. The loan that she is requesting will be invested to restock the shop.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INVERTIR EN SU BODEGA

loans.name: Pensando En El Futuro 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en: Sonia plans to use this loan to invest in her nail salon by purchasing a machine to polish nails as well as glue, cotton and the acrylic nails themselves. She makes her home in the Samana peninsula in a simple structure. Her group is located in a lush but rugged strip of land with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She is a single mother with three children. Sonia is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is very excited to be starting her own business. She will use the profits gained from this business to invest in improving her home as well as saving towards buying a computer for her children to learn on. Her long term goal is to turn her business into a profitable enterprise that will help her to own a car and to send her children to university so that they can be professionals. She thanks you all for your support. Sonia is the coordinator of her group "Pensando en el Fulturo" (Thinking About the Future) and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally.

loans.use: To buy a polishing machine, glue, acrylic nails and cotton

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo C. M., tiene la edad de 40 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 16 y 9 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de novillas de terneros y la compra de una vaca de leche,el señor cuenta con una área de pasto donde tendrá a los animales para su crianza, el está seguro de que puede darle un buen mantenimiento y así cuando las venda obtener una ganancia. Es la primera vez que se financea con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, ya que por la ayuda ha logrado sacar adelante los diferentes proyectos que se ha planteado, además que está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, estudios y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Rodolfo Chacon Marin is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children, who are his top priority. His sons are 16 and 9 years old, respectively. He wants the loan to buy calves and a dairy cow. Mr. Chacon Marin has a pasture where he will raise the animals; he is sure he can care for them well and thus sell them for a profit. This is his first time financing with FUDECOSUR. He says that the credit committee has helped him a lot, since the aid has allowed him to move forward with the various projects he has considered taking on. He is also very happy with the facilities provided to him. In the future, he hopes to provide his children with a better quality of life, schooling, and improved economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Livestock

loans.name: Faty

texts.fr: FAty K. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans et y a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés. Avec son crédit elle fait de la transformation de produit local, elle extrait de l'huile d'arachide pour le commercialiser en suite au niveau de son village et dans le marché. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge sa progéniture et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Faty K., 50, is a widow and the mother of 5 children, for whom she is still responsible. She has been a member of the Village Bank of SIWAL for 2 years and has received four loans which she used wisely and reimbursed in full. With this loan, she will be extracting peanut oil from local peanuts to sell in her village and at the market. Her profit will allow her to support her children and save a bit more money.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Ricardo Manuel

texts.es:
Ricardo C. de 44 años, vive en una casa de cemento en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa le ayuda con los gastos familiares vendiendo cosméticos tiene 2 hijos uno de 18 y  otro de 12 años los dos estudiando en una escuela fiscal.

Ricardo empezó hace 10 años atrás como ayudante en un negocio de radio- técnico. Poco a poco comenzó a reunir dinero y pudo instalar un pequeño taller de reparación. En la actualidad Ricardo trabaja de lunes a sábado con su hijo de 18 años arreglando radios, juegos de video y televisores. Hasta ahora no ha tenido complicaciones en su actividad.

Con el préstamo Ricardo quiere comprar un cautín, multímetro, repuestos para tener más facilidad en su negocio. En el futuro quiere ampliar su taller y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Ricardo C. is 44 years old and lives in a cement house in the Paraíso neighborhood of Guyaquil. His wife helps him with family expenses by selling cosmetics. They have two children, 18 and 12. They both are studying at a legal school. Ten years ago Ricardo started as an assistant in a radio repair shop. Little by little he gathered up enough money and built a small repair shop of his own. Currently Ricardo works from Monday to Saturday with his 18-year old son repairing radios, video games, and televisions. He has not had any problems with his business so far. With the loan Ricardo wants to buy a soldering iron, a multimeter, and spare parts to improve his business. In the future he would like to add on to his shop and make improvements on his home.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soldering iron, multimeter, and spare parts

loans.name: Genaro Deciderio

texts.es: El señor Genaro Deciderio R. V., tiene 58 años de edad, vive en el Barrio El Rodeo es casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio, ellos  tienen 5 hijos  de los cuales dos de los mayores están casados, los otros viven de manera independiente pero les ayudan en los trabajos de la casa y la finca, ellos se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 17 años, el problema que esto les ha traído, han sido la falta de financiamiento de parte de los organismos, para el apoyo a este sector, los planes a futuro serian el poder sembrar café, para esto necesitarían invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, que le proporcione a la cosecha mejores condiciones que le beneficien en la venta del mismo. Esto les traerá mayores utilidades  que podrían reinvertirlo en otros proyectos de la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Genaro Deciderio R. V. is 58 years old and lives in the El Rodeo neighborhood. He is married, and his wife works as a vendor. They have five children, the two eldest of whom are married, the rest live independently but they help their parents with housework and work on the farm. They have worked as farmers for 17 years. A difficulty they have faced is a lack of credit offered by the different organizations that support this sector. Their future plans are to plant coffee trees. To do this they need to purchase fertilzers which will result in a better harvest and will help them sell their product. The higher sales will allow them to reinvest the movey in other family projects.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supllies (fertilizer) to improve/maintain harvest

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N. est âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DJIMINI depuis juin 2007 et a eu 5 expériences avec le crédit. Son prêt lui permet de renforcer son activité de restauration. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge familiale et d'augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Awa N., 46, is married and the mother of 8 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of DJIMINI since June 2007 and has received 5 loans over that period. Her loans permit her to bolster her little cooked food production and sales business. Her goal is to help support her family and add to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Kakounding

texts.fr: Kankounding est une femme de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KADIOR depuis 8 ans et a été 8 fois de suite bénéficiaire de prêts. Son objectif est de mieux développer son activité de vente de bouillie de mil, une bouillie qu'elle sert sous forme de repas tous les soirs. Avec ses bénéfices elle assure partiellement la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Kakounding, 51, is married and the mother of 3 children who are all enrolled in school. She has been a member of the Village Bank of KADIOR for 8 years and has received 8 consecutive loans. Her goal is to expand her little business selling millet porridge, which she serves up at dinnertime every evening. With her earnings, she helps support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Flor De Tuna Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Flor D. Tuna” esta representado por la señora Virginia y compuesta por 11 miembros muy trabajadores y emprendedores, cada uno D. los socios tiene una familia que mantener es por esto que todas las mañanas salen al mercado a vender sus productos con la esperanza D. poder generar una ganancia para mantener en pie sus hogares. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la comercialización y elaboración D. artesanía, costura D. mochilas y carteras, a la venta D. verduras y productos para hogar como detergentes, abarrotes y electrodomésticos. En el mercado en el cual desarrollan sus actividades existe bastante competencia por lo que alguna vez las socias deben mover sus puestos D. venta a zonas periféricas para poder rescatar su capital e incrementar sus ingresos. El destino del financiamiento es para capital D. trabajo y la compra D. mercadearía e insumos para agrandar sus negocios y multiplicar sus ventas generando así un mejor ingreso que permita darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia del grupo una gran mayoría ya trabajo bajo la modalidad D. bancos comunales gracias a créditos similares, estando agradecidos con la Institución por el apoyo económico y la confianza brindada ya que eso representa que puedan seguir creciendo y poder soñar con un futuro mejor para sus familias.
texts.en:
The members of the group Flor D. Tuna are respresented by Mrs. Virginia and is maD. up of 11 hard-working and entreprenurial members. Everyone in the group has a family to support and this why every morning they go to the market to sell their products with the hope of earning enough money to mantain their homes. The majority of the members work selling and making crafts, sewing bags and wallets, vegetables, and products like detergent, groceries, and appliances. In the market where they sell their products their is a lot of competition, so the members plan to move their stands to peripheral areas to increase their sales. The loan will be used for the purchase of products and supplies to grow their businesses and increase their sales thus generating better incomes so they can proviD. for their families. The majority of the group has experience working with different community banks and are thankful to the institution por the monetary support and trust placed in them. This support and trust will allow them to continue growing and dream of a better future for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Retoño Group

texts.es: El banco  comunal "Retoño" esta representado por la señora Jenoveba y conformada por 14 miembros que van cursando juntos un tercer ciclo demostrando unidad y solidaridad con sus compañeros, son un grupo alegre y muy cumplido por lo que se les brinda un nuevo apoyo económico para que sigan creciendo y desarrollando un capital D. trabajo suficiente para mejorar su calidad D. vida. Una gran Mayoría D. los socios se dedica al ámbito comercial como la venta D. refrescos, venta D. comida, venta D. ropa para niños y jóvenes y venta D. perfumes (Avon, Esika y Ebel), otros se dedican a prestar servicios como el transporte, peluquería, odontología, costura y mecánica dental. Todos se dedican muy conscientemente a sus negocios y saben lo importante que es  tratar bien a los clientes ya que esa es la diferencia con sus competidores. El des tino del financiamiento es para la inversión en sus fuentes D. trabajo como la compra D. insumos, materiales D. trabajo y herramientas mas modernas para prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Entre las expectativas D. los clientes esta la educación D. sus hijos que es primordial para cada uno D. los socios así como el deseo D. la superación personal con cursos y negocios mas fructíferos que brinden una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias.
texts.en:
The community bank "Retoño" is represented by Mrs. Jenoveba and is maD. up of 14 members who are completed a third cycle together showing unity and solidarity with their partners. They are a happy group and reliable with their payments which is why they were offered new economic support so that they can continue to grow and develop sufficient capital to improve their quality of life. A large majority of the members work in the commercial sector selling drinks, food, children's clothing, and perfume sales (Avon, Esika, and Ebel). Others work in the service sector in areas like transport, hairdressing, dentistry, sewing, and dental services. They are all conscientious workers with their businesses and they know how important it is to treat the clients well because that differentiates them from their competitors. The loan will be used to invest in their different businesses by purchasing supplies, work materials, and modern tools in order to offer better service to their clients. The primary hope of the group is good education for their children as well as personal improvement and more profitable businesses which will proviD. a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations (sales and services)

loans.name: Oscar Vicente

texts.es: El señor Oscar Vicente R., tiene 33 años de edad, habita con su familia en el Barrio Buena Vista, es acompañado y su mujer trabaja como comerciante, tiene una hija de 8 años la cual comienza a estudiar la escuela primaria y un hijo de13, ellos se dedican al cultivo de la piña y Granos Básicos desde hace 12 años, uno de los problemas que ha enfrentado en los últimos años, ha sido los problema de  sequía y la afectación de plagas, inicio su negocio gracias a la reforma agraria, su padre se integro a la cooperativa y lo  fue involucrando poco a poco a las actividades del campo, dentro de los planes que tiene son el obtener los recursos necesarios para diversificar su producción, para esto necesita de un préstamo con el que pueda comprar insumos tales como fertilizantes y brindarle los nutrientes necesarios a su cultivo y mejorar la cosecha, esto les traerá a la familia mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Vicente R. is 33 years old and lives with his family in the Buena Vista neighborhood. His wife works as a vendor, and he has an 8-year old daughter, who is in elementary school, and a 13-year old son. They have grown pineapples and basic grains for 12 years. One of the problems that he has faced in the last few years is draughts and insent infestation. He started his business thanks to agrarian reform. His father joined the cooperative and became involved in rural activities little by little. Oscar's plans include obtaining the necessary resources to diversify his products. This is why he needs the loan, which he will use to buy supplies like fertilizer to provide the necessary nutrients to his crops and improve his harvest. This will help improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies to maintain crops

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D. est une veuve de 72 ans et a 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois de puis 7 ans et demi. Son activité est la vente de savon et balais traditionnels et de jus de citron. Son objectif est de participer aux différentes dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Awa D. is a 72-year old widow who supports four children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for seven and a half years. Her business is selling soap and traditional brooms as well as lemon juice. Her aim is to contribute to the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Dominga Leisla

texts.es:
La señora Dominga Leisla S. con gran ahínco se dedica a la actividad de pulpería atendiéndola en el departamento de León donde oferta gran variedad de productos a sus clientes entre los que se encuentran comestibles y productos varios.
Sus inicios fueron muy duros hace 15 años ya que vendía pocos productos en una mesa de madera pero hoy en día ha logrado surtir los productos y ha salido adelante gracias a sus esfuerzos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de los productos para la pulpería entre los que se encuentran los comestibles y los productos personales. Ella espera ser beneficiada con su crédito para continuar con su actividad de pulpería y así beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Dominga Leisla S. works with great enthusiasm at her grocery store in the department of León. She offers a great variety of products to her customers, including food items and general merchandise. Things were very difficult in the beginning, 15 years ago. She sold just a few products from a wooden table. Today, she has managed to increase her inventory and has made success due to her efforts. With this loan, Dominga will buy products for the store, such as food and personal care products. She hopes she will be granted this loan to continue her grocery business and provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products for general store

loans.name: Dinamicas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Dinámicas"  esta representado por la señora Maritza y conformada 10 miembros los cuales van cursando ya un segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y ganas D. salir adelante. La gran mayoría D. las socias se dedican a las actividades comerciales como la venta D. empanadas y pan casero, venta D. asados, cosméticos, comida, tarjetas, ropa y la atención en licorerías. En cuanto a la competencia del mercado podemos mencionar que es alta pero las socias siempre saben como salir adelante ya que tienen experiencia en sus rubros. El destino del financiamiento   es para la compra material D. trabajo y comprar D. insumos en mayor cantidad, incrementando sus ganancias y así poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.  En cuanto a las expectativas D. las socias todas desean poder tener su casa propia por lo que su esfuerzo es para ello ya que desean darles un techo estable a sus hijos y un mejor futuro para cada uno D. ellos.
texts.en:
The Dinámicas Communal Bank is represented by Maritza and comprised of ten members. They are in their second cycle, and they demonstrate punctuality and the desire to get ahead. Most of the members work in commercial activities like selling empanadas and homemaD. bread, selling roasted meats, cosmetics, food, cards, clothes, and operating liquor stores. As far as the competition in the market goes, it is high. But, the members always know how to get ahead because they have experience in their fields. The loan is to buy work materials and supplies in greater quantities. This will increase their earnings and allow them to give their families a better quality of live. As far as the members’ expectations go, they wish to be able to have their own homes. That is why they put forth so much effort. They want to give their children a stable roof over their heads and give each one of them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Julia Elida

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Julia P. se dedica a laborar arduamente para llevar a cabo su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por varios años ha estado en malas condiciones pero que hoy requiere ser mejorada. Ella ha solicitado un crédito con el fin de utilizarlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para así llevar a cabo esta obra que le urge realizar para beneficio de toda su familia.
Ella es madre soltera y con un hijo en edad escolar al que debe mantener y brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo y un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Julia P. works arduously in the department of León to achieve her dream of improving the conditions of her house. It has been in bad condition for several years, and it now needs to be fixed. She has asked for a loan to buy construction materials. That way she can accomplish this job that urgently needs to be done for the benefit of the whole family. She is a single mother with a school-age child. She needs to support him and give him the conditions necessary in life for him to develop, and she needs to give him a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: 15 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal "15 D. Diciembre" esta representado por la señora Nancy y conformada por 15 miembros que van participando ya en su tercer ciclo demostrando siempre puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Todos los miembros tienen actividades comerciales como la crianza y comercialización D. cerdos, la venta D. comida, ropa, refrescos, frutas, cosméticos y al servicio D. peluquería y lavandera. 

Nancy que es la presidenta D. este lindo grupo se dedica a la cría y venta D. chanchitos tiene una experiencia D. 2 años en este rubro, Martha se dedica a la venta D. soda desD. hace 1 años atrás, Maria Isabel venD. cosméticos desD. hace 2 años atrás, Juana venD. empanadas desD. hace 2 años atrás, Maria Renee venD. comida y tiene experiencia en el rubro D. 1 año, Cristina es comerciante D. ropa desD. hace 5 años atrás, Sonia también es comerciante D. ropa solo que a diferencia D. Cristina tiene menos años D. experiencia solo cuenta con 2 años, Martha se dedica a lavar ropa desD. hace 15 años atrás, Angel venD. refresco D. manera ambulante él se encuentra en este rubro desD. hace 2 años, Maria del Carmen se dedica a la venta D. comida tiene una amplia experiencia en este rubro(24 años), Yessica Denise se dedica a la venta D. frutas desD. hace 10 años atrás. Lucinda es promotora D. cosméticos y tiene una experiencia D. 7 años, Carola se dedica a la producción D. alimentos específicamente prepara cena para vender tiene experiencia en este negocio D. 1 año y por último está Rosa Liliana quién también es promotora D. cosméticos desD. hace 5 años atrás. 

En cuanto al entorno competitivo se pueD. mencionar que es difícil pero las socias saben como salir adelante con su negocios ya sea saliendo a mercados periféricos o diversificando su mercadería para poder obtener el ingreso necesario para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. alimento balanceada al por mayor, herramientas D. peluquería mas modernos, insumos, materiales y mercadería D. verano para la época. En cuanto a sus expectativas ellas trabajan para la educación D. sus hijos y para poder darles un hogar mas estable por lo que siempre piensan en el futuro y el bien estar D. sus familias; por lo tanto su mayor expectativa es que ellos puedan salir con una profesión y así mejorar cada día mas.
texts.en:
The 15 D. Diciembre Communal Bank is represented by Nancy and comprised of 15 members. They are in their third cycle, and the have always been punctual and responsible with their payments. All of the members have commercial activities like raising and selling pigs, selling food, soft drinks, fruit, cosmetics, and hairdressing and laundry services. Nancy is the president of this lovely group. For the past two years, she has been raising and selling pigs. Martha has been selling soda for the past year, Maria Isabel has been selling cosmetics for the past two years, Juana has been selling empanadas (meat pastries) for the past two years, Maria Renee has a year of experience selling clothing, Cristina has been selling clothing for five years, and Sonia also sells clothes but has just two years of experience. Martha has been washing clothes for the past 15 years, Angel sells drinks on the street and has two years of experience in this area, Maria del Carmen has a lot of experience (24 years) selling meals, and Yessica Denise has been selling fruit for the past 10 years. Lucinda sells cosmetics and has seven years of experience, Carola has been serving dinners for a year, and finally, Rosa Liliana also sells cosmetics, which she has been doing for the past five years. As far as competition goes, it is difficult. But, the members know how to get ahead with their businesses. They go to outlying markets or diversify their merchandise to be able to get the necessary income to support their families. The loan is to buy balanced food wholesale, more modern tools for hairdressing, supplies, materials, and summer merchandise for the season. As far as expectations go, they work to educate their children and to be able to give them a more stable home. They always think of the future and the well being of their families. Their biggest expectation is that their children are able to become professionals and improve more each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Todas los días desde las cinco de la mañana en el mercado La Terminal de León la señora Magda L. abre su negocio de venta de bebidas y café ofreciendo todo tipo de bebidas como gaseosas, jugos, agua y el café que nunca falta. También vende alimentos que son preparados por ella misma y ofrecidos a sus clientes.
Ella es una dama muy trabajadora que siempre está dedicándose a su venta y busca la manera de cómo llevar a su casa el sustento de cada día. Ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos a los que debe de mantener y proporcionarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para que ellos se desarrollen. El crédito lo utilizará en la compra de las bibidas gaseosas, jugos, agua en botella y cafe para continuar ofreciendolas en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Every day at 5 o'clock in the morning at the La Terminal de León market, Magda L. opens her refreshments stall. She sells all types of beverages such as soda, juice, water and a never-ending supply of coffee. She also sells snacks that she herself makes and serves to her customers. Magda is always hard at work and looking for a way to provide for her family. Magda is single and has four children that she has to support and to whom she has to provide the necessary living conditions so they can grow. She will use the loan to buy soft drinks, juice, bottled water and coffee to continue offering these goods in her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks and supplies to make food

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr: Sira DIAITE est une femme de 28 ans, elle mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KADIOR depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle achète en gros du poisson pour aller le revendre au détail dans son quartier. Elle assure une partie de la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Sira DIAITE is a 28-year old woman who is married with four children. She has been a member of the village bank in KADIOR for eight and a half years. She buys fish wholesale to sell it retail in her neighborhood. She assumes part of the family's responsibilities.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build up her fish selling business

loans.name: Estrella Oriental Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal " Estrella Oriental"  Esta representado por la señora Cecilia Andrea y conformado por 12 miembros las cuales 11 son mujeres y un solo varón, todas son amigas muy unidas, activas y emprendedoras las cuales van cursando un segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y capacidad D. pago. Entre las actividades que realizan esta la venta D. venta D. ropa, ropa americana, venta D. comida en pensiones en sus domicilios, venta D. tarjetas calendarios, otras se dedican a la coinfección D. prendas D. vestir, cortinas y la repostería tradicional, algunas cuentan con locales comerciales en sus domicilios propios en casetas en alquiler y otras trabajan D. forma ambulante; algunas tienen ingresos extras con la venta D. cosméticos por catálogo. 

Más a detalle se pueD. mencionar lo siguiente: Cecilia Andrea que es la presidenta del grupo se dedica a la venta D. comida tiene una experiencia D. 15 años en el rubro, Bertha se dedica a la venta D. tarjetas desD. hace 2 años, Elar tiene un puesto donD. venD. celulares	desD. hace 3 años, Karina es peluquera y atienD. en su salón D. belleza desD. hace 2 años, Hilda cuenta con una venta D. comida la que atienD. desD. hace 1 año, Renalia se dedica a la venta polleras desD. hace 2 años atrás, Josefa que se dedica a la venta D. ropa desD. hace 20 años atrás, Fabiola venD. comida hace 1 año, Senovia también se dedica a la venta D. comida solo que ella tiene una experiencia D. 12 años, Melvis también se dedica a la venta D. comida y tiene más experiencia (14 años), Delicia venD. ropa desD. hace 1 año, Marisol percibe un ingreso por concepto D. arrendar una movilidad ella se dedica a este negocio desD. hace 10 años. 

En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores siempre están presentes pero las socias se las arreglan para sacar adelantes sus negocios ya sea diversificando su mercadería o con la venta ambulante en zonas periféricas D. la ciudad que eles permite generar el movimiento necesario para el sustento D. sus familias. 

El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. material D. trabajo, insumos al por mayor y la mejora D. sus viviendas para darles mayor comodidad a sus familias. En cuanto a las expectativas D. las socias todas desean poder tener su casa propia por lo que su esfuerzo es para ello ya que desean darles un techo estable a sus hijos y un mejor futuro para cada uno D. ellos.
texts.en:
The Estrella Oriental Communal Bank is represented by Cecilia Andrea and comprised of 12 members. Eleven are women, and there is only one man. All of them are very united friends, who are active and entrepreneurial. They are in their second cycle, and they demonstrate responsibility and the capacity to pay. Among the activities they do is selling clothes, American clothes, selling food in boarding houses in their homes, and selling calendar cards. Others make articles of clothing, curtains, and traditional pastries. Some of them have commercial businesses in their own homes or rent stalls. Others work as street merchants. Some have extra income from selling cosmetics by catalog. In detail, the members' businesses are as follows: Cecilia Andrea, the group's president, sells food and has 15 years of experience. Bertha has been selling cards for the past two years, Elar has had a cell phone stand for the past three years, Karina is a hairdresser and has been working at her salon for the past two years, Hilda has been selling meals for the past year, Renalia has been selling pollera-style skirts for the past two years, Josefa has been selling clothing for 20 years, Fabiola has been selling food for the past year, Senovia also sells food but has 12 years of experience, Mevlis also sells food and has 14 years of experience, Delicia has been selling clothing for the past year, and Marisol generates income by renting out her car; she has been doing so for the past 10 years. As far as competition goes, it is always there. But, the members adjust to get ahead in their businesses. They diversify their merchandise or travel to sell in outlying areas of the city. This allows them to generate the necessary movement to support their families. The loan is to get working materials, wholesale supplies, and to improve their homes to make their families more comfortable. As far as the members’ expectations go, they wish to be able to have their own houses. That is why they put forth so much effort; they want to give their children a stable roof over their heads. They want to give each one of them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mayela Cayetana

texts.es:
Mayela Cayetana E. se dedica a la venta de bisuterías como golosinas, galletas, chocolates y agua helada vendiendo dichos productos en uno de los mercados del departamento de León donde todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ella inicia sus ventas de las bisuterías y siempre busca como vender todo el producto.
Actualmente solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las bisuterías como golosinas, galletas, chocolates y el agua helada. Para ello está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido a lo inmediato en la compra de estos productos y así realizar sus ventas en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mayela Cayetana E. works selling simple foods such as snacks, candy, cookies, chocolate and cold water. She sells these products at one of the markets in the Department of León, where she starts work very early in the morning, and always tries to sell all of her inventory for the day. Currently, she is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing foods such as snacks, candy, cookies, chocolate and cold water. The funds she is requesting will be invested immediately in purchasing these products, so she can sell them in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing snacks, candy, cookies, chocolate, water, etc.

loans.name: Mayra Petrona

texts.es:
la sra. Mayra Petrona V. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la colonia Reparto Arriba de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Mayra se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para empezar a producir sus tortillas de las cuales la primera produccion esta lista a las 6:00am, para poder repartirlas a sus clientes, la segunda produccion es para la hora del medio dia.
sus clientes le estan haciendo pedidos mayores todos los dias y no se da abasto para cumplir con todas las exigencias que tiene, es por tal razon que esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas y asi tener una mayor produccion.
las ganancias las necesita para el sustento de su familia y su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayra Petrona V. is 45 years old and lives in the Reparto Arriba neighborhood of Tegucigalpa. Mayra’s job is make and sell tortillas. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. to begin making tortillas, the first of which are ready at 6:00 a.m., which she then delivers to her customers. The second batch is ready around noon. Every day her customers are ordering more tortillas and she can’t keep up with all of their demands. Because of this, she is applying for this loan to buy more tortilla-making materials so she can produce more. She needs her income to maintain her home and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: firewood, corn flour, water, matches--materials to make tortillas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Activas” están representados por la señora Carmen y conformado por 14 miembros muy puntuales, trabajadoras y activas por lo que hacen honor a su nombre. Todas las socias del banco comunal tienen negocio, como la venta de comida, ropa, cosméticos, pan, ferretería, zapatos y la costura de prendas de vestir. Las socias indican que en el mercado tienen mucha competencia pero pese a eso ellas siguen trabajando y tienen clientes fieles. 

Carmen que es la presidenta del banco se dedica a la venta de cosméticos tiene una experiencia de 1 año en este rubro, Rosmery vende comida y tiene experiencia de 1 año, Concepción se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace 10 años atrás, Maria cristina también vende comida con una experiencia de 3 años, Ana maria atiende su zapatería desde hace 13 años, Claudia comercializa ropa usada desde hace 1 año, Bacilia vende comida y tiene una experiencia de 16 años, Pura vende ropa interior desde hace 7 años, Maria Esther también se dedica a la venta de comida con una experiencia de 2 años atrás, Nancy angelica vende dulces desde hace 6 años, Corina comercializa pan durante 9 años, Daniela se dedica a costurar desde hace 2 años, Alicia también comercializa pan desde hace 2 años y por último Justa atiende su punto viva desde hace 3 años atrás. 

El crédito esta destinado a la compra de mercadería, materiales, insumos y herramientas como maquinas de coser eléctricas o bordadoras, todo esto ayudara para generar un mejor beneficio económico que se traducirá en una mejor educación para sus hijos y un hogar estable para sus familias. En su gran mayoría las socias ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad de crédito solidario con instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que saben manejar los fondos otorgados para beneficio e incremento de sus negocios que son el pilar fundamental para el sustento de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The group “Las Activas” ("The Active Women") is represented by Ms. Carmen and made up of 14 very punctual, hard-working and active members who live up to their group's name. All of the members of this communal bank have a business, such as selling food, clothing, cosmetics, bread, hardware, or shoes, or working as a tailor. The members indicate that there is a lot of competition on the local market, but they continue working in spite of this fact, and they have loyal customers. Carmen is the group's president and has been selling cosmetics for the past year. Rosmery has been selling prepared meals for the past year, Concepción has been selling bread for 10 years, Maria Cristina also sells food and has 3 years of experience, Ana Maria has had her shoe store for the past 13 years, Claudia has been selling used clothing for the past year, Bacilia has been selling food for the past 16 years, Pura has been selling underwear for the past 7 years, Maria Esther has been selling food for the past 2 years, Nancy Angelica has been selling sweets for the past 6 years, Corina has been selling bread for the past 9 years, Daniela has been working as a seamstress for 2 years, Alicia has also been selling bread for 2 years, and finally, Justa has been working at a Viva cell phone sales location for the past 3 years. The loan is aimed at purchasing merchandise, materials, supplies and tools such as electric sewing machines or embroidery machines. All of this will help them generate greater economic benefits, translating into a better education for their children and a stable home for their families. The great majority of them have previous experience with solidarity loans from institutions similar to the Agrocapital Foundation, so they know how to manage the funds they receive in order to benefit and expand their businesses, which are the fundamental pillars that sustain their households.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Juventud está formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras  que  buscan con su esfuerzo salir adelante junto a sus familias, se han convertido en grandes amigas viven todas en la urbe cuencana, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su gente amable, sus paisajes, su centro histórico, en general es una ciudad encantadora que atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.

María M. es socia hace dos ciclos invitada por  su amiga Celina Cornejo, ella vive en la comunidad Conferencia en  la parroquia de Quingeo  en su casita pequeña de adobe con su esposo,  sus ocho hijos y dos nietos porque a su hija mayor su cónyuge la abandono,  de ellos su  hija de 23 necesita cuidado especial porque tiene epilepsia  y debe pasar en tratamiento constante pero  como no tienen los suficientes recursos económicos no  le suministran toda  la medicación necesaria, sus hijos de 19 y 16 años trabajan  y aportan un poco con los gastos del hogar y su hija de 14   ayuda en casa con el cuidado de los animales  y sus tres últimos hijos aun son estudiantes de primaria,  mientras que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura o al  aserradero realizando  tablas, tablones cuando le dan trabajo sus conocidos.

  Nuestra socia se dedica a la crianza de pollos, cuyes, además tiene una vaca lechera que abastece solo para el consumo familiar, tambieñ se dedica a la agricultura y siembra maíz, habas y ajos junto a su esposo.

Con el dinero que reciba de la Fundación comprará cuyes y pasto hierba para su alimentación e  incrementar su criadero para la venta.

Su sueño es  montar  un negocio de comida rápida.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Nueva Juventud (New Youth) is made up of a group of hard-working women who are using their strengths to get ahead and help their families. They have become great friends, all of them live in the Cuenca area, a city that is known for its friendly people, its landscapes, and its historical center. It is a lovely city that attracts national and international tourists. Maria M. has been a member [of Nueva Juventud] for two loan cycles. She was invited by her friend Celina Cornejo. Maria lives in the Conferencia neighborhood in the Quingeo district, in her little adobe house with her husband, their eight children and two grandchildren, because her oldest daughter’s husband left her. Her 23-year-old daughter needs extra care because she is epileptic and requires continuous care. Due to a lack of financial resources they are not able to give her all of her necessary medications. Her 19 and 16-year old children both work and help out with the family expenses and her 14-year old daughter helps at home, caring for their animals and the other three children, who all still attend elementary school. Her husband works in agriculture and at a sawmill when there is work. This member [Maria] raises chickens and guinea pigs and also has a dairy cow that provides milk for her family. She also works in agriculture, planting corn, beans and garlic with her husband. With the money she will receive from the Foundation she will buy guinea pigs and food for guinea pigs, so she can raise and sell them. She dreams of opening a fast-food restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: guinea pigs and feed

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: Fama N. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KIR-DIOM depuis 2 ans et a eu à y bénéficier 4 fois de suite de crédit. Son objectif est de mieux développer son embouche ovine et vente de mil, de haricot, d'oseille et d'arachide. Avec ses bénéfices elle compte renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Fama N. is a 46-year old woman who is married and has six children. She has been a member of the village bank in KIR-DIOM for two years and has had four consecutive loans. Her aim is to build up her beef fattening business and the sale of millet, beans, sorrel and ground nut. With the profits she plans to boost her savings and to contribute to the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
En el mercado central del departamento de León, muy responsablemente la señora Rosa C. se ha dedicado a la actividad de venta de productos comestibles como atol y pan los que son elaborados por ella misma a diario.
La señora Rosa C. tiene su puesto de venta en donde se ubica dos horas en la venta del producto y  luego lo ofrece de forma ambulante por las mañanas vende el atol y por las tardes vende el pan. 
El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima como lo es el pan, la canela y la leche. Por este motivo espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
In the central market of Leon, Rosa C. has very responsibly dedicated herself to the sale of food products like atol [a thick, warm drink made with milk and corn] and bread that she makes herself every day. Mrs. Rosa C. has a stand where she sells her products from for two hours every day, then she walks around selling atol in the morning and bread in the afternoon. The loan she is applying for is to buy basic things like bread, cinnamon and milk. She hopes that her loan will be approved and in this way she will continue to improve her quality of life for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ingredients to make bread and atol

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: 30 De Enero Group
