texts.es: E. grupo “30 De Enero“ esta representado por la señora Brigida y conformada por 12 miembros que van empezado en su 2do  ciclo, la mayoría son de la misma zona y se conocen bastante bien de manera que es un grupo muy solidario por que entre todas se ayudan para que E. banco marche bastante bien, los integrantes son personas mayores y responsables. Entre las actividades que realizan las socias esta la presidenta  que es una persona que se dedica a su negocio de venta de cosméticos  ambulando de donde le generan buenas ganancias las demás personas se dedican a la venta de comida en sus hogares, elaboración y distribución de empanadas, refrescos, venta en ferreterías, servicio de empleo domestico y los entre los hombres se dedican al transporte en moto taxis. La competencia de las socias esta realmente muy difícil, especialmente en la venta de cosméticos, comida y en E. transporte pero saben como salir adelante con entusiasmo y ganas de trabajar. E. destino dE. crédito es hacer crecer sus negocios,  llegando a surtir su mercadería y con la adquisición de insumos  incrementando sus ventas y ofreciendo mejores servicios a sus clientes para que a futuro puedan darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y  una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “30 de enero” is represented by Ms. Brigida and is made up of 12 members who are starting their second loan cycle. Most of the members are from the same neighborhood and know each other well, which makes them a united group that works together to keep the bank running smoothly. The members are all responsible adults. Among the different jobs of each member is the president, who works as a traveling cosmetics saleswoman, which generates a good income for her. There are also members who sell food from their homes, make and sell empanadas, soft drinks, members who work in hardware stores, housecleaning services, and some of the men work as moto-taxi drivers. Competition is very tough for the members, especially in cosmetics sales, food and transportation services, but the members know how to keep moving forward with enthusiasm and hard work. The loan will be used to grow their businesses, increase their sales and offer better service to their customers, so that in the future they will be able to give their children a good education and improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by RachE. Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operational capital

loans.name: Felix Cantalicia

texts.es:
la sra. Felix Cantalicia G. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en la colonia la Sosa de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Cantalicia se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de realizar este tipo de actividad. todos los dias tiene una produccion grande de tortillas, se levanta temprano para empezar su produccion.
las tortillas es un alimento que se consume en los tres tiempos de comida (desayuno, almuerzo y cena). es una costumbre en Honduras.
la sra. Cantalicia en estos momentos necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales al por mayor, asi tiene mas ganancias. ademas que ahora los pedidos son mas grandes y no logra cumplirle a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felix Cantalicia G. is 49 years old and lives in the Sosa neighborhood in Tegucigalpa. Cantalicia’s job is to make and sell tortillas, which she has been doing for several years. Every day she gets up early to start work and makes a large batch of tortillas. A custom in Honduras is that tortillas are a food that are eaten three times a day (breakfast, lunch and dinner). Mrs. Cantalicia needs a loan at this time to purchase wholesale materials, so she can increase her earnings. She also is receiving more orders and is having a hard time keeping up.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy firewood, water and corn flour to make tortillas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Corazon Salvaje Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Corazón Salvaje” esta representado por la señora Carmen Alicia y conformada por 12 miembros que se caracterizan por ser padres y madres de familia, que trabajan constantemente, para  poder sacar adelante a su familia y sus negocios, para así poder cumplir con sus obligaciones y mejorar los ingresos para el sustento de sus hogares. Entre las actividades que realizan para generar sus ingresos esta la venta de venta de comida, venta de ropas, servicio domestico y promotoras de cosméticos por catálogo, los  varones se dedican  a  la   actividad del trasporte, albañilería y el empleo en empresas. La  competencia  en respeto  a sus negocios es fuerte, ya que las señoras y caballeros trabajan duro y requiere un esfuerzo y sacrificio adicional para poder generar sus ingresos, además tienen que competir con negocios fuertes y ya establecidos en áreas comerciales como ser restaurantes, boutiques,  pero nada de eso los desanimen a seguir adelante, mas a lo contrario la competencia  les obliga a trabajar mejor para poder llegar a tener éxito por ende progreso económico.  El crédito será utilizado en agrandar sus negocios para poder brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes por lo que tendrán que incrementar su mercadería y mejorar sus herramientas de trabajo. Los socios tiene buena experiencia ya que la gran mayoría de las personas han trabajado en grupos similares, por lo que saben como manejar los fondos para que estos puedan generar una mejora en sus negocios y así mejorar sus ingresos para el sustento de sus familias.
texts.en:
The community bank “Corazón Salvaje” (Wild Heart) is respresented by Mrs. Carmen Alicia and made up of 12 members who are mothers and fathers who work non-stop in order to improve their families’ lives and their businesses, so they can complete their responsibilities and increase their earnings to sustain their families. Among the jobs that the members hold are selling food, selling clothing, housecleaning, and cosmetics sales. The men work in transportation, brick-laying and as employees for different companies. There is a lot of job competition so they must work hard and make additional sacrifices in order to generate income. They also have to compete against strong, established businesses like restaurants and boutiques, but this does no discourage them. The competition only makes them work better in order to have economic success. This loan will be used to grow their businesses so they can better serve their customers, by increasing their merchandise and using better equipment. The members have a lot of experience and most of them have worked with similar groups, so they know how to manage the funds so that they can grow their businesses and increase their earnings for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operational capital

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: Absa B. est âgée de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Son crédit lui permet de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de prendre en charge sa famille. Ses activités sont diverses : elle vend des tissus, fait de l'embouche ovine et vend de l'arachide, du mil de l'oseille, du sucre, de thé, beurre etc.
texts.en:
Absa B. is 60 years old, married and has nine children. Her loan will allow her to boost her savings and to take care of her family. Her activities are diverse: she sells fabric, fattens beef and sells ground nut, millet, sorrel, sugar, tea, butter etc..

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: Aby S. est âgée de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans. Son objectif est d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne et de participer à la prise en charge familiale à partir de ses bénéfices générés par son activité d'embouche bovine et ovine.
texts.en:
Aby S. is 34 years old. She is married and mother of five children. She has been a member of the ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group of SIWAL for two years. Her objective is to increase her savings and help support her family through income generated by her activity of fattening cattle and sheep.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Carmen Esther

texts.es:
En un pequeño barrio de Soledad de solo 4 manzanas llamado Bella Murillo, vive Carmen S., mujer comerciante de productos variados, especialmente cosméticos,  casada y con 2 hijos, que se inicia  como empleada de una confección donde trabajó por muchos años y de la que debió renunciar, debido a que su hijo presentó por un largo tiempo problemas de salud, que le impedían el cumplimiento de horarios laborales. 

Desde esta época, buscó oportunidades para trabajar como independiente para poder generar ingresos que le permitieran estar al cuidado de su hijo; fue así como comenzó   ella sola confeccionando vestidos por mucho tiempo,  lo cual le causó agotamiento; por eso aprovechando el conocimiento en el manejo de la clientela, decidió convertirse en comerciante y desde hace 7 años vende a través de guías especializadas de productos,  para poder continuar apoyando el ingreso familiar en unión de su esposo que también es comerciante de productos desechables y de farmacia.

Su pequeño e incipiente capital fue fortalecido desde el principio por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con más de 6 créditos gradualmente aumentados al terminar de cancelarlos; ella considera que al recibir un financiamiento debe administrarlo con cautela, esto es, dirigirlos a la inversión de mercancías para reproducir su capital de trabajo, tal como lo ha venido haciendo durante todo este tiempo; con los financiamientos que ha recibido se siente muy satisfecha porque se ajustan a las mensualidades que ella puede pagar, al plazo requerido y negociado previamente en la visita preliminar al crédito realizada por el asesor y porque puede apoyar mucho su hogar principalmente.

En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 el cual utilizará para obtener descuentos al cancelar facturas anticipadamente y para la compra de mercancías que le han requerido sus clientes.

Sus principales metas están relacionadas con cambiarse de barrio, comprando una casa en una zona más central, donde se encuentran sus principales clientes los cuales son empleados pero tiene trabajadores independientes, con todos ellos es muy selectiva y otorga pequeños cupos de crédito con una cuota inicial cuando se inician como sus clientes.
texts.en:
In a small neighborhood of Soledad, called Bella Murilo, measuring just 4 manzanas, lives Carmen S., a woman merchant who sells varied products, especially cosmetics. She is married with 2 children. Carmen began as a manufacturing employee and worked for many years but had to resign, due to her child's long-term health problems which impeded her from complying with work hours. Since that time, she has looked for opportunities to work independently, for a way to generate income that will permit her to care for her son. This is how she came to make dresses for a long time, which wore her out. For this reason, and knowing how to handle customers, she decided to become a merchant. For the last 7 years she has sold products, using specialized guides to products, in order to continue to add to the family income, in union with her husband. He is also a merchant, selling disposable products and operating a pharmacy. Her small beginning capital was fortified from the start by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with more than 6 loans, each gradually increasing as the last was paid off. She believed that each loan should be administered cautiously, that is, directing them towards investing in merchandise to reproduce her working capital, which she has been doing all this time. She is very satisfied with the loans she has received; her monthly payments have been negotiated by the assessor during the first visit at payable amounts and desirable periods that would benefit her family. Presently, she is applying for a loan of $2,000,000 (Colombian pesos) to be used to obtain discounts in paying off previous invoices early, and to buy merchandise requested by her customers. Her principle goals are related to changing neighborhoods; buying a house in a more central zone where she will be close to her principle customers, who are employees and independent workers. She is very selective in granting small amounts of credit, with an initial quota set when each begins as a customer.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE AND OBTAIN DISCOUNTS BY PAYING BILLS EARLY

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es:
el sr. Jose G. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en la colonia Brisas del Valle en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Jose es zapatero, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. con esta actividad a sacado a su familia adelante.
en estos momentos necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para fabricar los zapatos, ya que viene la temporada escolar y aqui es donde el vende un poco mas.
el sr. Jose es una persona de edad y esta es la unica actividad que el puede realizar para ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Jose G. is 65 years old and lives in the Brisas del Valle area in the city of Tegucigalpa. Jose is a shoemaker, and has worked in this business for many years. With this activity, he has gotten his family ahead. Now he needs credit to purchase more materials to make shoes, as the school term is about to begin, and this is when he makes more sales. Jose is elderly and this is the only activity he can carry out to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather, laces, threads, templates

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama BÂ est âgée de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WISAL depuis 2 ans et a eu à bénéficier 4 fois de suite de crédit. Sa principale activité est l'élevage de bovins. Une activité qui lui procure des bénéfices lui permettant de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Adama BÂ is 58 years old, married and mother of five children. She has been a member of the ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group of WISAL for two years, and has been granted four successive loans. Her main activity is raising cattle. This activity provides income that allows her to share support for her family and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business activity

loans.name: Adama Djiby

texts.fr: Adama Djibi B. est une femme agée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans et y a bénéficié à 4 fois de suite de crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et les bénéfices que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Adama Djibi B. is a 35-year-old woman, married and mother of six children. She has been a member of the ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group of SIWAL for two years, and has been granted four successive loans. Her activity is fattening cattle, and the income generated allows her to share in the support of her family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her activity of fattening cattle

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de zapatillas.

Margarita nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar zapatillas de diversas tallas y modelos.

Su sueño para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio y así progresar junto a su familia.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que da la promotora.
texts.en:
Miss Margarita has been a member of the Community Bank "Alto Alianza” for the last 3 years, She lives in the district and province of Yunguyo, state of Puno. She is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. She finished high school and is dedicated to the purchase and sale of shoes. ;

Margaret tells us that with the first loan requested to the Manuela Ramos group, which was for 300 nuevos soles; she was able to increase the working capital. She is requesting a loan for $350 which she will invest in the purchase of shoes of different sizes and styles.

Her dream for the future is to grow her business and progress with her family. What she likes the best about her Community Bank is the training that they give.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE ZAPATILLAS

loans.name: Lelia Goretti

texts.es:
La señora Lelia es socia del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudio secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa y frasadas.

Lelia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital de negocio.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar ropa al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es trabajar mejor y así incrementar su capital y ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
For the last 3 years Mrs. Lelia has been a member of the Community Bank "Manuela Ramos” in the Santa Rosa district, El Collao province, State of Puno. She is 23 years old, has a partner and one child. She finished High School and is dedicated to the purchase and sale of clothing and blankets.

Lelia tells us that with the first loan requested to the Manuela Ramos group, which was for 300 nuevos soles; she was able to increase her working capital.

She is requesting a loan of $ 700 which she will invest in the purchase of clothing in bulk. Her dream is to work better and increase her working capital and profits. What she likes the most about the Community Bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gemima

texts.es: Gemima, es una mujer muy puntual, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 28 años, es madre de un hijo, menor de edad, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, es madre soltera. Gemima forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Flores”, desde hace dos años y cuatro meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en productos para su bodega, ahora ella necesita 2000 soles, dinero que utilizará para implementar su bodega con productos comestibles. Ella agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la facilidad de obtener un crédito y poder hacer crecer su bodega. La meta de Gemima es tener un minimarket bien surtido.
texts.en:
Gemima is a very punctual woman that lives in Yarina Cocha District, Ucayali region. She is 28 years old and the single mother of a minor. She is dedicated to run her small grocery shop at home.

Gemima has been a member of the Community Bank "Las Flores", for two years and four months. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which was invested in the purchase of products for her grocery shop. She needs a loan of $700 that will invest in the purchase of food products to restock her shop. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Group for the loan that allowed her to grow her business. Her goal is to have a very well stocked mini market

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Kactus II” desde hace 6 meses, vive en el distrito y provincia de Huancané, departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y  tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió hasta tercero de primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales caseros.

Vilma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 100.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y comprar algunos animales.

Ella requiere otro crédito  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar: gatos, perros y alimento para estos.

Su sueño para el futuro es incrementar su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma has been a member of the Community Bank ´Flor de Kactus II" for 6 months. She lives in the district and province of Huancane, Puno State. She is 41 years old, married and has 3 children. She studied until third grade and is dedicated to the purchase and selling of pets.

Vilma tells us that the first loan requested to Manuela Ramos group, was for 100 nuevos soles and allowed her to increase her working capital and buy some pets.

She needs a loan of $125 that will be invested in the purchase of cats, dogs and the food to feed them. Her dream is to grow her business and improve her income.

What she likes the most about the community bank is the meetings with the members

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 50 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos mayores de edad e independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de panchos y anticuchos (comida al paso), actividades que realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es trabajador independiente. Paralelamente cuenta con algunas máquinas compresoras las cuales alquila y brinda servicio de alquiler de cochera.
Teresa forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito”, desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la construcción de una cochera, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, que será invertido en la reparación de sus maquinas compresoras. La meta de Teresa es salir adelante y equipar sus maquinarias.
texts.en:
Teresa is a dynamic woman, she lives in the district of Calleria, Ucayali region. She is 50, mother of two children that are independent adults, she sells food, panchos (hot dogs) and anticuchos (kebabs), activities that she does from home, she has her husband's support who is an independent worker. In addition she has some compressors that she rents and she also provides garage rent services. Teresa is part of the community bank “Women of Success” she joined five years ago, her first loan of 300 soles was invested to build a garage, she now needs a 3,000 soles loan to invest it in fixing her compressors. Teresa's goal is to get ahead and equip her machinery.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair compressors

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor D. Kactus II” desD. hace 1 año, vive en el distrito y provincia D. Huancané, departamento D. Puno, tiene 51 años D. edad, está casada y  tiene 06 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta D. abarrotes.

Felipa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es ampliar su negocio y ver a sus hijos profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Felipa has been a member of the community bank "Cactus Flower II" for one year, she lives in the district and province of Huancane, department of Puno, she is 51 years old, married and has six children. She finished elementary school, she sells groceries. Felipa tells us that with the first loan requested to Manuela Ramos of 500 soles, she was able to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles to buy: rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc. Her dream for the future is to expand her business and see her children become professionals. What she likes the most about the community bank is having savings.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa A. is a 43-year-old mother who cares for her three children, all of whom look to her for support. Her husband is a laborer who also makes doormats. To help support the family, she started a business making and selling doormats. 

Leonisa applied for a second loan to buy an assortment of raw materials for her business such as cotton, flannel and other supplies. In the future, Leonisa hopes to open a stall where she can fill orders. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education and to have a comfortable house to live in and a happy family to live with.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of raw materials such as cotton, flannel and other supplies

loans.name: Juana Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juana  Juliana R. S., labora como recepcionista de commema central, ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante seis años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los nueve créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.
 Ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos dos de estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de varias láminas de zinc para su casa de habitación, con el fin de darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos que tanto requieren del apoyo de su padre.
Juana dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Juana Juliana R. S. is a receptionist and has worked with Ceprodel for six years. In this time, she has improved her living conditions through nine loans she has borrowed from Ceprodel. She is married and has four children, two of whom are school-aged. This loan is for the purchase of various zinc sheets for her home, which will provide a better lifestyle for her children, who require the support of their parents. Juana gives thanks for the loans from Ceprodel, as her home has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and expansion

loans.name: Eddy Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Eddy Manuel G., labora como vigilante de seguridad en el centro de capacitación Nicaragüense Alemán (CECNA), ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante un año y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con el préstamo de Ceprodel.
Esta casado con cuatro hijos y dos de estos se encuentran en edad escolar.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de perlines para su vivienda lo que anteriormente esta tenia cuartones de madera para su vivienda con el fin de darle un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos que tanto requieren del apoyo de su padre.
texts.en:
Eddy Manuel G. works as a security guard in the Nicaraguan-German Training Center (CECNA). He has worked with Ceprodel for a year, and in this time he has improved his home with Ceprodel loans. He is married with four children, two of whom are school-aged. This credit is for the purchase of beams for his home, which were previously built with wood, so that he may provide a better lifestyle for his children, who depend on the support of their father.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and expansion

loans.name: Lenin Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Lenin Alberto G. L. ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante dos años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los dos créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.
Esta casado con tres hijos ye estos se encuentran en edad escolar
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ladrillos para su vivienda con el fin de darle un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos que tanto requieren del apoyo de su padre.
Lenin dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho en el mejoramiento de su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Lenin Alberto G. L. has worked with Ceprodel for two years and during this time managed to improve his home with the two loans he negotiated with Ceprodel.

He is married and has three school-age children.

He is requesting the loan to purchase bricks for his house, so he can provide an improved quality of life to his children who still depend on their father's support.

Lenin says that thanks to the loans he has received from Ceprodel he has been greatly helped in improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansion

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Salvador E. V., labora como supervisor de los higienista en commema mercado Iván Montenegro, ha trabajado con créditos con Ceprodel durante siete  años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los nueve créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.
Esta casado tiene tres hijos a su cargo y estos se encuentran en el colegio.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ladrillos para su vivienda con el fin de darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos.
Manuel dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho en el mejoramiento de su  vivienda.
texts.en:
Manuel Salvador E. V. works as supervisor of the custodial staff at the Iván Montenegro commercial market. He has negotiated loans with Ceprodel for seven years and over this time was able to improve the conditions of his home with the nine loans he received.

He is married and responsible for three children, who are all in school.

The loan requested is to purchase bricks for his house, to improve his children's quality of life.

Manuel says that that the loans offered by Ceprodel have greatly helped him in improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansion

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Paublo Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Paublo Ramón S. C., ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante  siete años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los once créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.
.
Esta casado con tres hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ladrillos para su vivienda con el fin de darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos que tanto requieren del apoyo de su padre.

Paublo dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Paublo Ramón S. C. has worked with Ceprodel for seven years and during this time been able to improve the conditions of his house with the eleven loans he has negotiated.

He is married with three school-age children.

The requested loan is to purchase bricks for his house in order to improve living conditions for his children, who still depend on their father's support.

Paublo says that thanks to the loans offered by Ceprodel he has continued improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansion

loans.name: Loung's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Loung N. is 57 years old. She is a village bank president of a group that consists of 17 people, all located in Chong Kaoh village, Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. N. Roeung are farmers who own a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. They now face some problems because the field is infertile and they do not have enough water to water the plants. Thus, Mrs. Loung N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Mrs. Loung N. is a mother of three children. One of her children is a farmer and the other two are laborers for a private company.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom C. is 42 years old. She is the village bank president of a group that consists of 18 people located in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal Province. The members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Sarom C. and her husband, Mr. Orn Oeng, are farmers who own a one-hectare field where they cultivate rice to support their famiL. members. But now they face some problems because the soil is infertile. Thus, Mrs. Sarom C. is applying for a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will buy rice seeds. Mrs. Sarom C. is a mother of four children. Two of her children are students in the local school and the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en: Mr. Sambath H. is 41 years old. He is the village bank president of a group that consists of 17 people, located in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province. Mr. Sambath H. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He now faces a problem because his field is infertile. Thus, Mr. Sambath H. decided to ask for a loan of 500,000R from AMK to buy fertilizer to support his farm. His wife, Mrs. Savy Phao, is a vegetable seller who earns a little income to support the family members. Mrs. Savy Phao is the mother of a child who is employed in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Phon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy P., 33 years old, is a coconut seller. She is the mother of five children: four are students in the local school while the other one is too young for school. Her husband, Mr. Tith Run, is a farmer who owns a 1 hectare field to cultivate rice. Since her business is going well, she would like to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chanthy P. is requesting a loan from AMK to buy more coconuts to sell. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a bicycle and rice seeds to support her husband's farm.

Mrs. Chanthy P. is the president of this village bank of 16 people located in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province. The members will use this loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Thuch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thy T. is 52 years old. She is the village bank president of a group of 16 people, located in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province. Members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Thy T. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. She would like to ask for a loan of 800,000 Riel from AMK to support her farm. Mrs. Thy T. is a widow with four children. One of her children is a laborer with a private company and the other is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To support her farm

loans.name: Ronald Ryan

texts.en:
Ronald Ryan D. is from the village of Polo. He is 28 years old. Ronald Ryan is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ronald Ryan owns & operates a food stall where he sells soft drinks and other food products in the local community. Ronald Ryan has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ronald Ryan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronald Ryan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ronald Ryan is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Ronald Ryan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business and to pay for the education of his children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn R. is from the village of Kauswagan, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. Evelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca M. is from the village of Kauswagan, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. Francisca is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Francisca owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Francisca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Francisca opted to request a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Francisca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sri Kurn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Village bank president Mrs. Sri K. leads a group of 17 people, located in Kandal province. The members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sri K. is a grocer in the local market. Although she tries to work hard with her business, she still doesn't earn enough income to support her family.   In order to increase and expand her business, Mrs. Sri K. is asking for a loan of 800,000 Riel from AMK to buy more fish. With the rest of the loan, she will support her grocery business.  Mrs. Sri K. is 57 years old. She is a widow with a child who is a student in the local school. Mrs. Sreynuch C. is a group guarantor of this village bank, so she is presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie E. is from the village of Omunay, Damulog, Bukidnon. Norie is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Norie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Norie has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Norie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Norie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita G. is from the village of P-9, Poblacion, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is married and has four school-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a business selling a variety of soft drinks in the local community. She also has a videoke business that provides "sing along" services to the public. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is married and has two school-aged children. Emma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Emma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mrs. Lorn Nurn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorn N. is 43 years old. She is the village bank president of a group that consists of sixteen people located in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province. All the members are shown in the photo, but some of them are blocked by others.

Mrs. Lorn N. is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other one is a student in the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Mom Makk, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice to support the family living. In this farming, they now face a problem because the field does not have enough water to grow rice.

Thus, Mrs. Lorn N. decided to ask a loan of 600,000 Riel from AMK to buy a water pump to support their rice field.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to irrigate her rice field

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Toir

texts.ru: Якубов Тоир проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 55 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Якубов Тоир имеет среднее Техническое образование по специальности "Шофер". Работает в этой области более чем 10 лет. Якубов Тоир предоставляет услугу такси. Кредит берет для ремонта автомобиля.
texts.en:
Toir Y. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 55 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Toir has secondary technical education and his profession is a driver. He has worked in this field for more than ten years. Toir Y. provides taxi services. He is asking for a loan to repair his vehicle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma A. is from the village of Langcata-on, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is married and has five school-aged children. Elma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mr. Den Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. D. M. is 61 years old. He is the president of a 20-member village bank group located in Anlong Romeit Choeng village in Kandal province. He is a village chief and his wife, Mrs. Soat Saiy, is a housewife.  Mr. D. M.'s salary is too low to support his family, so he decided to ask for 800,000 KHR to buy rice for eating. Mrs. Soat Saiy is the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other does housework.

loans.use: To buy rice for eating

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannak C. is 39 years old. She is a member of a group bank loan which consists of four people, located in Anlong Romeit Choeng village in Kandal province. The group loan will be used by each member for a different purpose.  

Mrs. Vannak C. is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Now she wants to borrow 800,000 KHR from the Kiva field partner, AMK (Angkor Microfinance Kampuchea), to support her field. Besides being a farmer, she is also a dessert seller. Her husband, Mr. Saroeun Preap, is a policeman who earns a small income to support the family. Mrs. Vannak C. is the mother of four children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To support her field

loans.name: Maksud

texts.ru: Шокиров Максуд проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Шокиров Максуд работает в этой области более 7 лет. Он занимается перевозками. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en:
Maksud S. lives in the region of Varzob. He is 36 years old. He is married and has two children. Maksud is working in the field of freight transportation for more than seven years. He is asking for a loan to repair his vehicle so he can provide safe services.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Savorn H. is 36 years old. She lives in Chrouy Chrey village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kheng Korn, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare field where they cultivate rice to make a small income to support the family.  

Mrs. Savorn H. needs 1,500,000 KHR from the Kiva field partner, AMK (Angkor Microfinance Kampuchea), to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She will also hire a laborer to help them. Mrs. Savorn H. is the mother of two children who are students in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, and hire a laborer

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Rith S., 43, is widow and lives with her only child in Batambong Province, Cambodia. S. is in the business of selling soy milk. She sells her products at a popular local market in the town and is able to earn a gross income of $33 per day. 

S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family.  They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to take care of the necessary daily expenses. 

Therefore, S. is requesting a loan of $1200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more soybeans to produce soy milk for new and existing customers at the market. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: to buy soybeans to produce soy milk to sell

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa V. is 49 years old. She is a member of a group loan which consists of six people and is located in Sambour village, Kandal province. The entire group loan will be used by its members for different purposes. 

Mrs. Channa V. and her husband, Mr. Thorn Khim, are farmers who own a piece of land where they cultivate rice. They are facing some problems because the soil on the field is infertile and there are a lot of insects.  So she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. 

Mrs. Channa V. is the mother of three children, one of whom is a waiter and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Ket's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who are led by Mrs. Ket S., located in Chong Koh village, Kandal province. The members of the group will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Ket S. and her husband, Mr. Khorn Thorn, are farmers who own a 2.5-hectare field where they cultivate rice. They do not have enough money to support the field, so Mrs. Ket S. decided to ask for 400,000 KHR from the Kiva field partner, AMK (Angkor Microfinance Kampuchea), to buy gasoline and fertilizer to help with their farming. 

Mr. Khorn Thorn is a fisherman who can earn a small income to help his family members. Mrs. Ket S. is the mother of five children, three of whom are students in the local school, while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and fertilizer

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of three people who are led by Mrs. Sokhom S.. She is 53 years old and lives in Crouy ChR. village, Kandal province. 

She and her husband, Mr. Samark Port, are farmers who own a 2-hectare field where they cultivate rice. They face some problems because the field is infertile and doesn't have enough the water to support it. So Mrs. Sokhom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to support the rice field. She is the mother of four children, one of whom repairs cell phones, and the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline

loans.name: Rorm

texts.en:
Rorm R., 26, is married and lives with his only child in Batambong Province, Cambodia. R. and his wife are in the business of selling Cambodian traditional cakes (made from sticky rice, beans or peas, coconut and coconut milk, then stuffed into bamboo sticks and roasted). They sell them at home and are able to earn an income of $3 each. They have been in this business since 2000.

R. and his family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to take care of necessary daily expenses. Therefore, R. is requesting a loan of $800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the loan to start a new business of selling fried meatballs. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

His wife is pictured.

loans.use: to start a new business selling fried meatballs

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach C. is 56 years old. She lives in Koh Reas Kroam village, Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Son Sorm, are farmers who own a plot of land for cultivating. They have their own water machine to irrigate the field. In order to grow more, Mrs. Thach C. decided to ask for 1,000,000 KHR to buy gasoline and fertilizers for supporting the field. 

Mrs. Thach C. is the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory, three are housekeepers, and the youngest is a student in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline

loans.name: Tin's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Tin H. is 32 years old. He is a widower and the leader of this group loan. The group consists of five members and is located in Prey Phnhi village, Takeo province. This loan will be used by the members to support different purposes. 

Mr. Tin H. is a silk weaver who can earn a small income to support himself, but now he wants to increase and expand his business. Thus, he is asking for 500,000 KHR to bU. more silk to continue and support his business.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Moa

texts.en:
Mr. Moa C. is 46 years old and lives in Thnal Bat village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Pea Touch, are farmers who own 1.6-hectare (4-acre) piece of land on which they cultivate rice.

In order to support the farming, Mr. Moa C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticides. The rest of the loan he would use to buy gasoline to support his rice field.

Mr. Moa C. is the father of two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other one is a silk weaver. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticides and gasoline to support his rice field

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. Francisco G., 54 years of age, is married to Fe and resides at Garang, Tangub City.

Francisco owns a motor vehicle for hire and earns a meager income of P4,500 per month. He acknowledges the fact that he has to earn more for his family and so he decided to approach Paglaum MPC to seek his needed capital. He wants to purchase a motorcycle with sidecar.

Preserving his good standing membership with the Cooperative, he applied for a P40,000 loan. The future income from this loan will be used for meeting his family’s daily basic needs and for loan repayments.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle with sidecar

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen S. is from the town of Butuay. She is 46 years old. Ellen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ellen owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ellen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2005, Ellen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ellen has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Ellen is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Lenie is applying for a loan of 50,000 PHP as additional working capital to open a new branch of the business. She plans to use the excess to purchase additional equipment. She deeply wishes to maintain a good repayment record with Kiva partner PMPC so that when financial need arises, she can always seek help from the cooperative.

Most of her neighbors come to her and bring their dough for baking. She has been involved in this busienss more than 10 years. Sema wants to take out a loan for her bakery business which is in her house. She wants to purchase more ingredients like, flour and fire wood to expand her bakery.She hopes to have a small shop for this business and to support her childern to go to school and have a bright future.She is a successful business woman and would like to be the best.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosita N. is 52 years of age, married, and a resident of Dimalco, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. The couple is blessed with six children, three of whom are already married, two of whom are at school, and the other of whom is still an infant.
Rosita joined Kiva partner PMPC to avail herself of its credit services. She has applied for her first loan of 3,000 PHP to add to her capital for running her sari-sari store business. The future income from this business will be used for basic daily needs and loan repayments. Rosita is hoping that her business will make good progress and that she will be able to send all her children to school.

She has been operating this business since early 2007 and is able to earn about $4 each day. She is assisted by her husband in selling the clothes. This couple has been married for years and is blessed with two school-aged kids. 

Math has been very busy at her business.  There are buyers who need to buy her clothes, but she doesn't have enough clothing to sell to them. Therefore, she looks for a loan to put additional clothing into her inventory. Math was busy selling clothes when the photo was taken, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.name: Saul Cotiens

texts.en:
Saul Cotiens O. is married to Judith O. and they have three children who are all in college. Saul is a carpenter who makes timber furniture in Bungoma town. He has been in the carpentry business for the last five years and, out of the profits he has made, he has been able to cater for all his family's needs and even pay his children's school fees.
Saul hopes to get funding through Kiva partner KADET to enable him to expand his business by buying more timber and velvet material for covering sofa sets and employing one more member of staff to enable him meet the deadlines for his customers' orders. He will also use some of the money for family upkeep.
Saul's future dream is to expand his business into wholesale and change his operations from manual to electric. He also wants to venture into the transport business and improve his children's level of education by taking them to higher institutions of learning.

loans.use: To buy more timber and velvet materials, and employ one more member of staff

loans.name: Sakun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sakun C. lives in Ba Khong Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Loek Douk is a Khmer noodle seller who sells door-to-door but is able to earn less income than needed to support his family.

In order to improve the family standard of living, Mrs. Sakun C. needs 1,000,000 KHR from AMK to buy a cow for breeding. She would use the rest of the loan to support her husband’s business.

Mrs. Sakun C. is the mother of four children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other three do housework. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow and to support her husband's business

loans.name: Somali

texts.en: Mrs. Somali K. is 47 years old, and she lives in Pravong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Pharn Tun, is a construction laborer. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income for their family. In order to improve their living, Mrs. Somali K. decided to ask for a loan in order to buy two cows for breeding. She is the mother of eight children. Two of her children are factory laborers, while another one is a construction laborer. The five other children are students in the local school. (Her husband appears on the right in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Nyaga

texts.en:
Nyga K. is a 47-year-old blacksmith from the coastal town of Mombasa, in western Kenya. He has been in the blacksmithing business for 23 years. He sells small handmade metal items such as dustpans, grills, garden forks, frying pans and basins. He is requesting a 20,000 KES loan for additional materials to make these small metal items to sell to both individual and wholesale customers. 

Nyaga currently employs two people in his business. His major challenges as an entrepreneur are the competition from other blacksmiths and the shortage of materials. 

Nyga is married and has eight children from the ages of 25 to 1 1/2 years old, and describes himself as hardworking and creative. In the next five years, Nyaga would like to grow his business to be the major supplier of the items he is now selling in the local markets.

loans.use: materials for blacksmithing

With the rest of the loan, she will support her farming. Mrs. Soeng C. is the mother of three children. One of her children is a security guard at a private company, and the other two children are employees in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike
