Kebbeh’s business is selling chemicals such as fertilizers, insecticides, baking soda, and others. She buys the chemicals from wholesalers and sells them as retail on a table in the Red Light Market. She has been running this business for more than 10 years and hopes to grow the business to a higher standard.

Kebbeh started selling at a young age with a very small amount. She arranges her goods in an organized way and talks to customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Kebbeh needs this loan to purchase more chemicals for resale.  She dreams of giving her children a good education and buying land for them to build their houses on in the future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kebbeh M. is the person holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide, and other chemicals for resale.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is married and mothers five children, all of whom are currently in school. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. 

Adwoa is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside in her community. She buys her raw materials from nearby towns. Adwoa has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 38 years old and married with three children who are currently schooling. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Lydia is a very skillful and talented hairdresser. She does all kinds of hairstyles, like plaiting, perming and fixing of weavons (extensions), etc. 

She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc., to avoid shortages and poor service.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of seven children. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a mining community. Industrious as she is, Comfort works to support her husband financially to be able to take proper care of the family. Her children are all in school. 

Comfort trades in bags of charcoal. She procures from nearby communities and supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also trades in cassava. Comfort has been in business for a year and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to be able to supply to more customers.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is married and mother of seven children who are all currently in school. The thirty-seven year old woman lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Akosua is a trader. She trades in earthenware. She sells on a table top at the local market. She procures the wares from the manufacturers in nearby communities. Akosua sometimes also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for fourteen years and wants a loan to procure wares in bulk.

loans.use: To buy earthenware in bulk

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty, de 32 años, es una madre muy amorosa y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Gloria, de 1 año, a quien desea brindar un buen futuro.
Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, los cuales trae desde la ciudad de Tacna (al sur del país), es por eso que los modelos que vende son muy novedosos y llamativos, haciendo que cada vez tenga más clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ayudar a sus clientes a escoger el par de zapatos adecuado, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día en su puesto. 
Con el tiempo, desea tener una tienda más grande donde pueda atender con mayor tranquilidad a sus clientes.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Betty con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está segura de poder hacerlo, al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos. En su banco comunal siente que está realizando una buena labor y que le tienen mucho respeto por la puntualidad que demuestra. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales para elaborar más zapatos.
texts.en:
Betty is 32 years old and a loving and cheerful mother. She lives in her own home with her beloved one-year-old daughter Gloria, for whom she wants to provide a good future.

Her business is located at the San José Market (the largest market in the city of Juliaca). She sells shoes that are shipped in from the city of Tacna (in the southern part of the country). The types of shoes she sells are the brightest and latest styles, which help attract many customers. What she enjoys most about her job is helping her customers select the right pair of shoes. Betty has been in this business for five years and considers the most difficult part is spending all day at her vending post. In the future, she wants to open a larger store where she can serve her customers more peacefully.

This is Betty’s second loan with MFP. She knows she has to make her payments on time and is expected to do so, just like she did with her first loan. Betty feels good about the work her Communal Bank is doing and demonstrates her respect by completing her payments. With her loan of 2000 soles, she will buy new materials needed to produce more shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Cristina Soraisa

texts.es:
Cristina S. de 24 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo tiene agua y luz como servicios básicos, esta separada de su esposo y no tiene hijos.

Los padres de Cristina comenzaron con el negocio de la tienda ya hace muchos años atrás. Cuando sus padres tuvieron una edad avanzada y ya no podían trabajar ella se hizo cargo de la tienda. Ahora Cristina trabaja con su hermana todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h00 tienen un aproximado de 200 clientes todos los días, vende la libra de arroz a $ 0.23, la libra de azúcar $ 0.5, atún a $ 1.00 etc. Una de las dificultades que tiene son las calles enlodadas por causas de las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras y la mano de obra para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, en el futuro quiere tener una sucursal de su tienda y poder así asegurar el futuro de sus padres.
texts.en:
Cristina S. is 24 years old and lives in a periurban district located along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and receives only water and electricity as its basic services. She is separated from her husband and has no children.

Cristina’s parents opened a store many years ago. When her parents became elderly and could no longer work, she took over the store. Now Cristina works with her sister every day from 6am until 9pm. They serve approximately 200 customers each day. They sell rice for $0.23/lb, sugar for $0.50/lb, and tuna for $1.00/can. One problem they encounter is when the streets get muddy because of the rain.

With this loan, Cristina will buy cement and stone, as well as pay for labor to make improvements to her home. In the future, she would like to open another branch of her store so that she can secure her parents’ future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement & stone; pay for labor

loans.name: Lesbia Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 20 años en el municipio de Chichigalpa, ella vende tomates, chiltomas, papas, platano. Actualmente ella solicita el crédito para la compra de las verduras tales como compra de tomates, chiltomas, repollos y cebollas.
Es importante destacar que es casada y con 2 hijos los cuales están a su cargo, es el segundo crédito que tiene con Ceprodel y espera que le sea otorgado para continuar con su venta de verduras.
texts.en:
Sra. Lesbia has been selling produce for more than 20 years in the city of Chichigalpa. She sells tomatoes, bell peppers, potatoes, and plantains. At the moment, she is requesting a loan in order to buy more produce such as tomatoes, peppers, cabbage, and onions.

It is important to note that she is married and has two dependent children. This is her second loan with CEPRODEL. She hopes that it will be approved so that she can continue selling produce.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, peppers, cabbage, and onions

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith, de 21 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su querido hijo Alexander de 3 meses, y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de frazadas y cubrecamas, las cuales trae desde las ciudades de Tacna (límite con Chile) y Desaguadero (límite con Bolivia), ya que es ahí donde llegan los nuevos modelos y es debido a estas novedades que su puesto es muy concurrido.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado. Lleva 3 años realizando es actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse en la madrugada para abrir su puesto de venta, ya que la gente acostumbra ir de compras muy temprano. 
Para más adelante, espera implementar una tienda de ropa en la cual pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Edith con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, puesto que no quiere perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la alegría que le pone al grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más frazadas y cubrecamas para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Edith is 21 years old. She is a cheerful and hardworking young woman who lives at home with her parents and her beloved son Alexander who is 3 months old. Edith is willing to work very hard in order to improve her quality of life.

Her vending post is located at the San José Market (the largest market in city of Juliaca). She sells blankets and bedspreads that are shipped in from the cities of Tacna (on the border with Chile) and Desaguadero (on the border with Bolivia). New models arrive from these places and keep her location busy. What she enjoys most about her job is talking with the other merchants who work next to her and learning about things that are happening at the market. Edith has been in this business for three years and thinks the most difficult part is waking up at dawn to open her vending post, since people are accustomed to shopping early. In the future, she hopes to open a clothing store where she can better serve her customers.

This is her second loan from MFP. Edith is willing to make all of her payments on time so that she does not hinder the other members of her Communal Bank, where is well-liked because of the joy she brings to the group. With her loan of 2000 soles, Edith will buy more blankets and bedspreads in order to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets & bedspreads

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda, de 31 años, es una mujer muy alegre y luchadora, vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a su querido hijo Hans, de 1 año, a quien desea dar unos buenos estudios.
Su trabajo es el tejido artesanal, el cual viene realizando desde que tenía 15 años, cuando ayudaba a sus padres a terminar los pedidos que tenían. Ahora ella tiene su propio taller en la comodidad de su hogar y sus tejidos los vende en su puesto de artesanías, el cual está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), donde atiende con mucha alegría a sus clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre las prendas que mejor les quedaran, lleva 10 años con este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que tiene que cuidarlo; aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas. 
Para más adelante, espera hacer crecer su negocio y tener una tienda más grande de ropa artesanal.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Esmeralda con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a sus compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para mejorar los tejidos que realiza.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 31 years old and a cheerful, determined woman. She lives in the home of her relatives with her beloved son Hans, who is a year old. She wants to provide him with a good education.

Esmeralda produces handmade fabric, an activity that she has been pursuing since she was 15 years old. Her parents helped in completing the orders that she received. Now she has her own workshop in the comfort of her home and sells her fabrics from a vending post at the Laguna Temporal Esplanade (a place where fairs are held in the city of Juliaca). She takes great joy in attending to her customers.

What she enjoys most about her work is conversing with her customers and advising them which clothes are best for them. Esmeralda has been in this line of work for ten years and considers the most difficult part is spending all day at her vending post because it requires constant attention. She knows that if she continues to work hard, she will be able reach her goals. In the future, she wants to expand her business and have a larger shop for selling handmade clothing.

This is Esmeralda’s fourth loan with MFP. She expects to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank, where she is loved and respected. With her loan of 3000 soles, she will buy more wool to improve her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa de 40 años de edad es soltera, trabaja para el MINSA desde hace 16 años como enfermera brindando cuidos a personas que llegan enfermas al centro de Salud del Coral,  tiene una hija y una prima a su cargo, quienes le ayudan a cuidar la casa.  Esta solicitando su 3er credito para construir una habitacion de concreto ya que actualmente la que tiene es de de tabla y se encuentra en mal estado, y quiere aprovechar antes que llegue el invierno para construirla.  Ella se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old, single, and has worked for MINSA for 16 years as a nurse, offering care to people who arrive sick at the Coral Health Center. She has a daughter and a cousin in her care and they help her around the house. She is requesting her 3rd loan to add a room to her concrete house. What she currently has is made of old boards and is in bad condition. She wants to take advantage of the season and accomplish the construction before winter comes. She is characterized as responsible and hard working, with a great desire to forge ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUILD A ROOM ONTO HER HOUSE

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia, de 19 años, es una joven muy alegre y sencilla, vive en la casa de sus padres Humberto de 41 y Nelida de 39 años, a quienes desea dar una vejez tranquila.
Su bodega es la primera en atender en su barrio, desde las 7 de la mañana sus puertas ya están abiertas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. 
Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.

Este es el primer préstamo de Katia con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Katia, age 19, is a cheerful and straightforward young woman who lives in the home of her parents, Humberto, age 41, and Nelida, 39, to whom she wants to give a peaceful old age. Her grocery store is the first one serving her neighborhood. Her doors are open from 7:00 in the morning in order to receive her early rising buyers who, being aware of the variety of merchandise she carries, don’t hesitate to buy from her, for they can be certain of finding the things they need.

What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers and finding out about things that are happening in her neighborhood. She has been in business for 5 years and considers the most difficult part having to stay inside her shop all day without being able to leave.

She desires to make her business grow and to offer her customers better service. This is Katia’s first loan with MFP, and she hopes to be able to pay it back on time since she doesn’t want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank. She is very respected there due to the organization she brings to the group. With the 1000 new soles applied for she will buy more products in order to make her grocery shop better.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in inventory

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja, de 49 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado mucho para sobresalir. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Leonardo, de 50 años, y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
Con mucho sacrificio y trabajo Maruja logró instalar su negocio de confección de zapatos, tiene un pequeño taller donde produce zapatos muy novedosos y llamativos, los cuales luego distribuye en las tiendas y puestos de los mercados más importantes de la ciudad. Sus productos son comprados muy rápido, es por eso que las tiendas solicitan mucho sus calzados.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es confeccionar los zapatos, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es hacer la distribución. 
Para el futuro, anhela implementar una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma los zapatos que confecciona.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Maruja con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más materiales para elaborar nuevos zapatos.
texts.en:
Maruja, 49 years old, is a woman who has worked throughout her life in order to excel. She lives in her own home with her husband Leonardo, who is 50, and what she most desires is to have a tranquil old age. With a lot of sacrifice and work Maruja managed to start a business making shoes; she has a small workshop where she makes shoes in styles that are very up-to-date and striking. She distributes them in shops and stalls in the most important markets in the city. Her products are sold very quickly, and for this reason the shops are requesting more of her shoes. What she likes most about her work is making the shoes; she has spent 8 years in this line of work. She considers the most difficult part to be the distribution. In the future, she hopes to establish a store where she can sell the shoes that she makes. This is Maruja's 3rd loan with MFP. She is prepared to make her payments on time so as not to harm the other members of her communal bank, where she is well-liked and considered to be responsible. With the fifteen hundred Peruvian soles that she requests she will buy more materials for the production of new shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to make shoes

loans.name: Simon Antonio

texts.es: El señora Simon Antonio V. H. nacido en managua el 20 de abril de 1963, es soltero pero mantiene una relacion con la señora Maria Elsa Lopez, ellos habitan en el Barrio Laureles Sur, la señora se dedica a los trabajos de la casa tiene tres hijos los cuales, dos le ayudan en su negocio, pero el menor depende completamente de los señores. El plan principal del señor V. es realizar mejoras en su vivienda, cambiar su medio de transporte y la carreta del caballo. El señor Antonio se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de leña compra las pilas derribadas y las hace manojo y en rajas para su posterior venta, se le han presentado problemas para las temporadas de lluvias, debido a que cuesta sacar leña por las condiciones de los caminos pues se hace intransitable el paso, es por esto que ha planeado para un futuro la compra de un camión , pero para eso primero necesitaría de una mejor estabilidad económica y para eso solicita de este prestamo para la compra de madera, para rajarlos y venderlos, esto le aumentaria la ganancia y  le permitiría una mejor estabilidad para la familia y el progreso para nuevos proyectos.
texts.en:
Señor Simon Antonio V. H. was born in Managua on April 20, 1963. He is single but maintains a relationship with Señora Maria Elsa Lopez, They live in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. Señora Maria Elisa works in the home. He has three children, of whom two help him in his business, but the youngest depends completely on the adults. Señor V.'s main plan is to make improvements in his house and change his means of transportation, his horse-drawn wagon. For 15 years he has sold firewood. He buys piles of cut-down wood, splits it into smaller pieces, and makes bundles to be sold. For his last sale, he had problems because of the rainy season, because it was difficult to get firewood because of the conditions of the roads, which became impassable. For this reason, he has planned the future purchase of a truck, but for this he would first need better economic stability, and so he is applying for this loan to buy wood, to split it and sell it. This would increase his earnings and would allow his family more stability and progress toward his new projects.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood to split and sell for firewood

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y luchadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos: Cristian de 12, Gonzalo de 10 y Gino de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Su negocio es la venta de faldas llamadas “polleras”, su tienda está ubicada en el mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado Importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), la cual es muy concurrida debido a los coloridos modelos que vende, el gran carisma que posee para vender y lo bajo de sus precios.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y comentar sobre las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo, es traer las polleras desde la ciudad de Desaguadero (distrito fronterizo con Bolivia), ya que es un viaje muy largo y cansado. 
Con el tiempo, anhela tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender sus prendas con más comodidad.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Yolanda con MFP, se siente muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal ha sido bien recibida por el resto de las socias, por lo cual se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más faldas para implementar mejor el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 44 years old, is a mother and a cheerful go-getter. She lives in her own home with her 3 children: Cristian, who is 12, Gonzalo, who is 10, and Gino, who is 3 years old. They are the motivation for all of her efforts. She has a business selling traditional Peruvian skirts called "polleras." Her store is located in the Tupac Amaru market, (an important market in the city of Juliaca), and it is very busy due to the colorful models sold, her great personality as a saleswoman, and her low prices. What she likes most about her work is to chat with the neighboring tradespeople about the things happening in the market. She has been carrying out this activity for 8 years, and what she finds most difficult is bringing the polleras from the city of Desaguadero (an area bordering Bolivia,) because it is a long and tiring journey. Over time, she hopes to have a bigger store where she can sell her garments in greater comfort. This is her 6th loan with MFP. She is very pleased to have this credit opportunity, and she is prepared to make her payments on time. In her communal bank she has been well-received by the other members, which makes her feel very happy. With the 1,000 Peruvian soles requested, she will buy more skirts to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy more traditional Peruvian skirts)

loans.name: Roberto Adán

texts.es:
El Señor Roberto S. es un agricultor de la zona del municipio de el Viejo y se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas desde  hace 15 años, siendo esta atividad la que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 4 hijos.
 
El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de 3 mamanas de sandia y 2 de melones. Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para continuar con su actividad agrícola.
texts.en:
Roberto S. is a farmer in the area of the El Viejo municipality. He has devoted himself to planting vegetables for the last 15 years. It is this activity that allows him to support his family, which is comprised of his wife and four children. The loan he is requesting is to buy farming supplies to plant three fields of watermelon and two of cantaloupes. That is the reason he is asking for a loan, to continue his farming activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married with a son. He is a small businessman from Beregovo where he sells electric appliances. Yuryi runs his business in a small vending store which he also uses as his office. He started this venture 6 years ago. Presently, Yuryi has 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Yuryi is seeking a 7,000 Grivnya loan to purchase additional electric appliances for future sale in his store. He is hoping to generate additional income as a result. Yuryi is very knowledgeable in financing, management and branding. All these skills help him run his business efficiently and further expand his trade.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise
